When we spend so much money on our skincare regime, there‚Äôs nothing more heartbreaking than feeling like our skin isn‚Äôt bringing the A-game. But the reason why your skin isn‚Äôt slaying could simply be because you‚Äôre applying your creams in the wrong order. We know it seems crazy militant, but if you don‚Äôt apply your lotions and potions in a specific order, you‚Äôre seriously disenabling them from doing their job. The most important thing is to ensure your skin is completely clean before you apply any hydrating lotions or oils. The general rule is to apply the most lightweight formulas first so they can be easily absorbed without the barrier of heavier creams. After each layer, give your skin time to absorb the product (at least a few minutes), this will also mean when you‚Äôre layering your products they won‚Äôt pill ‚Äì those tiny little balls you get when you‚Äôve used too much product. Here‚Äôs how to layer products like a pro: 1) Cleanser: Cleansing should remove any makeup or dirt from your skin while also adding a burst of hydration, and if you wear makeup, you should definitely be double cleansing. To double cleanse, start with a cleansing oil (the most nourishing way to remove any makeup as they‚Äôre free from harsh chemicals, soaps, and parabens), then use a foam or gel cleanser (or whichever best suits your skin type ). It sounds extra, but it will make sure there‚Äôs absolutely no makeup or dirt on your skin before you continue the rest of your regime. 2) Toner: Toning is super important as it removes any grime that your cleanser wouldn‚Äôt budge, and any minerals or chlorines from your water. It will also instantly tighten your pores and help restore your skin‚Äôs pH levels for a more even skin tone. For more guidance on choosing the right toner for your skin type, check out our toner guide here . 3) Spot Treatment: If you‚Äôre prone to pimples, apply your cream now so it can absorb properly and start working its magic. 4) Serum: Serums are lightweight and contain a high concentration of active ingredient. The formula is made up of smaller molecules that are absorbed into the skin at a much deeper level. This makes serums ideal if you‚Äôre trying to target a specific skincare issue, like wrinkles or dry skin, as many are packed with hydrating ingredients as well. Like essences, which are basically a more watery version of serums, you only need a small amount ‚Äì about the size of 2 pomegranate seeds! 5) Eye cream: Eye creams can brighten under eyes, reduce any inflammation, and add an extra hit of moisture. Depending on the formula it may look like a serum or a thick moisturizer, but now is the time to apply it. This way it has fewer barriers to get through and can be absorbed more easily! Always apply your eye cream with your fourth finger in a tapping motion, as this is the weakest finger so you won‚Äôt tug or pull the delicate skin. We also love to keep our eye cream in the fridge; it‚Äôs the ultimate eye wake-up call in the mornings! 6) Moisturizer: Hydrated skin is glowing skin, so NEVER skip your moisturizer. The right moisturizer will hydrate, replenish, restore your skin‚Äôs pH levels, and nourish and repair any issues like dry, flaky skin. But it‚Äôs also essential that you choose one with the right formula and ingredient list for your skin type. Like if you have dry skin, you need a really rich formula, but if you have acne-prone or oily skin, a gel formula will be your best friend. For our top tips on how to choose the right one, read our moisturizer guide . How much product you should actually be using: 7) Face Oil: Without a doubt one of the most powerful potions on your shelf, the small molecular structure of face oils allows them to penetrate deeper into your skin and hydrate at a much deeper level. They also repair and plump your skin, and feed it with amazing natural vitamins. If you‚Äôre on the oily skin list, we recommend only using your face oil at night. For our guide on how to pick the right oil, click here . We like The Ordinary‚Äôs Granactive Retinoid 5% in Squalane ‚Äì it combines an amazing natural oil (squalane) and a form of retinol, which is the ultimate anti-aging ingredient. 8) SPF: For daytime, this is THE most important step, even during the winter months. Applying a good sunscreen every morning will protect your skin from damaging UVA and UVB rays. An SPF will sit on the surface of your skin acting as a protective barrier against the sun, so you should always apply it last; otherwise, it could stop your other products from penetrating. From this point on you‚Äôre officially ready to start applying your makeup, although if you stick to this routine, your skin probably becomes so flawless, you‚Äôll be brave enough to go au-naturel in no time! skincare regime skincare rules skincare tips Tue, 27 Feb 2018 5 Comments Related Posts Where You‚Äôre Going Wrong With Your Moisturizer And‚Ä¶ Tue, 10 Oct 2017 How Your Cleanser Could Be Ruining Your Skin, And‚Ä¶ Sun, 27 Aug 2017 This Is The RIGHT Way To Cleanse For Model Skin Sun, 24 Dec 2017 Rizwana Shehbaz Plz show me pics of best cleanser, toner and moisturizer for oly combination acne porne skin Plz plz plz Hadia Khurram Love the size reference! Shirley Sawyer I do a thin layer of moisturiser then pat in oil. Then i add a tiny bit more moisturiser and massage that in. Lauren McGrath What spf do you recommend? Huda Beauty Yes üôÇ
Beauty 101: How To Layer Your Skincare

As much as we love a burger, we know it‚Äôs not going to help us get that glossy skin and beautiful mane we lust after. Sure, now and again it‚Äôs no harm, but no matter how much money you spend on miracle products, if you‚Äôre not taking care of what you put into your body, your newest potion is never going to reach its full potential. These five superfoods, however, will make you feel beautiful from the inside out and we swear in just a week, we‚Äôve been able to notice a difference in our hair and our skin. Plus, by eating healthily you‚Äôll have more than just extra energy and great hair, your concentration and mood will improve too. These five ingredients are so good you‚Äôll want to bathe in them ‚Äì and btw, we have the recipes so that you can: Chia Seeds ‚Äì The Glow-Getter Don‚Äôt be fooled by their size, these tiny seeds are literally full of beauty-boosting minerals and antioxidants. They‚Äôre super high in Omega 3, so they‚Äôll give you the ultimate glow while reducing any inflammation or dryness. The amazing seeds also increase your blood circulation, thereby giving you more even skin. You can sprinkle the seeds on pretty much anything, from your yogurts and smoothies to your salads. We love mixing them with almond milk and honey for a delicious breakfast snack with fruit. Chia Seed and Lavender Face Mask DIY: Our favorite Chia Seed DIY will gently exfoliate your skin leaving you feeling baby soft with a J Lo glow. Mix 2 teaspoons of Chia Seeds with 4 tablespoons of water, then add 2 drops of lavender oil. Massage it onto your face and leave the mix on your skin for 10 minutes, then just wash away with warm water. Medjool Dates ‚Äì Acne Banisher, Youth Booster In Dubai, Medjool Dates are literally everywhere ‚Äì we‚Äôre obsessed! But, not just because they‚Äôre mega tasty, they‚Äôre also a rich source of fiber, which will support your metabolism and help you debloat. In the Middle East, we like to use them to break our fast during Ramadan, as they‚Äôre great energy boosters ‚Äì making them an ideal snack (just stick to a few though as they‚Äôre high in sugar). Medjool Dates are also a great source of copper, which helps your body absorb more iron allowing your skin to produce more collagen. Dates can even help reduce redness and will work as an anti-inflammatory, so if you‚Äôre acne-prone, ditch the crisps and grab a date! Medjool Date and Honey Mask DIY: De-pit 3 to 4 dates and blend with 1 to 2 teaspoons of honey (both rich in vitamin B) to formulate a thick paste. Spread this mix on your face and leave for 10 minutes before washing away with water. Your face will feel SO smooth. Avocado ‚Äì The Hair Helper Avocados aren‚Äôt just for your breakfast Insta snap, they‚Äôre a beauty miracle ingredient too! Avocados are full of fatty acids and proteins, and whether you use them on your hair as a mask or you just eat them on toast, they‚Äôll give your locks killer shine ‚Äì Adriana Lima swears by it. The vitamin B and E content will also strengthen your hair follicles and help the strands remain strong and healthy, preventing split ends from forming. Avocado and Coconut Hair Mask For the ultimate hair mask, mash one ripe avocado (if you have shorter hair you can use half and eat the other), and mix it with one egg yolk and two tablespoons of coconut oil. Massage it into your hair (from root to tip) and then wash it off 20 minutes later. Just make sure you shampoo your hair thoroughly or you could get a little oily at the roots. Lemons ‚Äì The Detox Queen Whenever you ask a model how they start their day, we swear the answer will be with a cup of hot water and lemon. Lemon is an incredible detoxifier and cleans your digestive system so that your liver can eliminate waste more efficiently. It also boosts your lymphatic drainage, which will help get rid of any puffiness around your eyes and toxins from your body. And the best thing about a detox drink is that it can seriously help clear up your skin, so say hello to that glow! Lemon, Honey, and Green Tea Face Mask This face mask will revitalize your skin and cleanse your pores, leaving your skin super radiant. Mix the juice of half a lemon with 1 teaspoon of honey and the contents of one green tea bag (brew the tea first, and then take the leaves from the tea bag). Apply it your face and wash it off 15 minutes later with warm water. Figs ‚Äì The Beauty All-rounder Figs don‚Äôt get the hype they deserve but we love them! Just like lemons, they‚Äôre an incredible detoxifier as the seeds inside the fruit will help cleanse the digestive tract of mucus and toxins. This is so important as when it‚Äôs blocked, it prevents essential nutrients getting into your skin. It‚Äôs also full of antioxidants that help fight free radicals, which cause fine lines and wrinkles to form. A great source of vitamins C and B6, figs can help even out your skin tone and regulate hormone activity, combatting breakouts. We love to snack on them throughout the day, but make sure you limit your intake to just a couple as they‚Äôre high in sugar. Fig and Oatmeal Mask For an amazing exfoliator, we like to blend 5 figs with a teaspoon of powdered oatmeal and a teaspoon of milk. Once a smooth paste is formed, massage it into your skin, leave it for 15 minutes and wash it off with warm water and a soft washcloth. The struggle is real when it comes to finding your perfect foundation bae! Not only are you trying to find your unique shade, the ideal coverage for your complexion, a formula that won‚Äôt break you out, but one that will last you through every moment of your hectic day without looking cakey ‚Äì mission impossible? Oh, and add to that you also don‚Äôt want to spend a fortune, because let‚Äôs be real, we have an arm‚Äôs length list of beauty products we also need to shop for! This is especially important because with every new season, my skincare and foundation routine changes to adapt to whatever the climate throws at me. During the summer months, I prefer to wear a lightweight foundation formula, and my long-term FAV has to be Maybelline‚Äôs Fit Me Foundation ‚Äì it costs $8, or less depending on the store. Maybelline has just expanded the range with a new matte formula to suit more skin tones, and it‚Äôs perfect for controlling oily skin, especially during the summer months. I absolutely LOVE the original Dewy and Smooth formula for summer (I use shade 220). It‚Äôs one of those foundations I reach for when I‚Äôm having a ‚Äògood skin day‚Äô because it gives THE most gorgeous natural finish. If you love a no makeup-makeup look, then you‚Äôll adore this. It can easily be built for concentrated coverage, and it has a glowy, dewy finish. Because it‚Äôs summer (or if you have oily skin), I recommend setting this with a dusting of translucent powder. My tip is to use a damp beautyblender to gently bounce loose powder onto your skin; it gives seamless coverage that isn‚Äôt heavy or cakey ‚Äì just tap off the extra powder before application, as makeup sponges pick up a ton of product. (And make sure your beauty blender is clean! See why here) . Finally, the only issue with the Dewy and Smooth range is they only offer 16 shades, and only two of those are tailored for deeper skin tones. The newest addition, Matte and Poreless , is a much more full-coverage foundation, which is great for immediate coverage that can be effortlessly applied. This is also a good option if you have oily skin or acne, as it‚Äôs an oil-free formula which has micro-powders that absorb oil and help to blur pores. Body acne affects loads of us, I‚Äôve experienced it myself and it‚Äôs super frustrating ‚Äì unlike when you have a pimple on your face, putting a little concealer on your back isn‚Äôt as easy. I often get pimples on my shoulders, and I‚Äôve found a product that makes targeting and banishing the annoying spots so easy. But don‚Äôt get body acne confused with those annoying tiny bumps on your arms, that‚Äôs called keratosis pilaris, and it needs to be treated very differently ‚Äì check out our blog post on how you can control that here . If you‚Äôre here for acne, I swear by the Murad Clarifying Body Spray ‚Äì it made a huge difference to my problem areas in a week! What it is: An acne treatment in a spray bottle specifically designed for your body, which diminishes the ongoing acne cycle. What it does: The formula uses salicylic acid to penetrate and clean deep into pores, speeding up the disappearing process and preventing new acne from forming. It contains niacinamide to minimize oil production, and blue lotus flower to purify pores. Finally, menthol cools the skin and reduces irritation to soothe your skin. Why we love it: The Murad Clarifying Body Spray is amazing for getting rid of buttne , bacne, chestne or anywhere else you‚Äôre getting annoying pimples on your body. I use this after the shower to prevent breakouts, or if I have a breakout, I‚Äôll use this twice a day. It‚Äôs really convenient and super easy to use; because it‚Äôs in a spray bottle, it means you can target areas on your back that you might not be able to reach yourself with a cream or body wash, (you can even spray it upside down to get your buttne). It also means you don‚Äôt need to worry about washing your hands after you‚Äôve applied it, so this is great if you‚Äôre on the go, traveling or just in a hurry. Make sure you avoid using it on your face, where your skin is more sensitive. My top tips: If you‚Äôre suffering with body acne in the long term, I also really recommend using the Bioderma Atoderm Shower Gel , which is less pricey and really great for your skin and body acne. Even though the Murad Clarifying Spray is quite expensive, it lasts a really long time, and because it works so well, you‚Äôll use it less and less. Also make sure if you exercise regularly to try and wear ‚Äòsweat-wicking‚Äô fabrics that move the moisture away from your skin, and shower as quickly as possible afterward. It‚Äôs easy to let yourself go a little in the off-season when you‚Äôre not spending every weekend at the beach looking fresh in your skimpy bathing suits and golden tan (which very well may be faux and we‚Äôre totes supportive of that). But, whether you‚Äôre gearing up to jet somewhere warm for a winter vacation (lucky!) or just trying to keep up with all the beauty maintenance that can seem like a full-time job, a smooth and groomed bikini line is big must in our book. Since everyone has her own preference for hair removal techniques ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs shaving, waxing, laser, or hair removal creams ‚Äì we tapped dermatologist Dr. Cindy Yoon-Soo Bae of the Laser Skin Surgery Center in New York for some tips on staying bikini-ready all year round. Shaving Not ready to invest a ton of time (or money) on your hooha? We got you. If you‚Äôre all about that shave, Dr. Bae recommends using a single-blade razor ‚Äì and replacing it frequently ‚Äì then when you‚Äôre about 5-10 minutes into your shower, using good skincare products to help the blade glide (we‚Äôre still a big fan of this Lush Shaving Soap , FYI). ‚ÄúThis will ensure your hair and skin is sufficiently softened for an easier shave. And remember that when you‚Äôre shaving, you‚Äôre also exfoliating the skin in the area, so if you have a spray tan it will cause streaking,‚Äù says Dr. Bae. Waxing While it can be painful (no pain, no gain!), waxing is a good option that keeps you feeling smooth for a bit longer than a shave, and it‚Äôs not a huge splurge ‚Äì typically a bikini wax starts at around $30, depending on where you go. Of course, if you‚Äôre brave enough you can DIY it ‚Äì we like the Veet wax strips for their effectiveness and drugstore price. The reason it lasts longer is because rather than shaving, where you‚Äôre merely cutting off the hair at the skin‚Äôs surface, waxing is pulling the hair from the root where growth starts. In order to grab the hair, it‚Äôs best to wait until your grow-out is about ¬º an inch so the wax can really adhere to the hairs. And be careful about making an appointment around your time of the month, since your skin (along with your mood) is generally more sensitive then. Laser Laser hair removal is definitely an investment (it can set you back upwards of $200 per appointment and at least six sessions are recommended to see results), but if you‚Äôre really looking to get to the root of the problem ‚Äì literally ‚Äì it can be a cost-effective way to permanently preen your bikini area once and for all. The laser, in essence, penetrates skin to kill the hair follicle, leaving hair to gradually fall out from the treated area within weeks. If you‚Äôre thinking about trying laser hair removal around your bikini area, it‚Äôs important to prep for your appointment by shaving beforehand and not waxing. ‚ÄúThe way that the laser works is that it needs to find a focus point ‚Äì the hair follicles need to be in place for the laser to target and therefore be effective,‚Äù says Dr. Bae. And because the laser also targets pigment in skin, spray and sun tans should be avoided prior to your appointment. Laser works best on dark hairs, which can absorb the heat from the laser more effectively, and even better on dark hairs and fairer skin. Hair Removal Creams Though not as popular (partially due to the strong odor a lot of them have), hair removal creams are a quick, painless, and affordable way to de-fuzz fast. Similar to shaving, this method merely removes hair from the skin‚Äôs surface, but rather than using a blade, hair removal creams use chemicals to break down the hair follicle so that hair can be wiped away. Be sure to use a formula that is specific for the body part you are targeting, and do a patch test if you have sensitive skin to prevent a reaction. We recommend hair removal creams more for your legs and armpits than your sensitive bikini line. How to deal with ingrown hairs: No matter what method of hair removal you choose, ingrown hairs are bound to pop up along the way. Dr. Bae advises that you ‚Äúdon‚Äôt pick at an ingrown hair as there is a risk that it can lead to scarring. You can try warm compresses, gentle exfoliation, or even topical acne medicine like your salicylic acid spot treatment to try to clear it up fast.‚Äù If the irritation is less concentrated to a single spot and you‚Äôre concerned it could be a rash or reaction Dr. Bae suggests ‚Äúyou should see a physician or dermatologist for a proper diagnosis and treatment since it could be anything from folliculitis (infected hair follicles) to something more serious if you‚Äôve been using razors that have been sitting around.‚Äù Otherwise, an over-the-counter topical steroid can be used for a limited time and applying witch hazel (like Dickinson‚Äôs Witch Hazel ), can help with the redness due to its astringent properties. What are your favorite hair removal hacks? One scent that gives us serious holiday feels is the smell of nutmeg ‚Äì it literally takes us into a winter wonderland whenever we get a hit ‚Äì the Eggnog, the candles, you know what we mean! But, you shouldn‚Äôt limit your intake of nutmeg to the holiday period, it actually has some major health benefits. The best thing is you probably have it in your kitchen, and if you don‚Äôt, you can get it for less than $5! Naturally harvested from evergreen trees, this festive spice is bursting with goodness that will nourish, repair, and boost pretty much everything; from clearing your skin to fixing bad breath. Here‚Äôs how: For your skin : The next time you have a breakout, don‚Äôt grab the toothpaste ( find out why) instead get some nutmeg powder and make a mask. Not only does it have anti-inflammatory and antibacterial properties that will help reduce redness and swelling, but the grainy texture of the powder will also work as a gentle exfoliator. For mature skin: Nutmeg is a great anti-aging ingredient as it contains antioxidants that help fight off free radicals , which cause premature aging. These stimulating properties will also activate your dead skin cells and boost renewal and growth, reducing fine lines and wrinkles. For hair: Nutmeg oil can do absolute wonders for your hair health, it‚Äôll promote hair growth and add a killer shine. It‚Äôll also tone your hair and increase blood circulation getting rid of any flaky skin. You can add one or two drops to your conditioner and rinse as usual. For oral hygiene: Look for herbal toothpaste that contains nutmeg. Due to the many antibacterial components, it‚Äôll combat bad breath by killing bacteria in your mouth. This‚Äôll help build up your mouth‚Äôs immunity to bacteria so you can say goodbye to bad breath in the long run. For weight loss: Even when a whole nutmeg has been ground into a powder, it still retains its crazy high fiber content, which will instantly boost your bowel movement ‚Äì nasty we know, but also seriously helpful for weight loss. Plus, it‚Äôll naturally ease digestion by stimulating gastric juices that break down food. You can add a little nutmeg powder into your breakfast meal: sprinkle it on top of pancakes, oats, or cereals, or add a pinch to your smoothie. Acne Miracle Mask DIY Not only will the nutmeg work wonders, but combined with honey to heal, and milk to gently exfoliate your skin, this mask is ahhhhmazing for acne. Mix 2 tablespoons of honey, with one teaspoon of nutmeg, and one tablespoon of milk in a bowl. Stir until the mixture is well combined and then apply to your skin with a synthetic makeup brush and work outwards. Let the mask sit for 10-15 minutes before rinsing. Studies have shown, unlike any other nut, walnuts have a significant amount of alpha-linolenic acid, omega-3 fatty acids and vitamin E that all contribute to beautiful skin and hair. This is why many articles on hair loss have recommended eating walnuts to reverse the process‚Äìby maintaining healthy hair, preventing hair from falling and actually increasing hair growth. A good setting powder is one of the most important steps in ensuring your makeup looks great all day. You can use amazing foundations and the best primers, but ultimately without the right setting powder, your look just isn‚Äôt going to last. A setting powder is crucial to keeping your makeup locked in and matte, and the best powders will even blur imperfections and color correct problem areas. So, as you‚Äôre always asking us which is the best setting powder to use, we compared the top 5 industry favs so you can find the best setting powder for your skin type, tone, and budget. We analyzed Ben Nye‚Äôs iconic Banana Powder, Industry fav the Laura Mercier Translucent Setting Powder, Kat Von D‚Äôs Lock-It Brightening Powders, the Tarte Rain Forest Of The Sea Filtered Light Setting Powder, and the illustrious Givenchy Prisme Libre Loose Powder. Here‚Äôs our verdict‚Ä¶ Ben Nye is an excellent all-round setting powder, it‚Äôs affordable and gives great results for all skin tones. Laura Mercier is another powder that will work for almost anyone, plus it‚Äôs really reasonably priced. Kat Von D takes the crown for best for oily-skin, while Givenchy is our go-to for dry and normal skin types, although it is a little pricey. Tarte is a great daytime powder that will keep you matte all day and perfect your skin. See the full deets on each powder below. Ben Nye Banana Powder This powder became super famous because tons of Hollywood celebs used this to keep their under eyes baked to perfection all day. It was the first time a powder used a color like yellow, and as much as it was pigmented and beautifully brightening, the formula itself was amazing: It was professional makeup that catered to everyone, which is why is stuck around! Not only does it look great in photos, the yellow tinge balances out blue under-eye circles, while it also sets your under-eye area for a crease-free finish all day. The formula became famous for the yellow powder, but ultimately this works best for light/medium to golden skin tones, as it corrects surface redness and pink undertones. The good news is that they now have six color-correcting shades so that everyone can take advantage of the incredible formula. Available: CameraReadyCosmetics.com Price: $16.50 Laura Mercier Translucent Setting Powder We LOVE this super natural-looking powder, and Laura Mercier did such a good job creating a simple-to-use powder that works for everyone. It‚Äôs kind of iconic in the beauty industry, it‚Äôs like the powder that made translucent setting powder a thing because almost everyone uses it, and it‚Äôs available almost everywhere. The powder has two shades, a translucent shade for fair-to-tan complexions and a deep translucent shade that works for darker skin tones. We also love that you can get it in small sizes too, which is great for when you‚Äôre traveling or just want to test it out without investing ‚Äì that said, it‚Äôs actually the second-best value for money in our powder-off, after Ben Nye. Available: Sephora.com Price: $38 Kat Von D Lock-It Brightening Powder This powder is actually designed to be used under the eye for baking and brightening the eye area, but it honestly works incredibly all over, especially if you have oily skin! Kat Von D has done such a great job with the three shades, and there‚Äôs definitely one for every skin tone, but I wish they had an even bigger selection. The three shades are Petal, a pale pink that works to brighten fair complexions, Peach, for medium skin tones, and Golden, to brighten tan and deep complexions. The powder is really finely-milled, with the perfect amount of pigment and brightening particles that gives a matte look all day. Read my full review here . Available: Sephora.com Price: $25 Tarte Rain Forest Of The Sea ‚Äì Filtered Light Setting Powder This super unique formula is designed with tiny, light-reflecting particles that give an incredible airbrushed finish, as it blurs pores and smooths out fine lines. The shade is completely universal so it works for almost everyone, but it‚Äôs also made with antioxidant-rich algae that are actually meant to improve skin texture and reduce the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles. We love it when skincare and makeup meet! The powder is super fine, so you need to make sure you don‚Äôt get carried away with the application or you could end up looking cakey. But the biggest issue to note with this powder is the flashback ! Wear it for selfies with no flash, a day at work, or just generally anything that doesn‚Äôt involve flash and you will look flawless, but if you‚Äôre going to have a picture taken, this will leave you looking white and patchy. Read my full review here . Available: Sephora.com Price: $34 Givenchy Prisme Libre Loose Powder One of the absolute fav powders at HBHQ, this Givenchy powder is pretty incredible. It‚Äôs unique because each powder contains four pots of different color correcting loose powders that create one harmonious shade to brighten your skin and leave it looking smooth and luminous. There‚Äôre five different shades so there‚Äôs one to work with every skin tone, but they also offer differing effects, like a natural-finish, radiance, and glow. You can even custom use the powders, so if you have a golden skin tone, for example, you don‚Äôt need to open all the holes on one type of powder, like the beige tone, for example. The packaging is stunning and the powder is even more finely-milled than Ben Nye, it just gives your skin a gorgeous luminous, more polished look. Available: Sephora.com Price: $55 Huda‚Äôs Top Tips: Number 1: avoid the above! For using powders: Take a napkin and pour a small amount of powder on to it and then dab a damp makeup sponge into the powder. On another clean piece of tissue, dab off any excess powder. It makes using your powder extra easy and you can pour any leftover powder back into the pot. For controlling coverage: I always use a damp beauty blender to apply my powders, I feel like it gives a more flawless and natural finish. A big fluffy brush will give you a light dusting of powder, but more dense brushes will give you extra coverage. Okay, so anyone who has followed me over the years, attended my masterclass, and so much as asks me about skincare knows I am obsessed with the OroGold 24K Deep Peeling Mask ! Yes, I have written about it years ago, but it‚Äôs quite shocking to me , that after all this time, it is still my absolute go to before applying makeup! Why? Well because it is hands down my favorite SUPERFICIAL scrub! What that means is that it doesn‚Äôt go deep, but does remove the surface layer of dead skin (that sometimes emulates peach fuzz), allowing for super close makeup-to-skin contact that quick frankly just looks better! I had discovered it in complete skepticism walking through the mall, passing a concession stand. The woman squirted a large size gold-ish ‚Äúgunk‚Äù on my hands, as if I had actually wanted it there in the first place. Not gonna lie, it was one of the best things she could have done (for the both of us, since I purchased what was generously a life-time supply). Since then it has been my absolute staple in my makeup bag and my clients have loved it! Who should use it: I‚Äôve used this on all kinds of clients, from oily to dry and acne prone, as well as clients with skin disorders like Rosacea. I def always recommend consulting a doctor if you have any skin concerns. How to use it: Apply 2-3 squirts of the product to dry skin. Then lightly use circular motions until scrub starts to take effect. You will first feel a slightly gel like texture that will become watery, then the peeling begins. What I don‚Äôt like: Since it does seem to have skin softening properties, it‚Äôs really easy to get your dead skin stuck onto any hairs on your skin. I do recommend using a razor to shave away any peach fuzz for anyone daring enough (I do this all the time) to help avoid this issue. If you have longer facial hair and want to skip shaving you may find yourself picking & pulling pieces of dead skin out of your facial hair. It‚Äôs a powerful spice that has been used in many Chinese and Ayurvedic recipes for its beautifying and healing properties. Turmeric is an antiaging and antibacterial powerhouse. Mostly due to its curcumin, which gives it its distinct yellow color, it helps combat some of our biggest skincare woes: acne, aging, and dullness. If you‚Äôre reading this, you‚Äôre probably not one of those dedicated cross fitters that have the willpower to get up at 5 am and burn 500 calories before breakfast. Presuming we‚Äôre right and our title lured in our fellow lazy sisters, we‚Äôve got the easiest arm exercises that give maximum results. Obviously, we didn‚Äôt know where to begin, so we spoke to fitness guru and personal trainer, Jeremy Gwyer ‚Äì when he‚Äôs not writing for Men‚Äôs Health magazine he helps us get in shape with easy hacks . Naturally, the less effort, the better, so we asked Jeremy to give us his simplest and most efficient exercises to get rid of those saggy bits on our upper arms. The best bit is, you don‚Äôt need any techincial gear, you can do them on your couch, and you‚Äôll see results in as little as two weeks ‚Äì if you can be bothered to do them every day! 1. Soup Can Tricep Kickbacks Grab two tin cans, 500mg each should do the trick to start (or bottles of water!). Sitting on the edge of the couch, lean forward with a can in each hand. Then stretch the arms back behind your body keeping them at 90 degrees then slowly straighten your arms back behind your body into a straight position. Keep your elbows locked in position, while pulsing the arms forward and backward in small movements (keeping the cans behind your body at all times). Focus on squeezing your triceps as hard as possible. Do 15 of these three times! 2. Couch Dips Sit on the end of the couch with your hands holding the edges either side of you. Move your feet forwards to lift your bottom off the chair. Keep your knees hip-width apart and bent at 90 degrees. Lower yourself by bending your arms to about 90 degrees, keeping your elbows tucked in. Push back up and do three sets of 15. 3. Lying Soup Can Triceps Extensions Lying on your back on the couch, have your arms straight out in front of your body, holding a soup can in either hand. Lower the soup cans down to your shoulders keeping your elbows tucked in, pointing to the roof. Do 15 of these three times! 4. Easy Push-Ups Start in the push-up position on your knees. Place your hands underneath your shoulders with your arms fully extended, palms flat and fingers facing forward. Your body should form a rigid plank from head to your knees. Lower yourself by bending your elbows out to the sides until your chest is about 2 inches above the floor then push back up until your arms are straight. Do 15 of these three times! I‚ÄôM GAVE BIRTH 3 MONTHES AGO AND I‚ÄôM A BREAST FEEDING MOTHER, WHAT ARE UR RECOMMENDATIONS TO LOSS WEIGHT? alya Hi darling üôÇ If you are new to exercise, start out with gentle activities like walking, stretching, post-natal yoga classes, or swimming. Remember that for 3 to 5 months following pregnancy, your joints and ligaments are still looser than normal, meaning that you‚Äôre more prone to certain injuries. Since you‚Äôre breast feeding, your body needs about 500 extra calories a day to continue producing milk. Although exercising does not inhibit milk production, a lack of sufficient calories and nutrients can. Even though your goal is to shed that baby weight, be sure you‚Äôre eating enough calories to sustain your body, your increased activity and your baby. When doing cardio, aim to maintain an intensity that allows you to carry on a conversation but still raises your heart rate. Never exercise so intensely that you feel lightheaded, dizzy or weak. If you feel sharp pains, stop immediately. After pregnancy, many women‚Äôs abdominal muscles are still separated. If the width between your stomach muscles is 3 fingers or more, avoid doing intense abdominal exercises like sit ups and double leg lifts. You can measure the width by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feeling a few inches below your belly button to see if there is a separation in the abdominal wall. Wait until the gap has closed to two fingers or less before starting an ab routine. Lifting weights will give you a more toned look, boost your metabolism, and help burn fat. Lift weights at least two days per week, doing one to three sets of eight to 12 reps for each exercise. Check out this post I did on total body workout with exercise bands http://alyasfitclub.com/2011/12/06/total-body-workout/ Just take it slow, don‚Äôt try to lose too much too fast, if you eat properly and exercise the weight will come off. Sometimes you come across an ingredient and wonder, where has this been all my life? Well, that was us when we discovered jojoba oil . In its pure form, it‚Äôs like the fairy godmother of oils: it‚Äôs good for your skin and hair, can help to reduce wrinkles, improve acne, and can basically be used as an all-around beautifying serum. Although it‚Äôs technically a wax, it‚Äôs amazingly moisturizing, non-toxic, doesn‚Äôt block pores and is non-allergenic. It‚Äôs also full of minerals and vitamin E, and it‚Äôs an antioxidant which protects from free radicals ‚Äì it can literally do no wrong. Here are 5 awesome uses for jojoba oil: Acne and oily skin: First off, it penetrates the hair follicles where sebum builds up and acts as a deep cleanser to dissolve the sebum that causes blackheads. Because the waxy structure of jojoba oil is so similar to human sebum, it actually tricks acne-prone skin into believing it has produced enough, so that your skin produces less ‚Äì bye bye oily skin! Jojoba oil is also a potent anti-fungal agent and is full of antibacterial properties that kill acne-causing bacteria. Because it‚Äôs like a liquid wax, it also acts as a barrier against dirt while it‚Äôs anti-inflammatory properties further fight acne. Use 4-5 drops of jojoba oil before make-up or up to six at night ‚Äì six or more can make your skin look oily. Anti-aging: Jojoba oil is rich in antioxidants and contains vitamin B complex, which combined, delays the appearance of premature aging and soothes fine lines and wrinkles. Make-up removal: Like coconut oil, jojoba oil is an amazing natural make-up remover that easily flushes away dirt and make-up, as well as bacteria on your skin. Hair loss and healing: Let‚Äôs face it, we‚Äôd all love a bit more hair, and hair is more easily able to grow when moisture is restored, and the scalp is in a healthy state. Blocked hair follicles can be caused by excess sebum production or excess product build-up, a possible reason for hair loss. Jojoba oil works to unclog pores and treat any fungal bacteria. The oil also helps to promote new growth by stimulating scalp circulation, thereby encouraging new hair cells to develop. Gently warm one tablespoon of jojoba oil and rub it into your scalp 30 minutes before shampooing to improve hair health, get rid of dandruff, and detox your scalp. Use 1 or 2 drops on your hair after washing for extra shine and to control frizz. The ultimate moisturizer: It‚Äôs also an excellent healer for dry cuticles, hands, and feet. Soak your hands, feet or cuticles in warm water for 5 to 10 minutes. After, rub a drop of oil into cuticles, or use 5 to 6 drops for hands and feet to nourish dry skin. Applying one drop of jojoba oil to chapped lips will add instant relief, and the waxy substance will also further protect your skin from the elements. The vitamin E rich oil is also meant to calm sunburn, diminish the appearance of scars, and help heal wounds. *Image via www.stylecraze.com jojoba oil jojoba oil benefits Mon, 20 Feb 2017 2 Comments Related Posts 3 Super Easy DIY Hair Rescue Masks Mon, 13 Nov 2017 Why You Need To Add A Face Oil To Your Skincare Regime Sun, 12 Nov 2017 Why Not Understanding Your Skin Type Is Keeping You‚Ä¶ Wed, 29 Nov 2017 Jeanelle Lightfoot The article posted was very informative and useful. We‚Äôve all heard of the Brazilian Keratin Treatment and if you haven‚Äôt done it already, I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve at least been a bit curious as to what the hype is all about. I personally never thought I could benefit from this treatment as my hair is pin-straight and I was frightened to lose volume. But as a licensed cosmetologist (providing the service at a very reasonable price ), I had to at least try it out for myself. My verdict: Keratin is great for EVERYONE! Keratin is the main protective substance in our hair. Adding more keratin to our hair improves each strand inside and out. Keratin will not only make your hair shinier, healthier and stronger, but it also protects from environmental damage caused by the sun that cause hair color to fade. The great thing about the Brazilian Keratin Treatment is it‚Äôs just a reconditioning treatment ‚Äìshocking‚Äîa salon procedure that gives you beautiful, silky hair, without the damage! BEWARE: Most Keratin Treatments contain the carcinogen, formaldehyde. So, say no to brain tumors and consult your stylist to ensure they are using formaldehyde-free products. These formaldehyde-free products are significantly more costly to the stylist/salon. So, expect the formaldehyde-free Keratin Treatment to be a bit pricier than other salons that use products containing the cancer-causing chem. If any time to splurge on the higher end product, this is it. Expect silky locks for 3-5 months, depending on your products and how often you wash. Blow out time cut in half! Frizz-nonestistent. Without effort, tight curls will be naturally wavy. Waves will be naturally straight. Best place to get this treatment in Boston Area: contact Candice (+1774.930.8731) Not only will you get the formaldehyde-free treatment at $150, which is less than the standard $180, but you will also be on your way with all the tools to maintain your soft tresses at a discount price. Summer‚Äôs here, and although we‚Äôre relishing the chance to lounge around in the sunshine, the humidity and heat are really messing with our makeup ‚Äì not cool! If like me you enjoy the cake but don‚Äôt want to look cakey, then trust me, living in Dubai has taught me the fine art of melt-proof makeup. The secret is all in the setting, and no, I don‚Äôt mean just a setting spray, there‚Äôs a technique to it: Prep your base: Don‚Äôt overlook your skin care in the summer, exfoliation is so important. When you‚Äôre using a lot of powders, having a clean, smooth canvas is essential as powder particles can cling to any flaky patches and magnify dry skin. Moisturize: Many people think if there‚Äôs heat they‚Äôll sweat and become oily, this is true, but that doesn‚Äôt mean you should avoid moisturizer. Actually, when your skin gets dry, your sebaceous glands produce even more oil to compensate, so stick with an oil-free moisturizer that will balance your skin. I have dry to combination skin, and I use oils, even in the summer and the humidity of Dubai, but I just ensure that I set everything properly. Prime: Primers will definitely help to keep your face in place ‚Äì I like the Benefit Porefessional Primer and TooFaced‚Äôs Hangover Primer. And though I definitely think primers help to keep your makeup in place, setting your makeup properly is the key to keeping your look on lockdown. Set, set, and set again: This is the key to staying flawless no matter what the weather throws at you. First things first invest in a good powder: it‚Äôll save you time, stress, and money in touch ups. Laura Mercier‚Äôs Secret Brightening Powder or Translucent Loose Setting Powders are iconic for a reason, they just work, but Kat Von D‚Äôs Brightening Powders are my new obsession ( read my review )! I think baking in the summer is fundamental for a flawless last-all-day look, and my trick is to bake with different powders in different areas: it‚Äôs almost like I‚Äôm contouring and color correcting with translucent powders. I use a micro-fine peachy toned powder under my eyes (where makeup and concealers tend to crease) and on my T-zone ‚Äì the finer the powder, the less likely it is that it‚Äôll sit in creases and define wrinkles. Finally, I use a golden/yellow toned translucent powder all over, and a darker powder on my forehead and cheeks. ‚Ä¶Then use a setting spray: To top off all your setting, a setting spray will add the finishing touch to hold your makeup in place. My FAVs are Urban Decay‚Äôs All Nighter Long-Lasting Makeup Setting Spray and the Kat Von D Lock It Setting Spray. This setting method just ensures my makeup just doesn‚Äôt budge all day ‚Äì I‚Äôm talking 12 hours, completely flawless makeup. I even set my brows, so basically, anywhere that there‚Äôs gel or pigment, I dab with powder to set. You can also try the Jamsu makeup setting method , which will keep even the oiliest of skins at bay during seriously hot weather. long-lasting makeup makeup setting setting spray summer makeup Thu, 29 Jun 2017 7 Comments Related Posts This Is The BEST Powder You‚Äôll Use All Summer Wed, 21 Jun 2017 The BEST (And Cheapest) Drugstore Setting Powder‚Ä¶ Tue, 2 Jan 2018 Powder-Off: We Compared The Most Iconic Setting Powders Wed, 25 Oct 2017 Johanna Thank you Huda for all your tips and tricks I will put them on practice. The inspiration behind some of my FAV looks, and of course, how to recreate them. Check out these three super easy looks I created to showcase the versatility and playfulness of our Desert Dusk palette. Violet Vixen This look perfectly reflects the hazy purple sky of the desert at dusk, and I‚Äôm in love with these violet shades for fall. The rich Amethyst matte, combined with the shimmering pearls and duo-chrome topper creates a light shifting effect that makes this look so unique. Recreate the look: Use Amethyst all over the lid as a base and blend up into the crease. Intensify the crease using Oud and smoke it out in the inner and outer corners. Lightly blend Royal into the lid and then dab Twilight all over with your finger to maximize shine. Cosmo Queen I‚Äôm obsessed with the shade Eden, it was one of the first colors that I created, and it makes the perfect base for so many looks, as well as looking gorgeous just by itself. This amber toned look is sultry and powerful and has such a sophisticated tone to it, while the glitter shade Cosmo gives it a vibrant finish. Recreate the look: Use Eden as a canvas all over your lid all the way to meet the brow. Use Amber in the crease, winging it out towards the outer edge of the eye. Pat Celestial all over the eye with your finger for maximum shine, and use a brush to blend the outer edges. Add drama with Cosmo, using a stiff eyeliner brush, dip it gently into the pure, ready-to-wear glitter formula and dab across your lash line. Scarlet Siren This is like the ultimate boss look! The vibrant siennas and scarlets are intensified by the sand-toned base and rich mahogany liner and combine to create a really powerful, seductive statement eye that is perfect for night‚Äôs out and events. Recreate the look: Prep the whole lid up to the brow with Desert Sand, then mix Blazing and Amber for the crease and smoke out into a wing shape. Intensify the lid with a layer of shimmering Saffron and pack along the lower lash line. Dab a thin eyeliner brush into Oud and apply it as an eyeliner along your upper lash line, finishing with a subtle wing. I also created a super dreamy peach and purple look that‚Äôs perfect for daytime, check it out here . I hope you love these looks and we can‚Äôt wait to see what you all create! It‚Äôs rare I find a beauty product that‚Äôs completely irreplaceable, but the Power Peel Transforming Facial System by Ole Henriksen has remained a staple member of my beauty routine for forever. I‚Äôve been using this 3-step process facial for 15 years, and it‚Äôs literally THE BEST way to remove all kinds of dead skin. The genius step-by-step process was actually created after one of their celebrity clients begged for an on-the-go version of their famous facial service. The result is an insanely good exfoliating polish, peel, and clay mask that leaves your skin feeling like velvet. What it is: A professional facial with a 3-step microdermabrasion and AHA peel for the ultimate at-home complexion transformation. It banishes dull and uneven skin tone and works wonders on all skin types. What it does: The first step is an exfoliating Almond Polish Facial Scrub, which uses bamboo extracts and oat kernel flour to buff away dead skin cells. Step two is the Instant Transformation Lemon Facial Peel: it uses alpha hydroxy acids, (which occur naturally in fruits and break down the outer layers of skin to reveal new, healthy cells) and glycolic and lactic acids to smooth skin and reduce the appearance of fine lines, wrinkles, and discoloration. Lastly, the soothing Chamomile Comfort Mask calms your skin with evening primrose seed extracts. What we liked: I LOVE everything about this facial, and so does my skin! The almond scrub is invigorating, and you can really feel it making a difference, plus it smells so good I could eat it! I rub it everywhere for a good 2 minutes and then wash it off with a bamboo cloth ‚Äì the kit also comes with really great sponges for this purpose. The lemon peel is one of THE most amazing things I have ever used: it gives you crazy radiance and boosts your skin‚Äôs hydration. Although, it can sting when you use it, especially in the areas where you‚Äôve scrubbed vigorously with the Almond Polish ‚Äì but hey, the stinging lets you know the peel‚Äôs working, right? Oh, and definitely don‚Äôt leave it on for longer than the 2 minutes it says, trust me on that! When you apply the chamomile mask on top, your skin is immediately soothed, and you can sit back and relax for 15 minutes. Then rinse it away, and you‚Äôre completely selfie-ready. What we didn‚Äôt like: Literally NOTHING! Even the price is incredibly fair. You get six facials in a box, but I actually only use half, and usually split one with Alya or Mona, so technically you get 12. It works out at a fraction of the price of a salon facial, and you can do it from home too. I‚Äôve always had super sensitive skin, but this just works ahhhmazingly. It doesn‚Äôt break you out; it just leaves your skin in flawless condition with everything buffed to perfection. I recommend this to everyone! Though us oily skinned girls may strive for the dewy look that all top models seem to rock so effortlessly, it‚Äôs usually a look we can only pin down for about an hour‚Ä¶ and then it‚Äôs oil alert time, and we look like we‚Äôve just come back from a session of Bikram yoga. We love the summer, but it‚Äôs not our best friend ‚Äì the heat does things to our skin that messes with our cake face, so come lunch time, we‚Äôre a hot shiny mess. Well, fear the oil slick no longer, here are nine ways to keep your skin under control this summer: Don‚Äôt Over Cleanse The more oil we see, the more we feel like we need to wash our face. Unfortunately, washing your face doesn‚Äôt mean you will wash away oil ‚Äì if only it were that easy! The thing is your face has natural oils, and when they get stripped away by harsh chemicals in face washes, your skin goes into overdrive and produces more. Look for face washes without parabens, sulfates, oils, and perfumes and try to find a gel formula, that only foams a little ‚Äì this will be more gentle on your skin. And it‚Äôs not just about using the right face wash either, don‚Äôt overwash your skin: twice a day is more than enough, but the most important time to wash your face is after makeup ‚Äì a makeup wipe just won‚Äôt cut it. Moisturize! I know, I know, it goes against all your instincts, but our resident Skincare Queen and award-winning dermatologist, Dr. Doris Day swears moisturizing is essential, even if you have oil-prone skin. Dr. Day explained dry skin sends your sebaceous glands into overdrive, and they end up producing even more oil to compensate for the lack of moisture. So actually, keeping your skin hydrated in the summer will help to combat excess oil production. Try an oil-free moisturizer, which will hydrate without adding oil, and always leave about ten minutes for it to soak into your skin before you apply primer or foundation. Put Down the Ice Cream It‚Äôs summer, you‚Äôre hot, and you want an ice cream, but the truth is dairy can cause a major unbalance in your hormones‚Ä¶ and we all know what hormones can do! Dairy milk is full of hormones, and when you consume it, it causes all your other hormones to rise, including your testosterone and progesterone levels, which are the main causes of excess oil and sebum production. Switch to almond milk in your coffee and try an iced tea to keep you cool instead‚Ä¶ OKAY, okay, maybe one ice cream is allowed! Try Milk of Magnesia If anything can keep your oil at bay, it‚Äôs Milk of Magnesia. It‚Äôs not actually milk; it‚Äôs a laxative. It works by absorbing surface oil on your skin, making it an incredible primer. MUA Hrush Achemyan uses this on her celeb clientele to create a barrier between the skin and makeup to stop foundation seeping into pores under hot camera lights. To use, apply moisturizer and then with a cotton pad, blot the Milk of Magnesia onto your skin or oil-prone areas like your T-zone and gently rub it in (use sparingly). Leave it for a few minutes to ‚Äòset‚Äô and then apply your foundation as usual. Although this is king for oil control, don‚Äôt use it too often: It‚Äôs not directly harmful to your skin, but its PH levels are much lower than your skin‚Äôs PH. If you use it too frequently, it could cause breakouts or dryness ‚Äì save it for a special occasion or day in the sun. Use a Mattifying Primer Use a mattifying primer to avoid the dreaded mid-day foundation cake. The oil-free, Hourglass Veil Mineral Primer, $54 , is universally appreciated for its magical anti-oil formula, which contains powerful absorbents, a mineral-based sunscreen, and a silicone base. It makes your skin incredibly smooth, poreless and silky and it‚Äôll keep your makeup set in place all day, all while warding away any hint of oil. Look out for primers with silica in them, as this plays a major role in diminishing shine. Too Faced‚Äôs Primed & Poreless skin smoothing face primer is also an amazing primer that will do more than just control your T-zone. Curb Your Weekend Antics We‚Äôre sorry to be the ones to tell you, but if a boozy weekend with your gal pals is on the cards, your oil glands won‚Äôt thank you for it. Drinking too much alcohol causes your body‚Äôs heat index to rise, increasing your temperature and the amount you sweat, this can lead to clogged pores, excess oil, and eventually breakouts too. So go have fun, but not too much fun! Blot Oil Away With Blotting Paper If you‚Äôre not yet aware of this trick, blotting paper will become your best friend through the day. Plus, in the midst of summer, we‚Äôre all prone to a little extra oil on our T-zone, so mini blotting paper sheets are the easiest thing to carry around in your purse to keep your skin shine-free through the day. There are a ton of options: Clean & Clear do a pack of 50 mini Oil Absorbing Sheets for just $5, while Tarte‚Äôs green tea-infused Not So Slick Oil Absorbing Blotting papers , $10 for 50 sheets, offer soothing relief for your skin as well as mopping up oil. You can also find blotting papers that have a thin layer of powder on them, which mattify your skin too. If none of those are to hand, a tissue will do! Bake Like You‚Äôve Never Baked Before‚Ä¶ For special occasions, there‚Äôs no doubt that Jamsu will put your oil back in its place. It‚Äôs a Korean beauty hack that involves an all-over face-baking technique. After using a ton of powder, you submerge your face in water. The result is a completely matte finish that lasts all day. Watch me try this crazy water-setting technique here ‚Äì it really works! Try a Clay Mask A clay mask at least once a week is an amazing way to draw out excess oil, calm and soothe your skin. I‚Äôve been a long time fan of the GLAMGLOW Supermud Clearing Treatment , it leaves my skin super smooth, and the mud formula works to balance your skin‚Äôs PH while activated charcoal draws out dirt and impurities that block pores. When it comes to keeping your oily skin at bay, the main thing to remember is not to rush to drastic measures. Take small steps to cut back on naughty foods, balance your diet, and find products that will help your skin. Try to adopt a few of these tricks and you‚Äôll be sure to notice a difference. If there was something super easy you could do to give your brain extra power and function, and help you drop a few extra pounds, you‚Äôd probably want to try it, right? That‚Äôs what I thought, so when I heard about Bulletproof Coffee, I had to try it. In case you didn‚Äôt know, I‚Äôm actually a bit of a nerd, I love reading (I try to read a book a week). Earlier this year I picked up a New York Times Bestseller called The Bulletproof Diet, a book about wellness, enhancing brain power, and becoming healthier both physically and mentally: It was fascinating ‚Äì it‚Äôs like a whole other world of dieting ‚Äì but that‚Äôs another story! Although I still follow a lot of the practices from the Bulletproof diet, the one thing I found that made an incredible impact on my mind and body (and my waist!) was Bulletproof coffee. Bulletproof coffee is made using organic coffee, coconut oil, and grass-fed butter ‚Äì I know, it sounds weird AF, bear with me! It basically makes the coffee much more potent and minimizes the risk of your brain and body crashing after a few hours. It also boosts your metabolic rate to help you lose weight, but most importantly it gives you amazing clarity and focus. The coconut oil balances your hunger hormones making you feel full, while the saturated fat in grass-fed butter slows the absorption of caffeine, which gives you a longer-lasting energy boost, instead of a spike of intense energy that usually (for me) ends in jitters and a crash of energy levels. It also improves mental clarity as the coconut oil converts to Ketones, an energy that your brain uses more efficiently than any other form, this combined with the slow release of coffee makes such a crazy difference, that you can just feel your brain working more powerfully. I know, it sounds too good to be true, but I swear by it! I drink it probably three or four days a week on the days I really need to focus, otherwise, I drink green tea , which is also amazing for your skin, body, and focus. How to make Bulletproof coffee: It‚Äôs super easy to make! Take two tablespoons of grass-fed butter and add one teaspoon of organic Coconut Oil (or the official Brain Octane Oil, which is basically a very high-quality coconut oil), and freshly brewed organic coffee and combine the ingredients in a blender for 20 seconds. Honestly, it tastes really good, and the blending process gives it a nice froth on top as well, like a latte. I really recommend that anyone try this; it‚Äôs super easy to make, inexpensive, and something I don‚Äôt see myself quitting anytime soon! Not into drinking coffee? It‚Äôs great for your skin too! Try out our Bulletproof DIY body scrub: Combine one cup of ground organic coffee, one cup of brown sugar, and half a cup of melted organic coconut oil. You can store it in a tub and use two to three times a week. This makes such an invigorating, skin-softening scrub as the coconut oil is amazingly hydrating, coffee is full of antioxidants, and the brown sugar makes an amazing natural scrub. We‚Äôve all heard the mantra ‚Äòlove the skin you‚Äôre in‚Äô and to do that properly, you need to know exactly what your skin is thirsty for! This means knowing your skin type and its properties is crucial. It sounds easy, but it‚Äôs actually the most common skincare mistake people make. Your skin is hereditary, so although you can‚Äôt change it, you can rebalance it with the right regime. If you‚Äôre confused by your skin type and use the wrong products, it can compromise your skin‚Äôs natural balance and result in breakouts, irritation, inflammation, and even premature aging. So, to keep you from making this HUGE mistake, we‚Äôve broken down each skin type so you‚Äôll be able to self-diagnose and FINALLY get it right! Oily skin What it looks like: If you have oily skin, it‚Äôll be shiny and greasy with large, visible pores. The level of shine will typically increase around midday and the oil will affect your previously flawless foundation. You‚Äôll also be prone to inflammatory acne; pustules and pimples, as well as non-inflammatory acne, like blackheads and whiteheads. Oily skin can also be prompted by any form of hormone change, like your period or pregnancy. Why it‚Äôs oily: Our body produces a natural oil called sebum to help maintain soft and supple skin. If too much sebum is produced, it sits on your skin‚Äôs surface resulting in blocked pores and a greasy appearance. The overproduction of sebum also means that your pores are larger as it causes the follicles to expand. On the plus side, if you have oily skin, you‚Äôre expected to age better üòâ Acne-prone skin What it looks like: If you have acne, your skin will be extremely oily, with a significant amount of blackheads and whiteheads as well as pustules, pimples, and papules in concentrated patches. These are caused by the blockage of hair follicles due to the overproduction of sebum and dead skin cells. Combination skin What it looks like: Combination skin is super common and consists of two, massively contrasting skin types: oily and dry. The skin on your T-zone (forehead and nose) will typically be oily, resulting in larger pores, while your cheeks and other areas will be dry, tight and flakey with smaller pores. Top tip: We know it sounds extra AF, but it‚Äôll help if you use different products to target different areas of your skin. Concentrate your clay mask on your T-zone only and avoid using thicker creams on your T-zone. Normal skin If you have ‚Äònormal‚Äô skin, you‚Äôll have no visible pores, blemishes, flaky areas or oily patches. The texture of your skin will be smooth and is more likely to look radiant and youthful due to the well-balanced level of moisture, sebum, and keratin. Basically, you‚Äôre BLESSED. Dry Skin What it looks like: Dry skin is often dull, especially around the eyes, accentuating fine lines and wrinkles. Your pores will be small and barely visible but your skin will often feel tight, rough and may even chap ‚Äì you‚Äôre also more likely to have eczema or dermatitis. Why it‚Äôs dry: Dry skin is caused by a lack of moisture in the corneous layer, which also makes your pores less visible due to the lack of sebum. The lack of moisture also means that your skin loses its natural elasticity, which is why it feels tight. Aging skin What it looks like: Aging skin will often be dry, and will look translucent and pale, as the top layer of skin, the epidermis, is thinning. The skin will also appear saggy, especially around the eyes and neck due to a loss of moisture and elasticity. Aging skin is also prone to dark pigmented spots resulting from sun damage and potentially bad health habits. Test your skin: Wash your face thoroughly with warm water, cleanse and then pat dry with a towel. Leave your skin to sit fresh and clean for 30 minutes, get the mirror and take a good look ‚Äì are your pores visible or not, do you have spots or whiteheads ‚Äì access your skin, and see how it compares with the above categories! Repeat this test every six months, as your skin is always changing, responding to internal factors like your hormones, age or diet, plus external factors like the weather. Now you know your skin type (and remember, is can fluctuate), there‚Äôs no reason why you can‚Äôt cater all of your products to your skin‚Äôs specific needs. So, check out our guides to make sure you‚Äôre using the right moisturizer , cleanser , and toner for your skin type. finding your skin type skin type Skincare Wed, 29 Nov 2017 11 Comments Related Posts 5 Reasons Why You Need Jojoba Oil in Your Life! I also have combination skin, can you please please help me and give me some advice. I feel like I‚Äôve tried everything but nothing keeps working and I keep getting pimples on my forehead. Hey My Loves!! I loooove Winter in Dubai! Even though it‚Äôs not like freezing cold (in some countries I think our Winter, could be considered their Summer!), I still love the fresh air and the cool breeze. It‚Äôs also such an awesome time to spend time with Nour, go to the park and do outdoor activities which are simply impossible in the Summer! I do tend to suffer a little bit with my skin when the weather changes, and although I do use a bunch of really good products for my skin, somehow I always fall back on my DIYs. I think I just love how the ingredients are natural, easy to mix and super inexpensive! Here is one of my fav masks I use when my skin is a little dry and I swear it will make your skin feel soooo much better: INGREDIENTS 4 spoonfuls of yogurt (plain, try get the organic one) 1 spoonful of honey (also try use organic) Mix the ingredients together in a bowl, if you have time place it in the fridge for 30 minutes. Then apply to your face using your fingers. Let sit for 10-15 minutes and rinse with luke warm water. Follow with your favorite moisturizer, Voila! The lactic acid in yogurt will help dissolve dead skin and tighten pores. Honey is naturally antibacterial, full of antioxidants, and is great for moisturising and soothing, so it helps create glowing, dewy skin! Take note to the babe in the ball cap, that‚Äôs her ingenious makeup artist, Mario, he‚Äôs also a sweetheart! photos courtesy of kimkardashian in skin Fan Question: Dealing with Rosacea by hudabeauty Sat, 20 Mar 2010 1 Comment What You Need to Know About Rosacea I had a friend of mine send me a question about Rosacea and I was stunned when I read about this common facial skin disorder and how it can affect the lifestyle of individuals with Rosacea. According to Rosacea.org, well over 14 million Americans suffer from Rosecea and have no idea that they have it. If left untreated, Rosecea can worsen with age. Here are warning signs that you may have Rosecea: ‚Ä¢ Redness on cheeks, nose, chin, or forehead ‚Ä¢ Small visible blood vessels on face ‚Ä¢ Bumpy or rough patches sometimes with pimples ‚Ä¢ Watery or irritated eyes The cause of Rosacea is currently unknown, and while there are no proven cures, it is possible to control the symptons. Prescription antibiotics in the form of pills or topical ointments, may help the signs of Rosacea and usually are effective. However, if medicine does fail, try using sulfer creams for Rosacea. These are usually extremely successful and typically avoid any complications that could occur while taking antibiotics. It is recommended that you consult your dermatologist about what method is right for you. The following information is taken directly from skincarephysicians.com RosaceaNet Article Controlling Flare-Ups Can Boost Self-Esteem Another study that involved 583 patients with mild to moderate rosacea found that effective treatment significantly improved the patients‚Äô quality of life. The type of treatment did not matter. As long as it was effective, patients‚Äô quality of life improved. While rosacea is not curable, flare-ups can often be controlled by following the three-prong approach recommended by dermatologists: ¬∑ Skin care. Following a rosacea friendly skin care plan is essential. This includes being very gentle with rosacea-prone skin, using mild skin care products, and protecting the skin from the sun. ¬∑ Treatment. The treatment prescribed depends on the type and severity of the rosacea. Combination therapy is often most effective. Treatment may include a barrier-repair emollient, topical medications, and/or laser therapy. ¬∑ Trigger avoidance. What triggers rosacea in one person may not cause another person to experience a flare-up. Learning personal triggers and finding ways to avoid them can be very effective. References: Fleischer A, Suephy C. ‚ÄúThe face and mind evaluation study: an examination of the efficacy of rosacea treatment using physician ratings and patients‚Äô self-reported quality of life.‚Äù J Drugs Dermatol . 2005; 4:585-90. Nicholson K, Abramova L, Chren MM, et al. ‚ÄúA pilot quality-of-life instrument for acne rosacea.‚Äù J Am Acad Dermatol . 2007; 57:213-21. Society of Investigative Dermatology and the American Academy of Dermatology. ‚ÄúBurden of Skin Disease 2005.‚Äù Available at www.lewin.com/content/publications/april2005skindisease.pdf . Last accessed January 26, 2009. Tan SR, Tope WD. ‚ÄúP ulsed dye laser treatment of rosacea improves erythema, symptomatology, and quality of life.‚Äù J Am Acad Dermatol . 2004; 51:592-9. Rosacea Triggers Dermatologists‚Äô Tips for Controlling Rosacea in Fall Fall brings relief for many people with rosacea. Cooler temperatures and reduced humidity in areas across the United States mean less chance of becoming overheated. Even in the fall, it is important to be wary of rosacea triggers and to avoid your own personal triggers. These dermatologists‚Äô tips can help your skin feel better this autumn. ¬∑ Continue to practice sun protection. While the days are getting shorter, sun protection is still essential. A survey conducted by the National Rosacea Society found that sun exposure was the most common trigger among those surveyed. Be sure to limit your exposure to the sun, wear sunglasses that protect your eyes from both the UVA and UVB rays of the sun, apply a broad-spectrum (offers UVA and UVB protection) sunscreen with an SPF of 30 or higher every day, and wear protective clothing, such as a wide-brimmed hat. ¬∑ Heed cool-down strategies. You can still become overheated when the temperature drops. Activities such as raking leaves, baking a pie, and exercising can cause you to overheat. Cool-down strategies that can help keep a flare-up at bay in the fall are listed on this page. ¬∑ Moisturize if your skin starts to feel dry. When the humidity drops, skin can feel especially dry. A gentle moisturizer can help your skin feel better. To avoid irritating your skin, look for a moisturizer that does not contain alcohol, eucalyptus, fragrance, peppermint, or witch hazel. According to a survey conducted by the National Rosacea Society, these ingredients are more likely to aggravate rosacea. If you use a topical rosacea medication, let this dry before applying the moisturizer. If you cannot find a moisturizer that does not irritate your skin, be sure to ask your dermatologist for recommendations. ¬∑ Avoid getting too close to a burning fire or stove. The first fire of the season can be alluring. Remember not to get too close as getting overheated triggers rosacea for many. ¬∑ Keep the thermostat low. A bit of heat on a chilly autumn night feels great. To avoid becoming overheated, be sure to keep the thermostat low ‚Äî just enough to take the chill out of the air. ¬∑ Avoid steam, saunas, hot showers, and hot baths. Staying cool helps keep rosacea from flaring. Since steam, saunas, and hot water all increase blood flow, these are best avoided. ¬∑ Wear loose, layered clothing. This allows you to stay comfortable because you can remove layers as needed to prevent overheating. ¬∑ Limit hot beverages and alcohol. Heated beverages, such as hot cider, coffee, and tea trigger rosacea for many people. Drinking alcohol also can trigger rosacea. If any of these trigger your rosacea, be sure to limit your consumption or avoid the beverages that cause your rosacea to flare. References: National Rosacea Society, ‚ÄúIngredients May Aggravate Rosacea.‚Äù Rosacea Review , spring 2005. Available at: www.rosacea.org/rr/2005/spring/article_5.html . Last accessed: August 23, 2005. National Rosacea Society, ‚ÄúNew Survey Pinpoints Leading Factors that Trigger Symptoms.‚Äù Rosacea Review , summer 2002. Available at www.rosacea.org/rr/2002/summer/article_3.html . Last accessed: August 23, 2005. What if we told you to skip the makeup wipes and face wash, don‚Äôt bother toning and forget the moisturizer, we‚Äôve got a product that will do it all? You‚Äôd be pretty excited, right? It‚Äôs no exaggeration to say that after Huda introduced the HB HQ to it, we swiftly switched up our beauty routines to include miracle-worthy micellar water. No, it‚Äôs not a fancy bottle of H20 from our basement, it‚Äôs the lazy girl‚Äôs dream to cleansing! But don‚Äôt take our word for it, it‚Äôs a staple arsenal in every makeup artists‚Äô kit, and renowned to be a favorite among models and celebrities. Even the lifelong makeup remover wipe devotees among you will be converted! So, what actually is micellar water? Surprise, surprise, it‚Äôs another genius beauty product created by the French. Micellar water is made of tiny balls of oil molecules called micelles, which are suspended in soft water. The clever little micelles are made of surfactants, which act as magnet to attract dirt, makeup, and sebum, lifting impurities from the skin without stripping away natural oils like harsh chemicals and alcohol can. All you need to do is soak a cotton pad in micellar water and wipe away your makeup (even tough eye-makeup) and any other grime or oil that has built up ‚Äì no need to rinse because the formula draws out impurities without unbalancing your skin, and doesn‚Äôt leave behind oil. As a result, it‚Äôs incredibly hydrating for your skin, so if your skin tends to be oily, you may even find you can skip moisturizing before bed. It‚Äôs super gentle formula makes it ideal for sensitive skin, as you can avoid oil-stripping face washes and there‚Äôs no need to rub or scrub your skin. If you‚Äôre a bb cream and mascara kinda girl, this will soon become your go-to when you don‚Äôt have the energy to wash your face. If you‚Äôre part of the oily-skinned crew or a cake face fan, you‚Äôll need a few cotton pads to remove the layers, or wash your face and let a quick wipe of micellar water do the rest. No doubt you‚Äôll notice a huge change in your complexion the longer you use it, and dewy skin from your first use. HB HQ is never without Bioderma‚Äôs Sensibio H20 Micelle Solution ‚Äì the original French formula to spark the trend among the beauty world ‚Äì and their super cute mini versions make the perfect cleansing option for traveling! There‚Äôs a ton of options for every budget, some even contain ingredients like rose water to soothe, hibiscus to brighten, or vitamins. Our fave drugstore micellar waters include the incredibly affordable Garnier Micellar Cleansing Water and Simple‚Äôs award-winning Cleansing Micellar Water , which has vitamins B3 and C, and costs less than $6! best cleansing method cleansing micellar water Sensitive skin Sat, 5 Aug 2017 12 Comments Related Posts How Your Cleanser Could Be Ruining Your Skin, And‚Ä¶ Sun, 27 Aug 2017 The Drugstore Product Every Lazy Girl Should Have Sun, 23 Jul 2017 Your Skin Is Thirsty For This $9 French Beauty Essential Fri, 19 May 2017 Naina Hey, would you recommend micellar water for acne prone skin? I‚Äôve been obsessed with Soap & Glory for a really really long time, their products always smell divine (a bomb fragrance is everything to me) and they use the most gorgeous ingredients. No matter how many scrubs I try, I keep finding myself going back to the Soap & Glory Smoothie Star Breakfast Scrub , $15; it literally sloughs away every last bit of dead skin. Unlike some scrubs that can make your skin oily without really scrubbing, this one will actually exfoliate your skin and leave it crazy clean. It‚Äôs not super softening, but it‚Äôs one of my all-time faves because it just gets the job done; be sure to follow with a moisturizer. I also love that it uses amazing natural ingredients like oats, honey, and bananas ‚Äì I know, it sounds delicious, like some yummy maple syrup pudding. Oats are surprisingly good for your skin; they contain amino acids that can heal damaged skin and even target blemishes. Bananas and honey are also incredible natural ingredients that are loaded with good-for-your-skin vitamins and have anti-bacterial properties. With the added benefits of shea butter, almond oil, sea salt, and brown sugar, it‚Äôs basically a huge tub of food for your skin! I find with a scrub you need to use a good amount, or the exfoliation isn‚Äôt the same, and because this tub is huge, you can use a lot every time without having to worry about saving it (unlike when you have an expensive scrub, and you skimp, because you spent so much money on it)! DIY Your Own Breakfast Scrub! I love this scrub so much I‚Äôve even recreated it myself. It‚Äôs a little bit messy, but it‚Äôs totally worth it. For your face: Mash up half a ripe banana with a fork and combine it with two tablespoons of organic oats and about a teaspoon of honey. Combine the mix and then smother your face with it. I like to gently rub it onto my skin for exfoliation (over the sink, as the oats can fall off), and then I leave it on my face for around fifteen minutes. For your body: Mash up one ripe banana, and combine with half a cup of brown sugar, half a cup of oatmeal, and two tablespoons of coconut oil. Jump in the shower, plaster your body with the scrub (I always go in sections, my arms, my body, my legs) and rub in circular motions ‚Äì this usually takes me a good few minutes. Rinse thoroughly with water and pat your skin dry. DIY body scrub drugstore body scrub Soap & Glory Tue, 19 Sep 2017 11 Comments Related Posts DIY Face Scrub for Glowing Skin!
