OK So it‚Äôs no secret that I LOVE a good contour‚Ä¶I‚Äôve literally been contouring since I was about 14 years old and in middle school (true story!). People actually thought I was much older ‚Äôcause I was always wearing full foundation, concealer, mascara, strong eyeliner, and a bold lip. You guys know I‚Äôm all about symmetry, whether it‚Äôs using a capiler to make sure my brows are sisters , or tape to get the prefect contour ‚Äì I feel the exact same way about lips! It just makes the face look so much more harmonious, and I truly believe that lining your lips should be part of your daily beauty routine. That was the main reason why I decided to create our Lip Contours ‚Äì I wanted to take the whole idea of contouring from the face to the lips. It wasn‚Äôt a gimmick for me. Although no one is born with perfect face symmetry, it‚Äôs really fun to be able to play around with that using makeup! To get the perfect lips, here‚Äôs a quick How-To for you to follow: 1. Look at your lip shape and assess the areas you want to contour (add more volume, fix the symmetry, improve the shape etc) 2. I like to apply a little foundation on my lips after moisturising them ‚Äì I just feel like the color is way more intense that way! 3. Take your fav Lip Contour , draw an ‚ÄúX‚Äù on your cupid‚Äôs bow to create the arch, then line the bottom centre of your lips to match the same as the top. 4. Connect it at the corners (the goal is to make your lips appear even). 5. Generally speaking, you can overline a little bit, however just don‚Äôt do too much to avoid a clown-like lip. 6. Once you‚Äôve created the desired shape, you can use a lighter shade to fill in the rest of the lip. This will help create the illusion of a more voluminous pout. Afterwards I like to use my finger to lightly blend the colors together (to get rid of any harsh lines). lip contouring lip tutorial Tue, 7 Feb 2017 Leave a comment Related Posts My Top 3 Tips for the Perfect Nose Contour! Hey My Loves! So I recently did a video on Foundation Basics and decided to do a quick post which might help you guys find the right foundation shade! I know it‚Äôs such a tricky thing to do and it‚Äôs definitely not something you can do within 5 minutes. It takes patience and loads of swatches! But trust me, all that time you‚Äôve invested is going to be SO worth it when your foundation shade matches your skin tone and your selfies look flawless! It‚Äôs very important to figure out what your undertone is in order to know which shade foundation to go for. First off, pull up your sleeve and look at the veins below your wrists. Your veins (in most cases) will either have a green or blue tone to it. This helps to decide whether you should opt for a foundation which is more golden/yellow, or more beige. My veins are green so I always opt for golden, yellowish toned foundations. My skin color is medium olive so I always feel that golden-yellow tones match my skin best (quick note: these foundations tend to look kinda yellow in the packaging, don‚Äôt get put off!). If you have blue veins, then you‚Äôre more than likely have a beige undertone and should opt for a cool toned foundation (more white than yellow). Now; if you have both ‚Äì blue & green, then you‚Äôre somewhere in between and should look for a more neutral foundation shade. I always recommend to people not to purchase the foundation right away (unless you‚Äôre 100% sure). Rather swatch it, wear if for the day and if you can ‚Äì apply a bit on the one half of your face and check it out in natural light. This is the best way to see if the color matches your skin tone, if it‚Äôs suitable for your skin type and you can also see the coverage & wearability of the product. Hope this quick tip makes foundation shopping easier for you guys! Hi my loves, we wanted to make it as easy as possible for you to find your perfect #FauxFilter shade. We‚Äôve had hundreds of requests for a shade comparison guide with your favorite brands, so we‚Äôve put together an easy shade reference guide to help. I know a lot of you will only be able to shop our foundation online, so we hope this comparison table will guide you to find your perfect shade. You can also check out our 5 tips for figuring out your undertone and finding your ultimate foundation match here . We‚Äôve chosen six brands that everyone was asking us to give their matches for, so if you know your shade in that brand you can see which one should match our foundation. Because foundations are so unique, we weren‚Äôt able to find a match for every shade from each brand, so below are what we deem to be close matches or shades that are almost the same ‚Äì if there‚Äôs no direct match we‚Äôve included the difference between the similar foundation shades in brackets. If your shade isn‚Äôt in the guide, have a look for the ones which are close to it, and using our undertones guide to help you , you‚Äôll be able to weigh up the right flavor for you. Please remember these are the shades we found to be close, but they may appear different when applied to your skin, so we always recommend that you try the product in store. Our final tip, if you‚Äôre debating between two shades online, if you opt for the fairer version of the two, it can always be warmed up with bronzer. You can also check out findation.com , which allows you to enter any shade of foundation to find your match. This is just a guide to the shades we deemed to be a good match for our #FauxFilter foundations. If you find your shade based on the recommendation of this guide doesn‚Äôt match for you, Huda Beauty cannot be held responsible for your purchase. #hudabeautyfauxfilter which shade are you?! Ever since I became obsessed with makeup Benefit Cosmetics has been killing it with cute and quirky packaging. And it‚Äôs not just the design I‚Äôm obsessed with; their formulas are nearly always on-point too ‚Äì they‚Äôre like the girl next door of beauty brands, cute but accessible. Benefit‚Äôs Boi-ing concealer has fast become a cult product and a consistent bestseller for the brand, so when they decided to give it a makeover, I was keen to see how they would reinvent it ‚Äì I‚Äôm obsessing over their new metallic packaging look. Not only did Benefit repackage the original Boi-ing, but they also gave it some sisters too; three other siblings that promise to target and conceal in different ways. Would the Boi-ing Industrial Strength Concealer stand up to its famous past? What it is: A full-coverage creamy matte concealer designed to stay all day. It comes in three shades: 01 ‚Äì light, 02 ‚Äì light-medium, 03 ‚Äì medium. What it does: The heavy-duty formula is designed to cover dark-circles, blemishes, and discoloration. It can be used with a concealer brush to accurately give full-coverage to blemishes, or you can dab it under your eyes with your fingertip to hide dark-circles. What we liked: I love the new packaging, and I found the texture light but highly-pigmented, and when I applied it with a small dense brush it gradually buffed out with some stippling (I used the Kat Von D concealer brush). I chose shade 02 ‚Äì light medium, but the shade was very peachy, whereas I‚Äôm more yellow toned, so this wasn‚Äôt ideal for use on all areas of my face. What we didn‚Äôt like: I was never a regular user of Boi-ing before, but I did like the formula. I feel like this formula is much oilier than before, and it has quite a greasy texture (there was actually a thin layer of oil on top of the product when I bought it). Although I found it worked well on my skin before I applied foundation, when I tried to use it after my foundation it didn‚Äôt seep into the makeup, it just sat on top of my skin. It‚Äôs also designed to be ‚Äòindustrial strength, ‚Äô but by the time I had blended it to look natural, it wasn‚Äôt full-coverage. I also think the collection lacks diversity: there are so many different skin tones, and varying undertones within every skin tone, so offering just three shades is really not enough. This might work well for you if you only need light coverage of minor dark circles, but for me, it‚Äôs not a product I would reach for again. I also think in today‚Äôs world, there needs to be a better shade offering (the darker end of the shade spectrum is hugely lacking), particularly as this is a product that has been reworked. It‚Äôs a massively popular formula, so I recommend you try it in store first. From the moment Serena was spotted stepping off the train at Grand Central, Gossip Girl has been giving us MAJOR life goals. For starters, Gossip Girl basically made blogging a thing, while simultaneously teaching us how to curb the haters. Literally, no matter how much shade S & B got thrown their way, they always managed to come through ‚Äì normally with a brand-new outfit and a blow-dry to match. But it wasn‚Äôt just the wardrobe and the endless hairstyles that kept us watching ‚Äì although they did help! Behind all the schemes and scandals, each character was a BAWSE in their own right. So here‚Äôre just some of the many important things we learned from Gossip Girl‚Ä¶ 1) Don‚Äôt listen to the haters, they only criticize out of jealousy and insecurity ‚Äì even Serena did it sometimes. 2) We all know retail therapy is actually a thing, and in the words of Blair herself: ‚ÄúWhoever said money doesn‚Äôt buy you happiness, didn‚Äôt know where to shop.‚Äù Seriously, surveys have shown that 52% of Americans do it to boost their mood! 3) Don‚Äôt let social media run your life, but don‚Äôt get caught looking anything less than fabulous on your profile. As Eleanor Waldorf once said ‚ÄòFashion knows not of comfort. All that matters is the face you show to the world.‚Äô For our tops tips on how to take a snap as hot as a Manhattan socialite on page 6, check out our post on how to slay a selfie here . 4) BFFL means FOR LIFE. For guidance, just look at Chuck and Nate‚Äôs ultimate bromance: no matter what happened in the end, they always had each other‚Äôs back ‚Äì even if you do fall in love with your best friend‚Äôs ex! 5) Jenny Humphreys drew our attention to the fact there IS such a thing as too much black eyeliner ‚Äì all we‚Äôre saying is she got exiled from Manhattan for a reason. While a smoky eye is a classic, there needs to be a gradient of pigmentation, otherwise you‚Äôll probably end up looking like a raccoon, not Kate Moss. If you need a little extra guidance, check out these seriously sleek eyeliner looks . 6) Gossip Girl helped us save face on SO many occasions! Remember, if you get caught in between salon appointments, a braid or a high pony will literally save you. If you need some up-do inspiration, these IG looks gave us major vibes . 7) When it comes to love, don‚Äôt always go for the obvious option. Even if it seems impossible at the time, if you love someone, you can make it work. 8) Trademark your look ‚Äì whether that‚Äôs a bowtie like Chuck, a headband like Blair or lashes like Huda. 9) Being extra AF is nothing you should be ashamed of, and never let anyone tell you otherwise. blair and Serena Gossip Girl life lessons Tue, 14 Nov 2017 5 Comments Related Posts 5 Reasons We Wanted To Be Just Like Jasmine, And Still Do Tue, 17 Oct 2017 9 Reasons Why Love Actually Is The Best Christmas Movie Ever Tue, 19 Dec 2017 4 Easy Hairstyles To Hide Your Greasy AF Hair Wed, 17 Jan 2018 Marcela This is soooo true! If there‚Äôs one thing I‚Äôve learnt about Christian Louboutin , it‚Äôs that he never does anything the traditional way. Whatever he touches, he turns into a piece of art, which is why his latest collection of Eye Amplifiers are no different. After trying out his recent Loubichrome Polishes , I was extremely honoured to be one of the first in the world to receive this collection and try it for a few days before it was officially revealed to the public. The reason for a collection based only on Eye Amplifiers is to enhance the feature Loubouin considers most expressive . Eyes engage, reveal, and expose as Christian explains in his own words: ‚ÄúYou can see happiness, sadness, fear, fierceness‚Ä¶You definitely see everything through the eyes.‚Äù This collection is inspired by one of Christian‚Äôs beauty icons, Egyptian Queen Nefertiti, as well as his travels to India which are tributed to the collection‚Äôs rich colors and intense pigments. More about the collection: The Mascara is extremely opulent and reminiscent of Art Deco architecture. It‚Äôs something which you‚Äôd find in your jewelry cabinet, rather than makeup bag. My favorite feature of the Mascara is definitely the wand ‚Äì which is uniquely comprised of both vertical and horizontal bristles, assisting in smooth application and creating a dramatic, voluminous finish. The Ink Liners are stunning! The formula is amazing and the design of the bottle itself is SO Louboutin. I love how involved he is and that he personally designs everything. From Fashion to Beauty ‚Äì there is a consistency in his style and you can recognize his work miles away. One of the liner shades are Rouge Louboutin, which is the same iconic red shade present in his other designs. It is Christian‚Äôs interpretation of ‚Äúl‚Äôoeil de braise‚Äù: the burning look of desire. OK so True Story! The Brow Definers may be my new best friend! I must say, the application with both the Brow Definers and the Kohl Liners was super smooth and they feel very luxurious. The pigments are very rich and it almost feels velvet-like on the skin. The formula literally glides on and the packaging is insanely beautiful. I love the gold cap and embossed signature, as well as the fact that a sharpener is included in both the Brow Definers and Kohl Liners. Christian‚Äôs latest collection is a piece of art, and any Beauty Connoiseur‚Äôs dream. It almost makes me want to buy a second set to keep, admire and never touch! Louboutin is a true artist, and I think he is one of few who managed to successfully merge Fashion and Beauty in such a remarkable way. The official launch date is the 23rd of March, which includes a series of eye amplifying tools. For more information, check out: christianlouboutin.com This is not a sponsored post, however I did receive some of his products as a gift. All views are my own. Who doesn‚Äôt love a good cat liner? At HB HQ the general consensus is the bigger the flick, the better! Although we love the classic liner look, sometimes there are new trends that are just too gorgeous to resist ‚Äì not to mention we‚Äôre fans of switching up our makeup game whenever an opportunity arises. Fortunately, this fall the runways were literally dripping with stunning liner looks that will take your makeup game to a whole new level. For the days when getting out your eyeshadow seems way too much drama to handle, these stunning new liner trends will give your look a major refresh instead. Don‚Äôt be scared to get creative! DOLL-LIKE EYES We‚Äôre literally dying over how cute this playful, accentuated-glitter-lashes look is ‚Äì such a pretty look for fall. Even better, it‚Äôs super easy to do: just grab a fine eyeliner and accentuate your natural bottom lashes with small flicks. If you feel like adding a little sparkle, separate the bold black lines with glitter. DITCH THE FLICK Forget about perfect precision, ditch the flick and go for this rounded look instead! This thick-edged eyeliner is the answer we‚Äôve been waiting for to hide our clumsy cat liner flicks! Seen on the runways at Jason Wu and Tom Ford, this liner is like a super edgy, grungy smoky-eye, and we love it. FLOATING CUT CREASE We‚Äôve been dying over the floating cut crease on IG for a while now, but we‚Äôre loving the colorful, bold update showcased on the Prabal Gurung runway. Stray away from your lash line with a floating cut crease; it can be natural and sexy with a simple high-cat liner, or playful with different colored liners and bright hues. FIERCE FELINE LINER Easy, sassy, and the definition of fierce, this liner came to slay on the fall runway. Seen on the catwalks at Miu Miu and on a ton of It-girls, this liner is the easiest way to update your look for fall partying. To recreate the look, take a liquid liner and start at the middle of your eyelid and draw a line all the way from the center of your lid to your brow bone (towards the end of the brow), and fill in. BIG BOLD KOHL It‚Äôs time to leave the liquid eyeliner inside your make up bag and grab your khol ‚Äì the bigger the pencil, the better! We‚Äôve had it drummed into us for a long time that lining your eyes all the way around will make them look smaller, but Alexander Wang showed us we were SO wrong. This look is definitely cool, and we think the smudgier the better! When we say silk pillowcase our minds immediately drift to visions of a bachelor‚Äôs penthouse apartment ‚Äì like something out of Fifty Shades Of Grey. However, we‚Äôre here to realign your thought process, because there‚Äôs nothing sleazy about sleeping on silk, it‚Äôs actually THE bombest thing for your hair and skin. Sleeping on a silk pillowcase is SO much better than cotton; not only will it make you feel like a legit princess, you‚Äôll wake up with hair that no longer resembles a bird‚Äôs nest, and you can forget about those annoying sleep creases on your face. Seriously, you need to move on from your cotton pillowcase. Maybe you‚Äôve even heard all this before, but then thought, why would you fork out $60 when you already have a cotton pillowcase that gets the job done. Well, we‚Äôre here to tell you that getting the benefits of a silk pillowcase doesn‚Äôt need to be an investment and we found a satin-finish pillowcase on Amazon for less than $10 . Okay, so it‚Äôs not made of the finest silk, but it gives a silky finish that is sure to give better hair and skin benefits than your classic cotton pillowcase. The thing is, when you sleep on cotton pillowcases, the cotton ‚Äògrabs‚Äô your hair causing it to twist and stick, which is why you often wake up with frizz, and let‚Äôs be honest, a not-so-hot mess. The difference with silk and satin-finish pillowcases is your hair moves freely; there‚Äôs no friction or tugging, which means you wake up with smooth hair. Another weird thing you probably never knew, cotton draws moisture from your hair, which over time makes your hair brittle and more prone to damage, not to mention it‚Äôs literally absorbing your skincare and haircare products into the pillow that you sleep on every night, eww. Think about it; you spend at least 7 hours with your head on a pillow every night ‚Äì whether you‚Äôre Netflixing or sleeping ‚Äì so making the switch away from cotton really makes a lot of sense, for your skin and your hair! So, whether you fancy investing $60 in a real silk pillowcase (you spend a lot of time in bed, so the cost per use is less than a cent in just a couple of years), or you want to test the benefits first with a less expensive satin-finish pillowcase (like the ones we found on Amazon), it really might be the best thing you ever did! And, while we‚Äôre on the topic of sleeping, check out EVERY Weird Step Of My Nighttime Skincare Regime here . There are two types of people in this world: people who sleep with their hair up and people who sleep with it down. But we‚Äôve got some pretty major news for those of you who rock an updo while catching some zzz‚Äôs‚Ä¶ It could be seriously damaging your hair; and the reason why no matter how much you spend on oils and serums, your hair still doesn‚Äôt look healthy. So, if you‚Äôre doing this to your hair, you need to stop, now! How wearing your hair up at night is damaging your hair If having your hair down at night irritates you like crazy, chances are you pile it up on top of your head, but this can actually cause a hair loss condition known as traction alopecia. Before you start to panic, don‚Äôt worry, traction alopecia won‚Äôt cause ALL your hair to fall out, but it can result in hair loss and significant thinning (around your hairline in particular), especially during prolonged periods, like those eight golden hours of beauty sleep! It‚Äôs triggered by the constant tugging and pulling when your hair is tied too tight; this constant strain causes your hair follicles to become inflamed, damaging them so that they‚Äôre unable to complete their growth cycle. As well as pulling your hair, friction between your hair tie and the pillow will also cause your hair particles to weaken, and split ends to emerge mid-length, resulting in even more damage. What to do instead: For those of you with long mermaid manes or any other hair type that‚Äôs prone to knotting, wear your hair in a loose, low pony or a braid for minimal strain. If you must wear it in a bun on the top of your head, use a scrunchie and tie it loosely, so there‚Äôs no tension on your hair. If you use an elastic band, the rubber can lead to breakage and split ends. It may sound extra AF, but invest in a silk pillowcase to reduce the level of friction on your hair; this will give you smoother, healthier hair. It‚Äôll also help your hair retain more moisture than if you were to use a cotton pillowcase, which is absorbent and soaks up your hair‚Äôs natural oils, leaving it dry and more prone to traction alopecia. If you‚Äôre still skeptical, read this ! If you don‚Äôt have the cash to splurge on a silk pillowcase, rummage through your grandma‚Äôs drawer for a silk scarf. It‚Äôll do the same job as a silk pillowcase while keeping your hair off your face, not to mention it totally channels old Hollywood glam. If you‚Äôve already noticed signs of hair thinning‚Ä¶ Don‚Äôt worry, traction alopecia isn‚Äôt permanent, but it‚Äôs essential that you catch it early and break the habit. Make sure you aren‚Äôt falling into any other common traps, like using the wrong brush, brushing it incorrectly or over styling. For more tips on what you shouldn‚Äôt do to your hair, check out our tips here . Tying your hair up in a bun can be a really great way to style your hair in natural curls for the next day, but if done every night it could cause problems further down the line. We know we‚Äôre not meant to, but if we can avoid washing our hair, we will! This means not only is dry shampoo a must on our bathroom shelves, but so is an easy hairstyle that will disguise our roots. The best thing is, when our hair is greasy it‚Äôs actually in its most friendly styling stage, so cute braids, messy buns, and quirky pin-ups are made for your three-day-old hair ‚Äì who are we kidding, we push it to four or five days sometimes. To help you get the most out of your snooze button and that extra 20 minutes of beauty sleep, here are some seriously bomb hairstyles that look best when your hair‚Äôs dirty‚Ä¶ Werk-your-grease pony Make your oily roots work to your advantage! No matter how bad you think you are at doing your hair, you can master this slick pony, we promise! Brush your hair thoroughly, and then using a bristle brush, scrape your hair backward, gathering all your hair into one hand. Tie your pony high up on your head and take a small section from underneath to wrap around your hair elastic, then secure with bobby pins. Check out four more ways you can play with your slicked ponytail. The alternative messy bun! Okay, so some people find a messy bun to be the easiest hairstyle in the world, while the rest of us struggle to make it look cool and elegant and just end up looking like a 12-year-old ballerina. This is the perfect do for dirty hair, so if you need some direction, this fresh-twist on how to do a gorgeous messy bun is for you! Don‚Äôt forget the dry shampoo! The easiest crown braid ever This look gives us major summer vibes, but it‚Äôs so cute, why not wear it all year round? Not only is this super easy to do when your hair is greasy but because you end up wrapping your braids around the front of your head, it totally hides your greasy parting! If in doubt, put a headband on it! Sometimes the level of grease is bad, and on the days a hat in the office isn‚Äôt appropriate but you also really don‚Äôt want to wash your hair, a headband will be your BFF. And no, it‚Äôs not really preppy or old school, it‚Äôs basically the staple of any Dolce girl. A wide headband, bandana or ribbon will cover your greasy roots and look super cute. Today marks the launch of Christian Louboutin ‚Äôs very first foray into perfumes‚Äîthree to be exact‚Äìand we were lucky enough to get them in our office to try them first! Spoiler: They‚Äôre incredible. Time and money were no object to Louboutin, who had these scents brewing for three years until now. He went to four best perfume houses in the world and what they came up with is seriously incredible! It was so hard to pick favorites! The first one, Bikini Questa Sera (‚ÄúBikini Tonight‚Äù in Italian) is supposed to evoke an intimate, beachy feeling. The notes of jasmine, tuberose, and sandalwood. The second, Tornade Blonde aka ‚ÄúBlonde Tornado‚Äù is about a women who leaves a trail of golden light behind her. Picture you‚Äôre at a bar and see a gorgeous women who disappears in moments, leaving you wondering, ‚Äúwho was she?‚Äù (as the Louboutin team explained). It has a mix of violet, roses, and cassis. Finally, Trouble in Heaven is about a woman who is at ease with being sexy ‚Äì provokes and doesn‚Äôt mind being provocative. The scent is the strongest of the three, with notes of bergamot, amber, patchouli, and iris. The bottle itself is a work of art ‚Äì the clam shell is supposed to emulate a Caesar or Oscar award (and honestly, we want to display it on our shelves like one!). Louboutin actually enlisted an architect, Thomas Heatherwick (who also recently designed the new London double decker buses) to come up with a classic, strong design that really gives these scents a commanding identity. There‚Äôs a mix of complexity and simplicity in the design that we‚Äôd only expect from Louboutin. The perfumes are decadent, sexy, and quite honestly, to die for. They are all launched today at 1320 dhs in the UAE and $275 each in the US. Which perfume describes you? Anyone out to buy one for themselves? Like all Louboutin beauty products, we think this is something you‚Äôll use AND collect to display like works of art. The scents are so distinct, they‚Äôre perfect for layering as well. We‚Äôre seriously obsessed! Check them out at Louboutin stores, on Louboutin‚Äôs site , or online retailers like selfridges.com ! Who doesn‚Äôt love to wear glitter when the opportunity presents itself? Fortunately, it‚Äôs the time of year when you literally have any excuse to get your glitter on and not have to explain yourself. And it‚Äôs not just that it‚Äôs the holidays; glitter is actually massively trending right now, so get yourself glittered up ‚Äì this is only the beginning! Even if wearing glitter does give you throwback vibes to your teen years, here are four very adult ways to wear glitter that will take your look to the next level this season: For your eyes You can keep it low-key and swap out your black liquid liner for glitter liner, or go for full glitter eyeshadow ‚Äì you do you! We‚Äôre also loving the new trend of glitter liner on the lower lashline; it‚Äôs the perfect way to add a fresh take on glitter liner. Check out our tutorial for gorgeous snow queen glitter eyeliner here . For your body In summer we love a bit of shoulder bling with our Huda Beauty 3D Highlighter for a sexy shimmer, but when it comes to festive partying, we‚Äôre all down for getting the glitter out! If you really want to stand out at a Christmas ball or your work event, a little glitter or gold leaf on your shoulders or collarbones will slay ‚Äì it‚Äôs not just for festivals, we promise! Our trick is to spread a thin layer of Vaseline on the area you want to add sparkle to first. For your nails If you‚Äôre a glitterphobe, this has to be the easiest way to add some sparkle to your life without having to go out of your comfort zone. Go for full on glitter or experiment with shimmering nail beds, tips or single finger details. For your lips Yes, glitter lips have been around forever, but that‚Äôs probably because they look so damn good! Whether you want to make a statement and literally dip your lips in glitter or just add some sparkle to your pout with a glitter gloss ‚Äì our Lip Strobe in Shameless is our go-to ‚Äì this is the season to rock it! Metallic brows are such a fun trend, we‚Äôve seen them on the catwalk, the red carpet, and all over Instagram! Glitter brows were the perfect Coachella-vibe look for summer, but metallic brows are the coolest way to work the trend into your fall wardrobe. So even though gold and glitter brows look super pretty, it‚Äôs not necessarily very wearable. Fortunately, I have just the trick to take the trend from catwalk to your closet. It‚Äôs really important to find the right color; I tried silver at first, but it made me look so old even though it looked cool in person ‚Äì in photos, it was more Halloween than hot! Then I tried Fling from our Rose Gold palette, and it looked super cute and pretty, and it still made me look like I had brows! How to do metallic brows: I did my brows as usual, mixed the eyeshadow with a setting spray and used a fine, flat brush to paint the color onto my eyebrows, and it looked so beautiful. You can even use a smaller amount to make it more wearable, instead of covering your whole brow. in Perfume , product review All About the Global Launch of the New Christian Louboutin Fragrances! by HB Team Wed, 7 Sep 2016 42 Comments Today marks the launch of Christian Louboutin ‚Äôs very first foray into perfumes‚Äîthree to be exact‚Äìand we were lucky enough to get them in our office to try them first! Spoiler: They‚Äôre incredible. Time and money were no object to Louboutin, who had these scents brewing for three years until now. He went to four best perfume houses in the world and what they came up with is seriously incredible! It was so hard to pick favorites! The first one, Bikini Questa Sera (‚ÄúBikini Tonight‚Äù in Italian) is supposed to evoke an intimate, beachy feeling. The notes of jasmine, tuberose, and sandalwood. The second, Tornade Blonde aka ‚ÄúBlonde Tornado‚Äù is about a women who leaves a trail of golden light behind her. Picture you‚Äôre at a bar and see a gorgeous women who disappears in moments, leaving you wondering, ‚Äúwho was she?‚Äù (as the Louboutin team explained). It has a mix of violet, roses, and cassis. Finally, Trouble in Heaven is about a woman who is at ease with being sexy ‚Äì provokes and doesn‚Äôt mind being provocative. The scent is the strongest of the three, with notes of bergamot, amber, patchouli, and iris. The bottle itself is a work of art ‚Äì the clam shell is supposed to emulate a Caesar or Oscar award (and honestly, we want to display it on our shelves like one!). Louboutin actually enlisted an architect, Thomas Heatherwick (who also recently designed the new London double decker buses) to come up with a classic, strong design that really gives these scents a commanding identity. There‚Äôs a mix of complexity and simplicity in the design that we‚Äôd only expect from Louboutin. The perfumes are decadent, sexy, and quite honestly, to die for. They are all launched today at 1320 dhs in the UAE and $275 each in the US. Which perfume describes you? Anyone out to buy one for themselves? Like all Louboutin beauty products, we think this is something you‚Äôll use AND collect to display like works of art. The scents are so distinct, they‚Äôre perfect for layering as well. We‚Äôre seriously obsessed! Check them out at Louboutin stores, on Louboutin‚Äôs site , or online retailers like selfridges.com ! I‚Äôm a firm believer in the power of makeup; it‚Äôs transformative abilities to give you confidence and change the way you feel about yourself. That‚Äôs one of the reasons I started my blog; I wanted beauty to be accessible to everyone. This summer, I saw the difference beauty can make confirmed when my sister Alya asked me to give her a complete makeover. Of course, I couldn‚Äôt wait to help her feel more beautiful and see her more confident! Alya isn‚Äôt obsessed with makeup like my sister Mona and I, it‚Äôs just not something she‚Äôs crazy about, and her appearance isn‚Äôt something she focuses on ‚Äì she‚Äôll tell you that herself. She often forgets her skincare routine, isn‚Äôt fussed about having mani and pedis all the time, and is just generally a very low maintenance kinda gal, but she really wanted a huge change‚Ä¶ So, we went all out! Alya‚Äôs Complete Makeover: One of the main things Alya wanted to change was her hair and the texture of her skin. So, we took full advantage of being in LA over the summer and visited the best salons and clinics. I took her to see skin expert to half of Hollywood, Nurse Jamie . She‚Äôs the trusted beauty guru to celebs like Jessica Alba, the Kardashians, and Rita Ora, and I‚Äôm obsessed with her super-advanced anti-aging techniques. I love that Nurse Jamie is all about enhancing your natural beauty and making you the most beautiful version of yourself without invasive techniques; she was the perfect person to help give Alya confidence in her skin again. FACE: Alya previously had cheek fillers, but they weren‚Äôt in the right place, so as Alya puts it, they gave her ‚Äòchipmunk‚Äô cheeks. Nurse Jamie, the ultimate filler expert, reduced the filler in Alya‚Äôs cheeks and under her eyes, by injecting hyaluronidase (an enzyme that speeds up the natural breakdown of hyaluronic acid fillers like Juvederm), and defined the cheekbones to give her a more contoured look. Nurse Jamie also used her filler skills on Alya‚Äôs lips, reshaping them, evening them out, and adding fullness to the top lip with Juvederm Vobella . Finally, Nurse Jamie worked her magic and retextured Alya‚Äôs skin to make it more even-toned using pixel laser therapy. The laser creates thousands of microscopic perforations in the surface of the skin, which prompts the skin to produce new collagen, leaving the skin smoother and more even-toned. EYEBROWS: Everyone knows that the eyebrows completely transform the face, so this summer we all got our brows done by the incredibly skilled Microblading LA team . Our wonderful brow artist Lindsey Ta added fullness to Alya‚Äôs eyebrows and lifted them slightly by raising the outer arch for a more youthful and fresh look. HAIR: Alya has been set on having her hair longer for soo long! A few months ago, Balmain added extensions to Alya‚Äôs hair for volume, but it was length that she was really craving. We went all out and added super long extensions (22 pieces of 20-inch extensions), and added soft honey tones to warm up her complexion and give her the ‚ÄòJ-Lo look‚Äô she wanted. Between bleaching, Alya got a keratin treatment to improve the strength of the hair before the color was added. Finally, Alya received a Brazilian Blowout to eliminate frizz and give shine, which maintains the health of the hair and lasts for around 12 weeks. Alya was so happy with the final result of her hair she was intent on calling her transformation ratchet to Rapunzel üòÇ SKINCARE: I‚Äôm still working on skincare with Alya, but she is super tricky because she gets so lazy with her cleansing routine! Luckily, Alya is naturally gorgeous, but she wants to wake up looking completely flawless without putting effort into her beauty routine, so I‚Äôm trying to make it as easy as possible for her to follow. I‚Äôve given her five essential products to help smooth the texture of her skin, brighten her complexion, and keep any fine lines at bay: Clinique Clarifying Lotion 2: I love using this Clinique formula before my moisturizer, and it‚Äôs perfect for Alya‚Äôs slightly dry skin. It gets rid of any flaky skin and removes oil leaving your skin super fresh and your pores tighter. Dr. Doris Day‚Äôs Silky Foam Cleansing Mousse: This cleansing mouse by skincare expert Dr. Doris Day gets rid of all the dirt and oil that builds up during the day. It uses Lactic and Salicylic acids that exfoliate the skin gently and effectively. SkinCeuticals Skin Firming Cream: I swear by this cream ! It has incredible ingredients that are ideal for mature skin like mine and Alya‚Äôs, as it firms the skin, hydrates, and helps to tone and fight against aging caused by environmental damage. REN Rose O¬π¬≤ Moisture Defence Oil : Every time I use this oil it makes my skin SO soft! It contains awesome oils like Jojoba seed, cranberry seed, and rose oils that soothe, soften and condition the skin, providing vital nutrients, vitamins, and antioxidants so your skin can lock in moisture. Dr. Doris Day‚Äôs Light & Bright Brightening Pads: These brightening pads contain some major ingredients that naturally exfoliate. Hydroxy acids penetrate deep into the skin and accelerate skin renewal, which helps reduce hyperpigmented cells. Alya uses this twice a week as her skin is very uneven. BODY: Even though Alya is obsessed with fitness and is in amazing shape, she wanted to target some stubborn fat on her arms and waist. Nurse Jamie used her incredible SculpSure technique, which can reduce up to 23% fat in less than 30 minutes ‚Äì I know, incredible! It‚Äôs the world‚Äôs first FDA cleared laser for permanent, localized fat reduction that works to break down fats and other lipids. It takes 4-6 weeks to see results with the full result showing from 3 months: Alya is already noticing a difference. EYES: Literally every day since Alya was about 15, she‚Äôs worn colored contact lenses because she‚Äôs nearsighted. Alya finally had Lasik surgery, so she no longer needs to wear contacts ‚Äì although she is majorly missing her lighter eyes. NAILS: Maintenance is something Alya hates, so she‚Äôll usually get her mani and pedi every 2-3 weeks. Mona and I have finally persuaded her to come for weekly pamper sessions at the Dollhouse with us. The Result: It‚Äôs been so incredible seeing how all these tiny little changes have made such a huge difference to how Alya feels about herself. It‚Äôs amazing to work with the best beauty experts, but it also really highlights the importance of finding the right doctors. Always make sure you see a verified doctor, because it‚Äôs all about enhancing your natural self, not changing your appearance, and finding the right doctor will make the biggest difference! We‚Äôre still working to improve Alya‚Äôs skincare routine and her wardrobe, so stay tuned for part two of Alya‚Äôs makeover. We love Bobbi Brown‚Äôs range of wearable shades and high quality products, and her Long-Wear Brow Gels are no exception. But where does it stand in the spectrum of eyebrow needs? Here‚Äôs what we thought: What it is: A waxy, tinted brow gel housed in a sleek mini, black compact. What it does: With the help of a brow brush, waxy pigmented gel can easily help fill in sparse areas of the brows. What we loved: True to the Bobbi Brown spirit, this is best for a more natural approach to brows. The combo of pigment and beeswax helps achieve a natural, fuller look. It feels a bit like pomade for brows. We found it‚Äôs best for filling in sparse areas of the brows without looking like overkill. The color range (17 total) are also very close to natural hair colors (we love Saddle for brunettes) and shades for highlights to give hair the look of texture. What we didn‚Äôt like: While great for filling in brows, because of its waxy nature, it‚Äôs not the best for buildable, detailed work (such as defined strokes mimicking the look of natural hairs). A good pick if you‚Äôre looking for a little more volume with a more natural approach to brows. Also note, while it is water-, sweat-, and humidity- resistant, it can still rub off by mistake. There‚Äôs one thing we all have in common, and it‚Äôs our unique makeup routine we do every day. Like, I always do my brows before foundation, and I always do my mascara after eyeshadow, but I know so many people do those the other way around. Regardless of my makeup phases, the different products I use, and all the unusual techniques I try, there‚Äôs one product that I literally can not do my makeup without, and it‚Äôs something you can pick up for literally $2 at any drugstore. My life-saving beauty essential? It‚Äôs Q-tips, but more specifically, Muji‚Äôs Thin Cotton Buds ‚Äì they are so super fine, about half the size of a normal Q-tip. I mean Q-tips, in general, are a lifesaver, but these super-fine-ended Q-tips are ahhhhmazing; they‚Äôre really really precise, so they‚Äôre perfect for cleaning up my brows and getting rid of any lash glue that ends up on my lids. But really, there‚Äôs so much more to a Q-tip when it comes to makeup. Here‚Äôre some awesome hacks that will not only make your makeup routine quicker and easier, but cheaper too: Hide a Pimple: Instead of buying a tiny, dense concealer brush, a Q-tip can do the job just as well, if not better! Not only will you get a precise application, but because it‚Äôs disposable, it means there‚Äôs no risk of spreading bacteria, so you don‚Äôt need to wash it every time like you should with a brush. Once you‚Äôve applied concealer, you can dip the other end in powder to set your cream concealer. Perfect Your Varnish: The smaller the Q-tip, the better. The skinny Muji cotton buds are literally a dream when it comes to cleaning up messy nail varnish. Your left hand might look neat and tidy, but when it comes to painting your right hand, well, it can look like you let a six-year-old loose on your nails (trust me, I know what that looks like!). Just dip the Q-tip in nail varnish remover and wipe it around your cuticles to get rid of any smudges. Get Flawless Eyeliner: We all know getting the perfect cat-eye is something no amount of years can perfect, it‚Äôs one of those things we‚Äôve accepted we‚Äôll only ever be able to do on a very rare occasion (except if you use the Vamp Stamp ). Enter the Q-tip, your best friend for wiping away your liner mistakes. Dip the Q-tip in a little moisturizer or micellar water and gently neaten up your liner. Save on Makeup Brushes: Avoid shelling out for pointed makeup brushes and use a Q-tip for smoking out eyeliner along your lower lash line. Q-tips are also perfection for adding eyeshadow to your crease ‚Äì especially in the corner of your eyes ‚Äì and applying glitter, so you‚Äôre not forever washing your brush to get rid of left over glitter. Who isn‚Äôt obsessed with having full, beautifully groomed brows? We all want them ‚Äì I definitely do. The unfortunate problem is our bushy brow dreams of today are often hard to achieve. Fortunately, there are tons of ways to get your brows looking gorgeous and full, and the latest product for full brows isn‚Äôt a pencil or pomade, it‚Äôs fake hair encapsulated in a gel formula! I actually tried sticking individual lash hairs to my brows last year to see how it looked, so I was psyched when I saw the Reallyyy 3D Eyebrow Extension Fiber. We reposted this crazy fake brow product on our IG in December, and I just had to try it for myself. What it is: A clear, gel, glue-like formula containing hair-like fibers. The formula comes in a pot with a fine-tipped brush. What it does: The gel can recreate the look of natural brow hairs to visibly fill in the brow. First impressions: When I first opened the product, it looked kind of gunky, a bit like hair that you pull out of your sink. I tried applying the product straight to my brow, which really didn‚Äôt work very well. You need to apply the product to the back of your hand, pick up as few hairs as you can on a small flat brush, and place them one by one in the areas you want to add volume. You could even use tweezers to get the best application, but this could be quite time-consuming. A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Jan 8, 2018 at 6:43am PST What I didn‚Äôt like: This product will take some practice to get it looking good, as it didn‚Äôt look very natural at first. Once it sets, the hair placing can‚Äôt be fixed, so you need to make sure you get the hairs in the right position straight away. I tried to clean up my brows with concealer after I applied the product, which didn‚Äôt look good, as anywhere the glue is, it makes it look like your skin is almost peeling. The gel is tacky and sticky, and when you use it all over your brow it doesn‚Äôt feel nice at all, and when it dries it just feels a bit like plaster, so I recommend to use this sparingly in the areas needed. What I liked: I love that this is so innovative, and such a simple concept. It‚Äôs really good for adding depth to the front of your brows, especially if you don‚Äôt have many brow hairs there and you want to bring your brows further in (it makes your nose look slimmer! ). The verdict: This is a cool product and worth a try if you‚Äôre looking to fill in your brows in the most natural way possible. I would suggest doing your brows as usual with a product that has a lot of staying power, and then sparingly applying this on top. Using just the gel only took me a few minutes to do my brows (it was quite a frustrating process), but I would definitely use it again at the front of my eyebrows after I‚Äôve applied my usual product. If you have very sparse brows, I think microblading or simply filling in your brows using a fine brow pencil in hair-like strokes is a better option, as using this product alone would take a lot of time to make it look natural on sparse brows. When it comes to celebs, we want to know ALL their beauty secrets: how do they look that flawless on the red carpet? How can someone‚Äôs hair be THAT shiny, and how can their skin be SO dewy? Seriously?! So you can imagine how psyched we were when we discovered the products they use literally cost less than a few dollars and are some of our FAV natural beauty DIYs. Check out these six insanely cool (and super easy) beauty hacks Hollywood‚Äôs most gorgeous celebs swear by. Jennifer Aniston‚Äôs Secret To Youth I think we can all agree that Jennifer Aniston looks pretty bomb ‚Äì none of us actually believe that she is 48! Our FAV Friends actress claims using Vaseline under her eyes every single night is the secret to her youthful eyes and enviably smooth under-eyes, and for a couple of dollars, we‚Äôre definitely going to try this out. Find out more Vaseline hacks here . Miranda Kerr‚Äôs Glow Alternative Miranda is basically the ultimate poster girl for glowing skin; she is always radiant! Aside from the fact it‚Äôs slightly irritating that anyone can have skin that naturally glows so luminously, her tip for switching out highlighter is pretty genius. Miranda says on her down days; she uses ChapStick or lip balm instead of highlighter to give her skin a natural, lit-from-within glow. Considering most of us have at least three lip balms lying around our homes somewhere, needless to say, this incredibly simple, but effective tip, is our new off-duty essential. Beyonce‚Äôs Sweet Tip for Kissable Lips There‚Äôs no denying that Beyonce is completely flawless in every way, and we‚Äôre certain she did wake up as perfect as she is. Fortunately for us, her amazing makeup artist Sir John shared one of his rituals for soft lips he uses on Beyonce‚Ä¶ A mix of honey and brown sugar to make an all-natural scrub for Beyonce‚Äôs lips, which creates a perfectly smooth canvas for lipsticks. Not only does it make your lips incredibly kissably soft, but honey is also super nourishing and moisturizing. Adriana Lima‚Äôs Hack For Shiny Hair If we‚Äôre going to take beauty tips from anyone, the Victoria‚Äôs Secret supermodels are on the top of our list. Not only is Adrianna Lima completely flawless in every way, but she knows a thing or two about budget-friendly beauty. Her hack for her incredibly glossy, catwalk-worthy hair? She swears by avocados, and it actually works miracles! Check out our DIY avocado hair mask . The A-List Cure-All Obsession There‚Äôs such a lengthy list of celebs touting the beneficial properties of green tea that we‚Äôve lost track, but with devotees including Jennifer Lopez, Gwyneth Paltrow, and Lady Gaga, we know it‚Äôs a winner. Whether you drink green tea or apply it to your skin, it has some pretty magical properties that have turned HB HQ into religious green tea drinkers. Check out our favorite ways to use green tea and find out all the awesome things it can do for your body here . Scarlett Johansson‚Äôs DIY Anti-Aging Toner Considering Scarlett looks the same now as she did ten years ago ‚Äì yes, that What Goes Around Video with Justin Timberlake was made in 2007, and yes, she still looks that hot! Despite that all being incredibly unfair, we can at least jump on her skincare regime, and it will cost you just a few dollars. Scarlett has been a long-time fan of apple cider vinegar as a toner because she prefers to use natural ingredients instead of harsh chemical. Apple cider vinegar has insane properties that not only make it amazing as an anti-aging, anti-acne toner, but it can also help you lose weight and get glossy hair. If chocolate were a vegetable, we‚Äôd all be healthy AF! Literally, any excuse to eat chocolate and we‚Äôre there: our friend‚Äôs birthday, it‚Äôs the weekend, it‚Äôs Monday, we need energy, chocolate goes well with coffee, it‚Äôs on offer ‚Äì there are loads of reasons to eat chocolate! But, what if you didn‚Äôt need to find an excuse to eat chocolate? Imagine if it was good for you, like if it had 6000 times the power of vitamin C, and the same health benefits you‚Äôd get from eating superfoods ‚Äì you‚Äôd be pretty intrigued, right? Well, we discovered anti-aging chocolate called Esthechoc, and it might just be our chocolate superhero. Esthechoc isn‚Äôt just any dark chocolate, it‚Äôs award-winning chocolate developed by the Cambridge Research Center in the UK, which is scientifically proven to enhance your skin. Esthechoc claims to boost antioxidant levels and increase circulation, preventing lines and promoting the youthful appearance of your skin. It gets better, you‚Äôre meant to eat one bar a day (we‚Äôre already sold), and as each bar only has 38kcal, we‚Äôre not mad at all! The tiny, tasty chocolate bars ‚Äì we have to hide them from certain HB HQ members ‚Äì have the same health benefits of eating a 300g serving of wild Alaskan salmon (500kcal) and 100g of dark chocolate (600kcal). Dark chocolate has long been reputed for its health benefits; it‚Äôs rich in antioxidants, nutrients, and vitamins, but Esthechoc is formulated with two unique ingredients that have been clinically proven to provide strong anti-aging effects without the massive intake of calories. (*nibbles on a bar of Esthechoc). How it works: Esthechoc is infused with a potent combination of two strong antioxidants, Epicatechins, which are found naturally in dark chocolate, and Astaxanthin, nature‚Äôs strongest antioxidant known to science, which is 6000 times more powerful than vitamin C, and 500 times more effective than vitamin E ‚Äì we‚Äôre impressed! The chocolate is designed to fight against the damage that our skin gets on a daily basis: from environmental pollution, UV rays, capillary degeneration, and poor diet. Over time these stresses lead to a breakdown of collagen in your skin, a lack of elasticity and firmness, poor skin hydration, cellulite, and slow skin cell turnover. What it does: Esthechoc is like a shield against the effects of environmental aging, supporting skin nutrition, maintaining healthy oxygen levels, detoxing, firming, and protecting your skin. One small bar a day can improve your skin in just three weeks by boosting skin microcirculation, improving oxygen transport in plasma, and a lot of other pretty genius science stuff that enhances the quality of your skin on a daily basis. After eight weeks, you can see a noticeable difference in crow‚Äôs feet, skin elasticity, and sebum balance on your cheeks. Where to get it: You can order the chocolate online at primemarkme.com , a 30 day supply will cost you $70, just over $2 per daily bar of chocolate. Of course, we have to put this chocolate to the test, as dedicated beauty lovers, it‚Äôs our duty to review the chocolate and see the results for ourselves. Stay tuned for an update; we‚Äôll be trying out the chocolate over a period of a month to see if we notice any difference in our skin. Whether we see results or not, it‚Äôs a great excuse to eat chocolate every day. What do you think, would you be tempted to try this chocolate? Ramadan Kareem! Ramadan is here and so is summer, and we‚Äôre all super excited! It‚Äôs a time when you go on a spiritual cleanse and try to be the best version of yourself: that means being kind, patient, and humble while also evaluating what‚Äôs most important in life and helping people as much as you can. But it‚Äôs also a challenge for Muslims because you can‚Äôt drink or eat from sunrise to sunset, (or say bad words)! And it‚Äôs not just our stomachs that fasting effects, the lack of hydration through the day definitely has a tremendous impact on our skin too, and although it‚Äôs the largest organ, it‚Äôs actually one of the last things that gets the hydration it needs. So, during Ramadan, it can be really hard to achieve that beautiful supple, glowy and hydrated look‚Ä¶ But fortunately, there are SO many ways you can cheat it! One of the first places dehydration shows is on your lips, and not only is chapped and cracking lips uncomfortable, but it‚Äôs also not very attractive‚Ä¶ and there‚Äôs no reason you shouldn‚Äôt look your best during this period! Here‚Äôs what I like to do to keep my lips soft and hydrated during Ramadan: DIY Honey Mask: One of my favorite ways to keep my lips soft and supple during Ramadan is a honey mask. It‚Äôs super easy, just slather your lips in honey every night before you go to bed, and just leave it on for 10 to 15 minutes before removing it. Honestly, this works wonders! Lanolin Products: During the day, a good lip balm is an essential. I‚Äôve always found products with Lanolin in to have THE most amazing moisturizing properties, and it‚Äôs actually because it‚Äôs a completely natural ingredient that comes from sheep‚Äôs fleeces. My favorite pure lanolin lip balms to date have to be Lanolips (which literally lasts allll day) and Dr. Lipp . Carmex is also a brilliant and contains lanolin, beeswax, shea butter, Menthol, and Aloe, which all work together to really soothe your lips. DIY Balm Take your lanolin lip balm (or another lip balm) and whip it up in a mini container with a couple of drops of rose oil. This is totally optional, but rose oil has the most amazing hydrating effects. Be sure to drink as much water as you can in the evenings so your body can catch up on the hydration it needs. dry skin Lip balm ramadan skin hydration Sun, 28 May 2017 8 Comments Related Posts 3 Tips For Kissably Soft Lips This Winter Wed, 13 Dec 2017 Sheep‚Äôs Wool for Softer Lips?! DAILY DOSE | SUMMER HAIR By Huda Heidi Kattan It‚Äôs summer time and if you‚Äôre anywhere close to the equator, it‚Äôs HOT! With all the humidity, let‚Äôs face it, our hair just doesn‚Äôt like us as much! Adjusting to climate change is essential not only with your wardrope, but especially your hair! Here are my summer tips for taking the best care of your mane. Get UV Protected! The sun is so powerful and the heat can do a great number on your hair. One of the best ways to protect your hair during the summer, is to buy a UV protector for your hair. One of my favorite products for sun protection is the Redken ColorExtend which has soplexyl, which helps prevent sun damage. Simply spray it on before you leave the house. Go Easy on the Blowdry! We all love perfectly styled hair, but with the humidity and heat, it‚Äôs best to let your hair go au naturale. If you must blowdry, try to skip one in between! When I do blowdry my hair, I use Kerastase Oleo Relax serum with Morrocan Oil , which seriously fights frizz! Fake the Beach! A great way to prolong a blowout is to spray your hair with a curl spray. I love the Bumble & Bumble Surf Spray . It literally looks like I went to the beach and it‚Äôs a great way to style my hair before the next blowdry! Right when my hair is ready to wash, I take one extra day to get a great beach inspired do, and your friends will love it! Keep it Real! If you do want to go with your natural curls, try using a good cream that can fight humidity. I like to use Frederic Fekkai‚Äôs Lucious Curl Cream for the summer, which keeps my curls beautiful all day long! Be an Opportunist! Take advantage of the sun! When ever I know I will be in the sun, I take the chance to put a great hydrating mask on my hair and let the sun‚Äôs heat really soak it in! I usually use coconut oil or vatika oil, but really any type of hair mask, oil, treatment, etc, will work! Quick Note: If you can‚Äôt find the Morrocan Oil in Dubai or wherever you are, try any Argan Oil, I know Kiehl‚Äôs has a selection of Argan Oils. Since Bumble & Bumble is also hard to find, for the Surf Spray, try mixing a cup of water with a tablespoon of sea salt and spray on your hair. image courtesy of agirlsgottaspa argan at beach blow bumble coconut color curl dry extend fekkai frederic frizz hair home kerastase kiehl's lucious mask morrocan oil oleo redken relax soplexyl spray summer surf waves Sat, 26 Jun 2010 7 Comments Related Posts The Product You NEED for Gorgeous Beach Waves Mon, 3 Oct 2016 My New Secret Weapon: Dallas Thickening Spray Sun, 22 Jan 2017 How I Get Sleek Hair Without Any Damage! FALL TRENDS | HAIR By Huda Heidi Kattan Do I like to make a statement? Heck yeah! And one of those statements is being with the latest trends! Growing up in a small city in Tennessee, I still always wanted to know the latest trends to come out of Paris and New York. Things haven‚Äôt changed too much! With winter being just around the corner, here are some of my favorite hair trends to start wearing now and through the cold! (above: Ombre Hair, perfect to soften features and keep hair looking super trendy! This look has been made famous by celebrities including Drew Berrymore and Rachel Bilson! Perfect for any women who loves highlights in the summer and wants to stay trendy) Luscious Soft Curls look great on nearly face shape and seem to suit every women, no matter how her features are set. Super feminine and classy, this look is a great day look that looks well put together and chic! Side swept bangs are perfect for women who have larger features and want may not be able to rock blunt bangs! This is a great way to make bangs work, while softening your features! Sleek Strands are super sultry and make the great winter companion! They say winter in a very haute way! I love how simplistic they are and since winter can be very dry, it‚Äôs a great time to skip a wash if possible and opt for a dry shampoo! Fiery Red Locks, Christina Hendricks has literally made red hair the hottest thing on the planet! We all dread the time of the month when our period comes; you know the stomach cramps, the headaches, and our crazy high emotions. That said, there‚Äôs no reason you can‚Äôt continue to be the badass girl boss that you are the other three weeks of the month, and having a period that‚Äôs chill af is totally possible ‚Äì we promise! So, to make your time of the month a little more zen, we‚Äôve got the top tips on how to conquer PMS once and for all. Never be caught off guard There‚Äôs nothing worse being surprised by your period when you could‚Äôve sworn you weren‚Äôt due for another week. To make sure this never happens, track your period not just in your diary but by using apps like Clue and MyFlo . It can literally tell you everything, from the date that you‚Äôre due to the day you‚Äôll most likely experience cramps, and when you‚Äôll be heaviest. MyFlo will even tell you what food and workouts you should be doing at certain times so that you‚Äôre more productive and less likely to feel the typical painful symptoms. Oil up! Essential oils are the answer to your problems, which means you can ditch the pharmaceuticals. Essential oils heal naturally, so grab any oil that is known for soothing like lavender or chamomile. Our favorite oil to pop into the diffuser is Ylang Ylang as it has sedative and antispasmodic properties, which help reduce cramps and mood swings. If you don‚Äôt have a diffuser, you can put a couple of drops in your bath or dilute it with a carrier oil (like coconut oil) and massage it directly on to your stomach. Eat with your period in mind It‚Äôs time to put the chocolate down and resist those cravings because fatty, sugary foods are only going to heighten your PMS ‚Äì although let‚Äôs be honest, we‚Äôll probably still nibble on some chocolate! You only crave these foods because your serotonin levels are running low and although they‚Äôll give you a quick fix, it‚Äôs not what your body really needs. Instead eat foods that are packed with iron , (or take iron supplements) like spinach, quinoa, and dark chocolate (we got you covered), as these can help prevent anemia, triggered by the loss of blood during menstruation. Bananas are also a great sweet alternative as they release glucose and potassium at a steady rate so that they‚Äôll elevate your mood for longer, while they‚Äôll also get rid of that irritating bloated feeling. Crack open the gin Now, don‚Äôt get us wrong we know that alcohol is not usually the answer, but having a G&T on your period can actually help alleviate pain. This is because the gin will not only relax your joints and muscles, but the juniper berries have an antiseptic effect. But stay clear of any other alcohol and keep your G&T intake to a two-drink maximum otherwise it will have the opposite result. You can also try Dry Soda‚Äôs Juniper Berry soft drink, for a non-alcohol version if you prefer. Get the gang over We‚Äôre firm believers that there are few things a girl‚Äôs night can‚Äôt fix, and your period‚Äôs no different, you just have to cater it to your monthly needs. So, get your girlfriends over because chances are your cycles have synced due to an increase of the luteinizing hormone (the hormone that controls ovulation) in your shared airspace. Trade your pillows for hot water bottles as the heat will relax your abdominal muscles while sending signals to your brain to distract you from the cramps. It‚Äôs also the perfect opportunity for a DIY mask, so you don‚Äôt have to look as bad as you feel, check out our fav masks here. And of course, for your next girl‚Äôs night in, here‚Äôre our fav movies to help you feel better: Mean Girls, Clueless, Bridesmaids, How To Lose A Guy In 10 Days, Grease, She‚Äôs The Man, Bridget Jones‚Äôs Diary, Pretty Woman, Legally Blonde, Chicago‚Äì we‚Äôre totally debating spending an entire day watching these in the office with popcorn and chocolate. DAILY DOSE | FAN QUESTION By Huda Heidi Kattan Hello Huda, I read your blog every day when I get to work, is like therapy. Since I have moved to Dubai I notice that my skin and hair are crazy. My hair specially has lost the shiny looks like before. I have serious problem because the way my hair looks and now I really hate how its so dry and not looking healthy like before. Please right back, because I look to you and I think is great what you do. Please help Darling! OMG! If I only had a dime everyone told their hair and skin has changed when they moved to Dubai! First but foremost, the complete environment changes factors in your hair, skin and body anytime you travel! The main influences that can alter what you may be used to for hair and skin are weather, water, hormones in food, and of course any changes in diet! Anytime I travel, I pack my skin kit and hair kit according to where I am traveling to and I definitely don‚Äôt use the same things all across the world! For instance, when I am in very dry climates, like some areas on the coast in the states (for example Boston or California), I typically use skin care products that are very hydrating! One of my favorite face creams to use when I am in LA or the Bean is Shiseido Face Cream . While when I am in wetter climates, like Dubai, etc is the Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizer , since it is quite moisturizing, but still light enough to keep me from melting! Unlike your skin, which can sometimes improve when you hit more humid climates, hair can be super difficult to deal with when traveling! One of the best things to do is to keep your diet in check! It‚Äôs always great to start with healthy vitamins and foods! Some of the best foods to eat for your hair are walnuts, salmon, and flaxseeds. Keeping Omega-3 in your diet will literally transform your hair! My hair use to be soooo dull and when I started eating Salmon as well Walnuts, my hair changed sooo much! It started to shine (like from far away!) and it stopped falling out! Of course adjusting the rest of your products with your environment, can happen over time, but I love using Argan Oil (which you can find from Kiehl‚Äôs) as well as Kerastase Oleo Relax. I usually use a bit more Argan Oil in Dubai than I do in other countries to keep my hair in check! image credits allure beauty hair health Mon, 14 Mar 2011 5 Comments Related Posts The BEST Way to Wash Your Hair, Start doing this NOW! One of the things I love about being a beauty blogger is getting the chance to discover new brands, try new and exciting products, and share them with you. My latest discovery is a new brand called MAKE Beauty ; they‚Äôre all about self-expression and breaking the beauty rules ‚Äì I love that! While recently shopping on Net-A-Porter, I noticed one of their products, the Sea Salt Exfoliator & Marine Lip Repair kit, so I had to check it out. I was intrigued; would my lips be the softest they‚Äôve ever been? Could this be my new beauty staple? What it is: A two-step rejuvenating lip repair kit that includes a sea salt exfoliating scrub and a protective lip balm. What it does: With real sea salt crystals suspended in a soothing oil-based cream, the scrub gently buffs away dead skin and polishes away dry skin while the oil simultaneously smooths lips. The balm instantly soothes lips with natural oils, while Shea Butter adds long-lasting hydration. What we liked: I love that 10% of sales are donated to the We See Beauty Foundation that supports women-led businesses in poor communities ‚Äì I think that is so amazing. I also think the packaging is cute and simple, even if it does give me a bit of a Topshop vibe. I tried the scrub (more on that later) and followed it with the marine lip repair. The lip repair formula is unusual; it‚Äôs very gooey and stays on your lips forever and because it doesn‚Äôt move I found it very hydrating. It‚Äôs also very sticky, and although they say this can be used as a lip primer, I‚Äôm not sure that would work well under lipsticks as it is so thick. I think this would be an amazing overnight treatment so you can wake up with super soft lips, but for daytime, I‚Äôd rather wear a Liquid Matte. What we didn‚Äôt like: The results were great, but I can‚Äôt say I was a fan of the process. The scrub was strange, it kind of smells like medicine and because it‚Äôs salt, well, you know that‚Äôs not going to taste good! I can‚Äôt fault the scrubbing effect, it worked really well, and it was oily, not dry, so it‚Äôs a comfortable formula to use. However, the fact that I could taste it meant I didn‚Äôt want to leave it on my lips for very long. I wish they had used sugar because I think it would have tasted much better and scrubbed a little more. I didn‚Äôt find this lip repair kit life-changing, and I‚Äôd still go to my La Mer lip products over this. It‚Äôs not a bad product, but it‚Äôs just not a new favorite for me. I love brands that try new things, and I love the ethical background of this brand, so I definitely think it‚Äôs one to watch, and I look forward to trying their makeup collections. DAILY DOSE | BEAUTY RECIPE By Huda Heidi Kattan I am serious germ-a-phob! I have to constantly wash my hands or use antibacterial! As much as I love protecting my hands against bacteria, constant exposure to hot water and alcohol has made them dry and not-so-softt! In my opinion, nothing is more appealing than feeling a person‚Äôs soft silky hands. This is why I try to use a hand scrub followed by intense moisture as often as possible. Want soft hands? Check out this recipe for at home hand scrub! Silky Soft Hand Scrub Ingredients 1 cup sugar 3-4 tablespoons olive oil 2 tablespoons water 3-4 drops Essential Oil (optional) In a bowl, mix sugar, olive oil and water until solution is lump free, add essential oil. With one hand, scoop out a handful of scrub and rub on each hand in a circular motion. Rub until you feel your hands are the desired level of softness. Let Air Dry: Even if you plan on blowdrying, let your hair air dry for a few minutes before you begin. It really makes a huge difference when you know your hair will have a protective layer that will help seal moisture in! Savor Your Do: Try to avoid touching your hair too much after it‚Äôs done! This way you avoid adding too many oils to your hair and you can keep it styled as long as possible! Blowdrying your hair too much, can cause severe damage as well as hair loss! When I first heard about the new Dyson Supersonic Blow Dryer, to be honest, I wasn‚Äôt impressed. To me it looks like a gimmick and I have a hard time trusting a futurisic, strange, ufo-like product; or something I would imagine like an out-of-this-world, supersonic gun in a movie. So I didn‚Äôt buy into the hype‚Ä¶ just yet. When Jen Atkin came into the office, she told me how much technology Dyson invested into this blow dryer. My thoughts were, ‚Äúokay, they spent $72 million on this product, four years of hair research and 103 engineers were working on a single hair dryer. There‚Äôs got to be something good about it.‚Äù (there should be!) So I bought it, and yes, I thought it‚Äôs expensive, but if it‚Äôs really what everyone says it is ‚Äì I consider it a good investment. Here‚Äôs what I thought. What I love about it: It is indeed a powerful hair dryer! It just blows super awesome, it sucks all the air in like a vacuum and blows it out in a straight and totally smooth way. (BTW Dyson is initially, and surprisingly, a vacuum manufacturing company so no surprise there that they have the whole air-flow game perfected!) It is absolutely fast drying as well. My usual hair drying session lasts for an hour but with this one, it can be done within 15 to 20 minutes only. I also love how easy the controls are, anybody can understand it. There are four buttons, one each to turn it on, to make it cool, for intensity and heat preference. I love that the diffusers are magnetic and they go right on easily. And then the length of the cord is 9 feet long‚Ä¶I mean how many times does it happen to you that the cord is too short to reach the mirror?! Other brands just don‚Äôt get how important that is. Overall, the way it functions is just impressive. When I tested it, my team were hooked and we actually took turns using it!! The moment you turn it on, you‚Äôll notice the big difference between the Dyson hair dryer and a classic hair dryer. What I wish they have done: The major concern for me is the heat. The brand claims it can measure the air temperature 20 times more so it can control the heat and prevent damage. But the hot is just so hot, it seems you will burn yourself when you are not careful. Also, it is agreeably lightweight (a motor in an acorn-like size and total weight of only 1.8 lbs.) and I love that, but I wish it was more lightweight and I wish there‚Äôs a smaller, travel version because this is such a powerful tool and I would love to bring it on my travels. I just wish there‚Äôs an easier click system for the cleaning filter as well. Would I recommend it: I have a bunch of blow dryers and although I love my classic blow dryers, this one has made me think I‚Äôm never gonna use any other blow dryer but this one. (until a better one comes out!) I haven‚Äôt used blow dryers for a long time simply because it takes forevaaahhhh, but since I got this, I‚Äôve been blow drying again. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who loves blow drying at home. It is fast drying, smooth, fights frizz and so easy to use. It is an advanced, futuristic, and revolutionary blow dryer. Like the blow dryer ahead of its time, or the blow dryer of 2020. Even though there‚Äôs nothing we love more than when the snow starts to fall, unfortunately, our hair doesn‚Äôt feel the same way. The dry winter weather likes to mess with our blow dry and give us back the frizzy hair we worked so hard to smooth out ‚Äì we‚Äôre basically Ugly Betty when winter comes. Because our hair is hygroscopic, which means it matches the moisture content of the surrounding environment, in winter our hair usually gets majorly dehydrated due to the dry air. So, when you‚Äôre in a heated room or the cold outdoors, your hair will expel moisture until it matches the climate that it‚Äôs in. Without moisture, your hair is prone to breakage, split ends, damaged hair follicles, and you can even experience hair loss ‚Äì not cool! But fortunately for our hair, we‚Äôve got six tips that will help your hair look flawless AF in no time at all. Go easy when you towel-dry Okay, we all know too much heat on our hair is bad (we‚Äôre not going there again), but it‚Äôs actually the way we dry our hair with a towel that‚Äôs doing the damage. More often than not, we twist and rub our hair dry with a towel, but this is a HUGE mistake as it‚Äôs what causes the hair follicles to break ‚Äì et voila, flyaways. Instead, you can use a soft T-shirt or a microfiber towel as they cause less friction, or just make sure you very gently ‚Äòblot‚Äô your hair with a towel, like you would with your face. Dryer Sheets are your best friend We know this sounds weird, but during the colder months, dryer sheets are THE solution to getting rid of frizzy hair and flyaways. The way they work is simple: when you glide them through your locks, the negatively charged surface of your hair bonds to the positively charged ingredients of the dryer sheet, reducing the static, leaving your hair super sleek. Get regular trims We think it‚Äôs safe to say that we‚Äôre all guilty of skipping a scheduled trim, and although you may be able to pass it off as ‚Äòbeachy waves‚Äô in the summer, it‚Äôs not as easy in the winter. Try to get a trim every six to eight weeks to side step split and brittle ends. Just be sure to ask a for a trim when you book your appointment, as tons of salons do a trim for half the price. Or, if you‚Äôre feeling brave, try out our hack for getting rid of split ends on your own: A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Aug 30, 2016 at 8:52am PDT Don‚Äôt cook your hair When our alarm goes off in the winter, the only thing that gets us out of bed is the thought of a steaming hot shower. But as hard as it may be, you need to take a shorter shower that isn‚Äôt boiling, because prolonged periods of extra hot water can damage your hair follicles and will strip your hair of essential oils that lock in moisture. Our top tip is to end your shower with a cold water rinse, as this helps to smooth your hair cuticles, which are more easily able to reflect light, therefore looking less dull. Brush with care We know it may sound a bit extra but it‚Äôs essential to use different brushes for when your hair is wet and dry. For wet hair: A plastic comb or brush is best, as this will eliminate any pulling, ripping, tugging or tearing, which will minimize breakage. For dry hair: If your hair tangles easily, avoid using a plastic comb when it‚Äôs dry, as it will only make it more static. Instead, use a metal bristled brush as this will act as a conductor of static and will give your hair a smoother finish. Nourish your hair from the inside No matter how many miracle hair products you use, if you want tresses like a Victoria‚Äôs Secret model you need to eat with your mane in mind. Look for foods that are high in antioxidants and vitamins, so stock up on your fruit and veg. Vitamin C is perfect for the winter months as it helps produce collagen, which will strengthen the capillaries of the hair shafts. Kidney beans, lentils or leafy greens like spinach are also great as they‚Äôre not only full of protein, which promotes hair growth, but also iron and zinc. Low levels of zinc and iron are the main causes of hair loss and dullness, so make sure you incorporate these into your diet ASAP. Long nails have been trending for a while, and Instagram is full of gorgeous lust-worthy pics of super long nails. In fact, we‚Äôve been fans for a really long time! But finally, we‚Äôve come to a point when we‚Äôve realized that more than anything, long nails just get in the way of life. So we‚Äôre making the switch to shorter nails, and here‚Äôs why: 1) The stress of long nails potentially breaking is too much to handle. Not only are they fragile and more likely to break, but when they do, it‚Äôs so noticeable it feels like the worst thing in the world. 2) You‚Äôll finally be able to dress yourself again! Zips, buttons, shoe buckles, earring backs‚Ä¶ yeah, you‚Äôll be able to get ready all on your own. 3) You can text. Not only is having nails a normal length hugely practical when you‚Äôre trying to type a message quickly, but it‚Äôs a way more peaceful process without all the tapping going on. Who can relate? üòÇüòÇüòÇ A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Oct 1, 2017 at 11:30am PDT 4) You can play with makeup again. With shorter nails comes greater precision, you can finally use your finger to apply and intensify foiled eyeshadows, and you don‚Äôt need to worry about stabbing your powder formulas accidentally. 5) Just imagine all the money you can save on manicures and nail polish! Not only will you be saving a ton of money on your polish and acrylic, but the maintenance is dramatically reduced. 6) You won‚Äôt poke your eyes out trying to do the simplest things: Wearing contacts, applying false lashes, rubbing your eye‚Ä¶ Yep, all of that is no longer a hazard to your eyesight when your nails are shorter. 7) Nail art looks cuter! For some reason, tiny little nail designs just look so much better on shorter nails. 8) Shorter nails feel a little more hygienic! It‚Äôs not to say that longer nails are dirty, but if you‚Äôre a long nail fangirl, you‚Äôll know there‚Äôs no avoiding certain things embedding themselves under your nails ‚Äì although they do come in particularly helpful as a toothpick after meals, ewww! 9) Long nails are fun and all, but we kinda feel like shorter nails are a little bit cooler. 10) Basically, we‚Äôre just over super long nails‚Ä¶ even if they did make us feel like a mermaid! A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on May 4, 2017 at 9:35am PDT If you‚Äôre worried short nails might not make your hands look as good, check out our nail shape guide to choose a nail shape to flatter your hands!
