When you‚Äôre sitting at your desk all day, it‚Äôs easy to put on a few pounds. Not to mention, if your office is anything like Huda Beauty HQ, the constant supply of food is a continual test of your will-power! Don‚Äôt get us wrong, we love our curvy selves, and so should you, but we‚Äôre all for upping our fitness levels. We spoke to amazing personal trainer, fitness guru, and contributor for Men‚Äôs Health magazine, Jeremy Gwyer ( check out his IG account , you won‚Äôt regret it) to get his top, super-easy fitness tips. Even if you‚Äôre as lazy (or as busy) as many of us, we reckon you can still do at least a few of these a day. And DW, you can do these in your heels, skinny jeans, or whatever boujee outfit you‚Äôre wearing to the office: 1. Cut Back on Inter-Office emails If the person you‚Äôre emailing works in the same office or even building, get up out of your chair and deliver the message in person. Every minute of movement burns more calories than every minute seated! 2. Take the stairs Okay, maybe not every floor, but you can do the first five! Stair climbing is one of the most effective ways to tone and shape your legs. If your office is located higher than the 5th floor, every morning, lunch break, and evening, take the stairs from the ground floor to the 5th, then take the elevator the rest of the way. 3. Squeeze your booty The simple act of squeezing your muscles can help tone and strengthen them. If you can‚Äôt get out of your chair due to meetings or important calls, spend five minutes squeezing your butt, leg and abdominal muscles. For example: Squeeze the butt muscle 20 times, then the abs 20 times, then the legs 20 times. Try to repeat this at least five times during the day. 4. Walking Meetings Instead of sitting around the table of the meeting room, get moving. Discuss the business matters while burning some extra calories! If you have a big office, take a walk around it with your colleague while you ask your questions or give your weekly update. If your office is smaller, then suggest going for a juice or smoothie and get chatting on the way. 5. Drink more Water ‚Ä¶ and your metabolism increases! Staying hydrated also helps to keep feelings of hunger at bay and fills up your stomach. Replace your sweetened (or sugar-free) drinks with water, and you‚Äôll lose more weight ‚Äì period! If you‚Äôre not a fan of plain H20, add some fresh lemon or cucumber slices to give it some flavor! Aim to drink at least 2 liters of water a day ( see why you should be here ), and keep track by always having a bottle of water on your desk. Set yourself challenges ‚Äì like finishing two bottles of water bottle before lunch, or drinking a green tea every afternoon with one bottle of water before you leave work ‚Äì to make sure you‚Äôre hitting your daily target. fitness get fit health Wed, 3 Jan 2018 4 Comments Related Posts Lazy Girl Hacks: 4 Easy And Free Tips To Banish Arm‚Ä¶ Tue, 16 Jan 2018 4 Super Easy DIY Drinks To Detox And Slim, NOW! PRODUCT | GROW LUSCIOUS By Huda Heidi Kattan I really wasn‚Äôt going to give this mascara too much attention, but after hearing so many great things about it, I decided to try it. Gucci Westman told me that Cameron Diaz loved the mascara so much, she actually requested a box full! Personally, I have been a Dior Show girl since I can remember, but recently, I have made a switch, permanently! Luckily with technology improvements, mascara has revolutionized to bring us mascaras that now make our lashes look dramatic and keep them growing long and beautiful. While you could dish out 100+ AED ($20+) to get mascara that could revive your lashes, the people at Revlon understand that quality doesn‚Äôt need to cost a fortune. Their new Grow Luscious Mascara has been my newest obsession. I seriously swear by this! It makes your lashes look beautiful, but the best part about the mascara is the affect on your lashes. My lashes have grown longer and have barely fallen out since I have starting using this mascara. I HIGHLY recommend this mascara, but try using it over a period of two weeks to notice improvements. If you have a mascara that you can‚Äôt part from, try applying it over the Grow Luscious. Start with the Grow Luscious, so that the formula will be directly on your lashes, thus you will reap all the beautiful benefits! FOOD & HEALTH | MEAT By Huda Heidi Kattan I‚Äôm honestly not even sure if I should be sharing this with you and if you have a weak stomach, it might be good to avoid reading further, but I found this very important especially for those who love chicken nuggets or patties as much as I do! The pink lump of goo is actually chicken that has been separated mechanically and pushed through a machine that mashes it all together! Pretty gross huh? Well, it gets better! The mashed chicken then needs to be cleaned, since it is covered with bacteria, and is soaked in chemicals, including ammonia. After that, it is then articificially infused with chicken flavoring and then dyed white to look like ‚Äúreal‚Äù chicken. Yum! I think I may just never have chicken nuggets again! If you‚Äôre prone to hyperpigmentation, you‚Äôve probably tried a ton of products to hide it and found that most only give disappointing results. Though hyperpigmentation is completely harmless, those dark patches ‚Äì caused by excess melanin that forms deposits of brown pigment in the skin ‚Äì can be a bitch to cover up. Fortunately, we‚Äôve got all the tips for how you can keep your pigmentation under control, hide it, and gradually reduce it. Our top pigmentation-covering products: 1: Make Up For Ever Full Cover Concealer, $34 This intensely pigmented cream formula is designed specifically for covering scars, tattoos, hyperpigmentation, and marks. A little goes a VERY long way, so even if you use this every day, it will probably last you six months. Just dab the formula onto the area you want to conceal with your fingertip, and it will set to a completely matte-finish that lasts all day. Shop it here . 2: Huda Beauty #FauxFilter Foundation, $40 For effortless coverage, our #FauxFilter foundation creates a flawless filter-like finish that will evenly and easily cover pigmentation. The formula is packed with ultra-refined pigments so that when it‚Äôs stippled onto the skin, it immediately camouflages dark areas. For extra coverage, the formula can be easily layered and then set with a powder for seamless all-day coverage. Shop it here . 3: Kevyn Aucoin The Sensual Skin Enhancer Concealer and Foundation, $48 Created by one of the most talented makeup artists of all time, you know anything from the Kevyn Aucoin brand is going to be amazing. This extra rich, creamy formula binds color-correcting shades and intense pigments with honey, Jojoba oil, and minerals for a formula that melts into your skin while providing foolproof coverage. Take a rice-sized amount on a concealer brush and gently press into the skin, blending the edges. Set with a dusting of powder. Shop it here . When blending a concealer, either use a small concealer brush and pack it on or use the pointed end of a DRY beauty blender, which will keep the coverage full. Our top tip: Use an orange or red-toned color corrector on areas of pigmentation before applying foundation or concealer ‚Äì allowing it to set first. The orange tone balances out the brown color of the pigmentation. If you have fair-to-medium skin, use a peachy shade, for medium, tan, and deep skin tones, orange works amazingly for creating the best base, and for richer skin tones, red works best to cover pigmentation. You can use liquid lipsticks on areas around your mouth, cheeks, and forehead, just be careful using them around your sensitive eye area; try shades Mamacita or Heartbreaker . A post shared by Nabela Noor (@nabela) on Nov 15, 2017 at 11:24am PST Our FAV DIYs for lightening pigmentation and dark spots: Raw Potato: Potato contains an enzyme called catecholase, which helps to lighten skin. Cut a potato into thick slices, then add a drop of water (or lemon juice) to the surface and rub it onto the area of pigmentation for around five or ten minutes. Do this morning and evening, and you should start to see results after a month. Apple Cider Vinegar: ACV is one of our all-time fav natural ingredients (see why it‚Äôs so awesome here ), and it has natural AHAs that penetrate deep into the skin and can help lighten skin tone. Dampen a cotton pad with water and add ACV, and wipe it over the affected area every morning and night. Red light therapy and retinol are also amazing for improving the appearance of pigmentation, and you will see much swifter results, get all the details about retinol here . This Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA formula ($13) from The Ordinary is specifically designed to target pigmentation. Finally, make sure you always wear an SPF, as this will prevent your hyperpigmentation from darkening further. concealers for pigmentation Hyperpigmentation pigmentation Fri, 24 Nov 2017 3 Comments Related Posts Concealer 101: How To Hide Dark Circles And Pimples! A Nude Lip, in my opinion, is THE sexiest lip a girl can wear. So obviously, I was dying to get my hands, and lips, on the latest Kylie Cosmetics collaboration with her big sister Kim. The KKW Cr√®me Liquid Lipstick collection includes four super pretty pinky nude shades, AND they‚Äôre in a completely new formula ‚Äì not a gloss or a matte! This new formula reeeeally intrigued me and I was very excited to finally try these out! Appropriately named with Kim‚Äôs nicknames ‚Äì Kimberly, Kim, Kiki, and Kimmie ‚Äì the whole vibe of the collection is cute and girly, just like the brand. What it is: Four nude colored creamy liquid lipsticks offering sheer to medium coverage, which can be layered to build intensity. What it does: The formula contains ingredients to moisturize and hydrate your lips, while the gloss-like texture glides onto lips for a lightweight feeling. What we liked: I looove the packaging, and the colors are SOOO stunning! They feel super comfortable, and have a really nice texture to them. However, when I removed the product, my lips didn‚Äôt feel particularly hydrated. They lasted long enough as well, and with a couple of layers, the finish was a beautiful, soft sheen. My favorite has to be Kimberly; it‚Äôs such a subtle and wearable nude. What we didn‚Äôt like: Although the cr√®me is comfortable, the pay off is quite sheer, and I prefer my lipsticks to have more coverage. I tried mixing it with a liquid matte, but the combination seemed too intense, and the lightest color, Kimberly, turned out really light and chalky. If you guys get this collection and want a more opaque finish, use a liquid lipstick and then apply a very small amount of lip cr√®me at the center and blend out. I can‚Äôt help it, I‚Äôm a matte liquid lipstick lover! I kind of wish these were in a liquid matte formula, but the colors are really really pretty so I‚Äôll definitely enjoy wearing these shades. It‚Äôs a well-known fact that beauty editors have one of the most envied jobs in the world; who wouldn‚Äôt want to have the best beauty products landing on their desk every day? With access to the hottest products on the planet, an insight into the latest must-have ingredients, and tricks up their sleeves from years of beauty editing, who better to reveal their all-time favorite products than New York‚Äôs most distinguished beauty editors! So, we asked these five beauty connoisseurs to narrow down their trusted favorites and share their top three ride-or-die products with us‚Ä¶ Jenna Rennert, Associate Beauty Editor, Vogue Shu Uemura Eyelash Curler: When I was 14, my high school sent every student on a mandatory outward bound program in the Everglades for a week. Most kids brought protein bars or mini battery-powered fans as their desert island item. I bought an eyelash curler ‚Äì still can‚Äôt live without one to this day. The Drybar Detox: No one should ever leave the house without a mini can of dry shampoo. Drybar‚Äôs formula is like a reset button for your hair ‚Äì instant blowout refresh. Bonus points if you spray pre-workout; it always helps my hair feel cleaner post sweat! Tom Ford Tobacco Vanilla: My signature scent, there‚Äôs absolutely nothing out there like it. I always spritz my clothes with 1-2 pumps before getting dressed ‚Äì really subtle and not overpowering at all. Follow Jenna on Instagram . Shop Jenna‚Äôs beauty favs: the curler , the dry shampoo , the perfume . Kahlana Barfield Brown, Editor at Large, InStyle Nars Matte Velvet Lip Pencil In Dragon Girl : I wear this red lipstick almost every day ‚Äì literally! It‚Äôs the perfect red for dark skin. It‚Äôs blue-based and completely matte without being drying. I layer it on nice and strong, so it really pops. Eve Lom Face Cleanser: I‚Äôve been using this cleanser consistently for the past two years, and I love it. It‚Äôs a balm that you apply to dry skin, massage across your face, then rinse with a damp cloth. It gets rid of all traces of makeup and leaves your skin feeling super moisturized. Lancome Grandiose Mascara: I have wildly curly lashes and this mascara keeps them tame. The bristles really get in there and stretch my lashes from root to tips for major length and lift. Follow Kahlana on Instagram . Shop Kahlana‚Äôs beauty favs: the lip pencil , the cleanser , the mascara . Jessica Chia, Senior Beauty Editor, Allure Dr. Fill in Women‚Äôs Edge and Fill Powder: This dark powder was originally created to fill in guys‚Äô beards and bald spots, but it doubles as the best brow product. I use it with an angled liner brush to create long, arched brows every day (mine are naturally short and stubby), and on special occasions. On nights out when I know there‚Äôll be flash photography, I use it on the front of my parting so that it looks a bit tighter and fuller (this is something celebs do so you never see obvious scalp). Wherever I apply it, it goes on smoothly and absolutely never budges. Harklinikken Hair Extract: This might not sound sexy ‚Äì but after experiencing unexplained hair thinning last year, this botanical serum is the only thing that fixed my widening part and bald patches at my temples. I‚Äôve been using it for a year now, and I‚Äôm happy to report that not only has my hair returned, but it‚Äôs also thicker and longer than it‚Äôs ever been. Eminence Organic Facial Recovery Oil: I have breakout-prone skin, but using this clarifying facial oil every morning keeps my skin super-glowy and keeps my pores clear. It‚Äôs really strengthened my skin barrier, so it‚Äôs less sensitive overall, and I always get compliments on how healthy my skin looks. Plus, it doesn‚Äôt contain any gross chemical ingredients! Follow Jessica on Instagram . Shop Jessica‚Äôs beauty favs: the powder , the serum , the face oil . Bee Shapiro, Writer for The New York Times, Vanity Fair, Glamour Ellis Brooklyn Sci Fi Eau de Parfum: I‚Äôve never been a vanilla fan, but when I worked with perfumer Jerome Epinette on this beauty for my fragrance line, he really blew me away. He took vanilla to another otherworldly level ‚Äì it‚Äôs blended with green tea and bitter orange for a unique take that has the sweetness, but finishes clean and modern. Omorovicza Mineral UV Shield: I only do mineral sunscreens ‚Äì why put more chemicals on your skin than necessary when there are terrific mineral options out there now? This one, hands down, is the best one I‚Äôve ever tried. It‚Äôs weightless, melds into skin nicely, and there‚Äôs this lovely matte finish that‚Äôs almost like a blur primer. Diorshow Brow Styler Ultra-Fine Precision Brow Pencil: There are so many brow products out now, but I just keep going back to this wonder pencil. The formula is the perfect amount of waxiness, so it doesn‚Äôt slip, and the color (I use universal dark brown) is on point ‚Äì not too dark as brunette colors can be. Follow Bee on Instagram . Shop Bee‚Äôs beauty favs: the perfume , the sunscreen , the brow pencil . Jennifer Goldstein, Executive Beauty Editor, Marie Claire, and Co-Host of Fat Mascara Blinc Mascara in Black: I co-host a podcast called Fat Mascara, so you know I try every mascara out there. The thing is, they all smudge or run on me. (I think it‚Äôs a combo of having long lashes and oily lids ‚Äì who knows?) The only one that stays put is Blinc, a ‚Äòtubing‚Äô mascara that wraps your lashes in little black tubes that don‚Äôt budge until you wet your lashes and gently press on them to slide them off. If you‚Äôre after major volume or a spiky editorial look, this mascara won‚Äôt do it; but if you want to define, darken, and separate and never worry about raccoon eyes, this is the bomb. Skin Medica TNS Essential Serum: I have no problem with the word antiaging because I. Don‚Äôt. Want. To. Look. Old. There, I said it. In an attempt to stave off all the signs of aging, I use this morning and night. The key ingredient, in my opinion, is the epidermal growth factors, which do everything retinol does‚Äîand then some‚Äîbut without any of the irritation. Use it for 30 days so you can really see the effects: lines are softened, skin tone is evened, and you just have this plumper more radiant look. Blum Naturals Daily Dry/Sensitive Skin Towelettes: When trying products all day long is part of your job, you need a workhorse makeup wipe, and these are mine. They remove most color cosmetics quickly and easily, but the major reason I love them is that they don‚Äôt make my skin or eyes sting. Like, at all. I first tried them when a stranger offered me one after an AKT fitness class ‚Äì I must have looked like a hot mess ‚Äì and now I buy them in bulk from Amazon every few months. Follow Jennifer on Instagram . If your latest skin care product is failing to give you the glowy skin of every beauty ad you‚Äôve ever seen, then don‚Äôt worry, we know the reason, and we have a solution. It seems that no matter how reliable a product claims to be, when you get to the three-month mark the miracle that once took hold of your skin is slowly vanishing. At this point, we decide the product isn‚Äôt as good as we previously believed and instantly regret telling all our girlfriends, colleagues, and anyone who will listen, that this new product is THE bomb. There‚Äôs such a thing as a 3-month ‚Äòick‚Äô ‚Äì and it doesn‚Äôt just relate to the people you‚Äôre dating ‚Äì it basically means that after your new moisturizer starts to change your life, it will eventually plateau. When you start to see improvements, your faith in the product increases. By week 12 you‚Äôre expecting to be even more impressed, but this is actually the stage when the effects of your favorite cream will begin to diminish as your skin builds up a resistance to the ingredient. Now before you get upset, this won‚Äôt be the case with every single product you love ‚Äì thank god! This is mainly regarding products you‚Äôre using that include super active ingredients, like retinol. The fact is you need to switch up your skincare routine regularly ‚Äì like interval training for your skin. Now, as the seasons are changing, it‚Äôs the perfect time to reevaluate your skincare routine and see what you need to change with the cooler weather. It‚Äôs actually easy: if you‚Äôre using a retinol cream (find out why you probably should be here ), every few months swap it with another of your fav ingredients, maybe an AHA or a hydrating serum. Try two sets of products that have different primary active ingredients, which you can alternate every few months, that way your skin will get the most out of each ingredient, and you‚Äôll get that dewy glow all year round. You don‚Äôt need to throw away your products, just rotate them! Here‚Äôre a few other tips to make sure your products are packing as much punch as they were at week six: Keep your eyes creams in the fridge. Keeping them in a chilled environment will immediately reduce puffiness and dark circles when you use them. Some celebrities, including Beyonc√©, have been known to use their eye creams all over their face. As it‚Äôs made for the most sensitive skin, it‚Äôs packed with potent nourishing and hydrating qualities. No wonder she wakes up that flawless! This may sound simple, but this easy step can make a big difference: make sure you wash your face with warm water before you apply your creams. When you raise the temperature of the skin, it creates space in-between your pores allowing for better absorption. retinol skin tricks Skincare Fri, 3 Nov 2017 8 Comments Related Posts How Your Moisturizing Mistakes Are Messing Up Your Skin Thu, 28 Dec 2017 Where You‚Äôre Going Wrong With Your Moisturizer And‚Ä¶ Tue, 10 Oct 2017 If You Want To Look Like These Celebs At 50, This Is‚Ä¶ Wed, 4 Oct 2017 Sam I have been suffering from acne and have had it for years but now I get it them often but not as much around my face. Am i going wrong somewhere here..? HB Team Hi my love, it really depends on your skin type. A salicylic cleanser is great for acne-prone skin. If your skin is warm, it will be better able to absorb moisturizer, but the cold ice wash will close your pores, so that‚Äôs great to do before makeup application. DAILY DOSE | SKIN By Huda Heidi Kattan Beautiful skin is one of the most important parts of a gorgeous appearance. People have literally spent thousands of dollars to get clear, glowing skin. While some are doing everything right, others may be causing damage to one of the most important parts of their face (and body). Here are 5 extremely bad skin habits to break from Totalbeauty.com. Bad Skin Habit #1: Smoking If health isn‚Äôt a good enough reason to stop smoking, what about your looks? Along with sunbathing, smoking is one of the worst things you can do to your skin. It decreases the rate at which your cells get oxygen, which cause you to wrinkle, significantly. Bad Skin Habit #2: Going Unprotected You may not realize this, but years of unprotected exposure to the sun will eventually catch up to you one day. Sun damage builds up over time and can be completely irreversible and deadly. Make sure you wear a good sunscreen to protect against any of the damage and premature aging that is unavoidable without protection! Bad Skin Habit #3: Sleeping with Your Makeup Night time is a great time for your skin to renew itself, which is why skin needs to breath at night. Wearing makeup while you sleep hinders the ability of collagen reproduction, which increases the chances of wrinkles, scarring, etc. Washing your face before bedtime is also crucial to wash off any bacteria and dirt that may be clogging your pores! Bad Skin Habit #4: Stressing Cortisol is the famous hormone that is released when we stress ! When this happens, the chances of breakouts increase significantly and may cause your skin to become dull. Meditating , even for a few minutes a day, can help your skin improve dramatically! Bad Skin Habit #5: Long Nights When you skin sleep, your skin muscles start to relax and cause your skin to look saggy. If that‚Äôs doesn‚Äôt scare you, the dark circles and puffiness that comes with lack of sleep will! Getting 8 hours of sleep is crucial for gorgeous skin! image credits ayushveda Anti-Aging beauty damage Eye circles health premature aging scar skin Skin Care sun Sun tanning Wrinkle (skin) Mon, 30 Aug 2010 1 Comment Related Posts These 5 Things Will Make Your Skin Look‚Ä¶ Sat, 28 Oct 2017 This Is The RIGHT Way To Cleanse For Model Skin Sun, 24 Dec 2017 Why Not Understanding Your Skin Type Is Keeping You‚Ä¶ Wed, 29 Nov 2017 Pur Essence Review Hey there! I just would like to give you a huge thumbs up for your great info you‚Äôve got here on this post. I‚Äôll be coming back to your web site for more soon.

It‚Äôs the age of the unicorn and I‚Äôm more than happy to embrace it on every level ‚Äì okay, perhaps not unicorn hair! I‚Äôve tried unicorn brushes, unicorn makeup, and I even threw a unicorn party for my daughter, of course I wanted to try a scrub that would turn me into a mythical creature. The Frank Body Shimmer Scrub is packaged to perfection ‚Äì if you put glitter or iridescent shimmer on anything I‚Äôm more than likely going to want to buy it and try it. The thing is, I‚Äôve received so many coffee scrubs in the same zip-lock packaging, but none of them called to me to try them (they weren‚Äôt covered in shimmer). I could never be bothered to open them up and figure out how I was going to keep my scrub fresh when it came in a packet. With a 50,000-person waiting list on its launch, the Frank Body Shimmer Scrub was a must-try, especially as it promises to turn my weekdays into weekends! What it is: A sugary, salty scrub with vitamin E, grapeseed oil (rich in antioxidants), salt, sugar, roasted ground coffee beans, and mica (a pearlescent mineral) to make your skin glow. It‚Äôs also vegan, nut-free and palm-oil-free. What it does: It exfoliates and smooths your skin to leave you with gorgeously shimmering, soft, and hydrated skin. It also promises to put ‚Äòa little disco in your day.‚Äô What we liked: I‚Äôm not a big coffee drinker, and I‚Äôm not crazy about the smell of coffee, but OMG this smells absolutely divine ‚Äì it‚Äôs like a delicious macchiato that I want to drink all day. As soon as I took my first handful of scrub I loved it, the texture was really fine, finer than sugar, so it wasn‚Äôt gritty or scratchy on your skin. It has a slight oil base, but only enough to bind the product, so it‚Äôs not dripping in oil like most scrubs, which can leave a greasy residue on your skin that can feel a little icky. This combo of a very light oil and a fine scrub was ahhhhmazing, I used it neck-to-toe and it left my skin feeling unbelievably soft, like every bit of dead skin was completely gone. I noticed it evened out my skin tone and I even felt like it improved the appearance of wrinkles on my d√©colletage (sunbathing faux pas!), if that‚Äôs possible! The coffee definitely has an invigorating effect, and it smelt so fricking good I really didn‚Äôt want the experience to end. What we didn‚Äôt like: I love the packaging, but I‚Äôm not crazy about the packet; it opens easily, and it has a zip lock, so it‚Äôs easy to reseal but because there isn‚Äôt a flat bottom you still have to try and prop it up between bottles so that it won‚Äôt fall in the shower. As far as the shimmer is concerned I didn‚Äôt really notice much of a mythical glow after I used it, which is fine, I don‚Äôt want to look like I‚Äôve just come back from Coachella. But because it‚Äôs called a shimmer scrub, I kind of expected it to have big chunks of glitter in the formula, just for fun when you‚Äôre using it. So, although the mica makes the formula shimmery, it doesn‚Äôt quite transform you into a glowing goddess like it claims it will. I have to admit, I felt kind of addicted to Frank Body scrubs after I used it and I immediately wanted to go out and buy them all. The product packs 7 ounces, so you could easily get 15 to 20 uses out of it, depending on how much you use. I REALLY love how this made my skin feel, it was just super beautifying and deep-cleansing, and the smell more than makes up for any lack of glitter. DAILY DOSE | SKIN By Huda Heidi Kattan Taking care of your pores is really super important for every girl who wears makeup! It‚Äôs hard enough to keep pores looking minimal as it is, with dirt from the environment, face creams that are too thick, and simply other elements that are unavoidable! Good upkeep is key to keep your skin looking flawless and give you that porcelain appearance! A great way to keep pores clear is with steam! You can do this as often as daily or weekly depending on your skin! I recommend doing this before you sleep or a day where you can give yourself a break from makeup! Boil a large pot of water on the stove. Use a medium size towel and place over your head while you lean over the pot. Make sure water is no longer boiling at this point, you don‚Äôt want water spewing out of the pot, you only need the steam! Lean over the pot for 10-15 minutes than wash your face as usual, followed by toner to extract any dirt out of your face! Tips on staying clear post workout: Make sure your skin is clean before you workout. Yes, this may seem pretty self-explanatory, but if you have oils already on your skin, then this will increase the likelihood of breakouts when you sweat. If you don‚Äôt have time to bathe before hand, try just rubbing down the areas that you are prone to breakouts with mild toner, like witch hazel. If you are very much prone to acne, then try using a cream that has salicylic acid or zinc before you work out. Make sure you wear clothing that does dry very quickly so that when you do sweat, it will not hold to your skin. Try to bathe immediately after your workout if possible. More and more we‚Äôre realizing the importance of our skincare regimes ‚Äì we spend hours looking for moisturizers that won‚Äôt block our pores and choosing toners that will give us radiant skin. But when it comes to cleansers, we‚Äôre much less discerning; we‚Äôll choose one based on brand, packaging, or an ad we saw. Getting clued up on your cleansers is actually so important, because knowing which type of cleanser to use can have a huge impact on your skin ‚Äì seriously, HUGE! We all know how long we spend decoding our moisturizers, well, the process should be the same for your cleanser. To make it extra easy for you, here‚Äôs our ultimate cleanser breakdown, so you can choose the best one specifically for your skin type: Gel Cleansers BEST FOR: COMBINATION/ OILY/ ACNE-PRONE SKIN Gel formulas are clear with a thick gel consistency, and they‚Äôre amazing for deep cleansing. They decongest clogged pores, remove excess oils without stripping the skin, and many formulas also have antibacterial ingredients that are perfect for calming acne-prone skin. Gels are ideal for deep cleaning without over-stripping. You can even use some gel cleansers as a mask, just leave them on your skin for a couple of minutes and wash off. Beware of: Strong ingredients that can overly strip your skin. If your face feels tight after using a gel cleanser, it could be too intense for your skin. Best ingredients: Alpha Hydroxy Acids, Glycolic Acid, Tea Tree Oil, Witchhazel. Cream Cleansers BEST FOR: DRY/ SENSITIVE/ AGING SKIN Cream cleansers are typically a thick, dense formula that is extremely moisturizing (perfect for aging skin), while they‚Äôre also great at removing makeup due to the heavy consistency. The rich consistency means that they‚Äôre less foamy, and as a result, will not dry your skin. If you‚Äôre a heavy makeup wearer, it‚Äôs better to remove makeup with a wipe or micellar water first and then finish with your cream cleanser. Some formulas even say to apply on dry skin and wipe away with a cotton ball ‚Äì in this case, it‚Äôs better to use a toner after to make sure no residue is left on your skin. Beware of: Some cream cleansers can block your pores, so look out for labels that say non-comedogenic and non-acnegenic, as this means the product has been specifically tested for this, and won‚Äôt block your pores. Best ingredients: Vitamin E, Jojoba , Shea butter . Foam Cleansers BEST FOR: OILY/ ACNE-PRONE SKIN Foaming cleansers usually come with a pump dispenser and are typically a little tougher on your skin. They‚Äôre perfect for getting rid of makeup and removing dirt and oil, but if your skin tends to be dry, it‚Äôs better to steer clear of foam cleansers as they‚Äôll strip your skin. There‚Äôs a little controversy around foam cleansers, as some believe they can be too harsh on your skin, but foam cleansers are a great option for oily-prone skin types, just be sure to follow with a moisturizer as oily skin needs moisture too! Beware of: Check the ingredients and be sure to avoid sodium laurel sulphate, as this ingredient can irritate your skin. Best ingredients: Tea Tree Oil, Salicylic Acid, Glycolic Acid, and Benzoyl Peroxide. Oil Cleansers BEST FOR: DRY SKIN/ SENSITIVE SKIN/ ECZEMA/ MAKEUP REMOVAL The theory behind cleansing oils ‚Äì an oily, watery formula ‚Äì is oil attracts oil. So, when you massage an oil cleanser into your face, those good oils bind with the sebum and any makeup oil and dirt, and when your rinse your skin all the oil is removed together. An oil cleanser is a very gentle way of removing dirt from your skin, and it doesn‚Äôt clog your pores because it doesn‚Äôt sink in, it only removes impurities. Cleansing oils will also balance and maintain your skin‚Äôs natural PH, preventing your skin from producing excess oil, like it might do to combat drying ingredients from other cleansers. The other benefit is natural oils are antibacterial and have antioxidants that help to improve your skin texture while retaining your skin‚Äôs typical moisture level. Beware of: If you have acne-prone skin, look for cleansers with the ingredients glycerin or silicone as these are non-comedogenic and non-acnegenic. Try to avoid parabens, petrolatum, phthalates, sodium laurel sulphate (SLS). Best ingredients: Grape seed, almond oil, sunflower seed oil, argan oil, green tea , vitamin E. Milk Cleansers BEST FOR: DRY/ NORMAL/ SENSITIVE/ AGING SKIN These extra-gentle milky formulas are an emulsion of fats and water, the tiny droplets of fat in the water give the formula its milk-like look and silky texture. Cleansing milk doesn‚Äôt foam, but instead, it dissolves dirt, makeup, and sebum, with oils and fats; this makes it extremely moisturizing as it won‚Äôt strip your skin with chemicals, and it‚Äôs great for removing makeup (not a full cake face). Most formulas should be massaged into the skin in circular motions and be wiped away with a tissue ‚Äì because milk cleansers are an emulsion, water will not remove them. Beware of : If you wear heavy makeup, it‚Äôs better to use a foam or gel cleanser first and follow with a milk cleanser. This double cleansing technique will ensure your face is free of makeup and the final milk cleansing step will ensure skin is soft and hydrated. Best ingredients: Natural ingredients like cucumber, rice bran oil, vitamin E, hyaluronic acid/sodium hyaluronate . Water Cleansers aka Micellar Water BEST FOR: SENSITIVE/ ACNE/ NORMAL This French creation is a super sensitive alternative to traditional cleansers, the formula looks and feels like water, but it contains tiny balls of oils molecules (micelles) suspended in soft water. The micelles contain surfactants, which attract makeup, dirt, and sebum. To use, soak a cotton pad in micellar water and wipe gently across your skin ‚Äì no scrubbing is needed as the formula draws out impurities. The formula doesn‚Äôt contain harsh chemical, is hydrating for your skin, and if you‚Äôre a heavy makeup wearer, it can be used as a gentle alternative to toners, as it won‚Äôt dry out your skin. Beware of: Nothing! This formula is ideal for all skin types and makes a perfect step for a double cleansing routine, which if you wear makeup, you should do. Use before your chosen cleanser to remove makeup, or after to remove any excess residue. Best ingredients: Some formulas contain added benefits like vitamins, rose water, rose oil, or hibiscus. Cleansing Tips: Now you know which cleanser you should be using, here‚Äôs how you can get the most from your cleanser: If you wear heavy makeup use a double cleansing method. First remove your makeup with a makeup wipe, micellar water, a foam, or gel cleanser, then follow with a cleanser suitable for your skin type. Follow with a toner or micellar water. Always use warm water to wash your face. Studies have shown hot water can dry out your skin, increase the likeliness cleansers will irritate your skin, and even cause damage to your facial capillaries and the barrier function of the skin‚Äôs surface. Once your face is clean, use a splash of cold water to close your pores. Always moisturize after your skin is cleansed, this is particularly important at night, even if you have oily or acne-prone skin , as your face loses more moisture over night than at any point. If you‚Äôre anything like us at HB HQ, you treasure your beauty products and want to make the most of every last brush, blush, and lipstick. A smashed palette is a worthy reason for a day off work, your FAV foundations stuck at the bottom of the bottle is cause for a tantrum. Besides the fact that we love our makeup, we spend good money on it too, and we don‚Äôt want a single drop to go to waste. So, with that in mind, here‚Äôre 10 genius hacks that will do everything, from save your eyelashes, fix your mascara, save your smashed powders and more‚Ä¶ A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Aug 13, 2017 at 1:52am PDT 1. Get Every Last Bit of Lotion Cut open your beauty tubes to get all your beauty product out. This works on almost ANY plastic bottle! You‚Äôll be amazed by how much is left inside when no more will seem to come out. Scrape out the leftover product from the top half that you cut off, and put it into the bottom half. You‚Äôll then have a huge amount of product left to use, and you can seal it up again by pushing the top half over the bottom half. 2. Salvage Broken Powders We‚Äôve all lived the nightmare of watching in slow mo as our fav powder or eyeshadow drops slowly to the floor and shatters into tiny little pieces. But, there‚Äôs good news! You can save your broken powder (don‚Äôt take them traveling!) with rubbing alcohol. Add a few drops at a time until the eyeshadow turns into a thick paste, then press it down firmly with a spoon or your finger. Leave it open for the alcohol to evaporate, when it does, your powder will be good as new. 3. Save Your Foundation You found the perfect shade, the perfect coverage, and now it‚Äôs gone, but you can still see a good few dollars of foundation left at the bottom of the glass jar. Of course, the stupid pump won‚Äôt reach it. Remove the pump, tip the foundation upside down in a re-sealable pot and leave it for a few hours. When you return, the majority of the product will be waiting in the pot for you. Still more Foundation stuck inside the bottle? Add a little moisturizer and shake, et voila‚Ä¶ Tinted moisturizer. 4. Fix Broken Lipstick Nothing is messier than trying to apply lipstick when it‚Äôs broken. Fix it by gently melting the broken parts, put them back together, then place it in the fridge for around an hour to seal‚Ä¶ Lipstick fixed. 5. Revive Your False Lashes Make the most of your false lashes by cleaning and storing them properly to get up to 20 wears from them: A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Jul 5, 2017 at 11:07pm PDT See the full false lash cleaning hack here . 6. Don‚Äôt Waste Your Foundation Never apply your foundation straight onto a beauty blender or sponge, it will soak up all your foundation. Instead, dot it over your face, and spread it with your fingers or a foundation brush. Then, use your makeup sponge as the final step to perfect and blend your foundation, contour, or concealer. 7. Freshen Up Toiletries Think you‚Äôve finished your shampoo, conditioner or body wash? Add some water to it and give it a shake, you‚Äôll get more than a few more uses from them. 8. Rescue Your Lipgloss Revive your fav lip gloss with warm water. When it gets to the stage you‚Äôre literally scraping the barrel, just put the lip gloss in a glass of hot water (not boiling). The leftover product will sink to the end of the tube where the wand can reach it. 9. DIY A Unicorn Glow! Got glitters you never use, outdated bronzers and shadows, broken powders? Smash them up into a fine powder and mix it with a moisturizer or coconut oil for a homemade tinted or shimmering moisturizer. 10. De-Clump Mascara Mascara going dry and clumpy? Add a couple of eye drops into the mascara, mix about, and it will be good as new for another week at least. In a pinch, a drop of hot water will do the trick. We hope these hacks revolutionize how you save your beauty products! HUDA BEAUTY | HARPERS BAZAAR By Huda Heidi Kattan Has anyone seen the December issue of Harper‚Äôs Bazaar Arabia ? I‚Äôm in it with a bunch of really fabulous girls!!! I will post the pictures from the magazine as soon as I get them, but for now here are a couple Behind the Scenes photos as well as my interview with them!! üôÇ Me and the Gorgeously talented makeup artist, Kate Goodwin Click here to check out the final photos!! Full name: Huda Heidi Kattan Age: 27 Nationality: Arab American How long have you been in Dubai? 2 Years Official job title/ and a description of what you do as part of your job: Beauty Blogger & Makeup Artist How long have you been a make up artist? How did you get in to the industry? I have been playing with makeup since I was 14, but I left to Hollywood to study a little over year ago. The decision was kind of obvious, I was working in finance, but obsessed with beauty! While I was in uni I was modeling, so getting into the industry was quite easy, thankfully! How would you describe your party style? FUNK! I love things that stand out, but still have some element of classiness in them! I love bulky jewelry and crazy shoes, with lots of faux fur! Do you have a signature style that you tend to stick to? And if so, what is it and why? As much as I like to believe I set my own trends, I love following what comes off the runway! I am constantly changing my style, but everything still has an hint of me in it and I would say it‚Äôs my own personality that comes out. There‚Äôs always a dash of color and something bold somewhere in my look! Who would be on your dream guest list for the party season? Well, I am kind of a grandma since I am pretty much married to my job, but I would love my family and close friends to be at my party. I have to admit, my friends are without doubt some of the most fabulous people I have ever met and I would love to have a super private but very fancy party with them! Of course if Jay-Z and Beyonce decided to show, I wouldn‚Äôt ask them to leave! What‚Äôs your top tip for surviving the party season? I do my best to make it to as many parties and events as possible! Being extremely busy makes it very tough at times. For me, my most important accessory for looking perfectly refreshed and gorgeous is a killer pair of false lashes. Call me crazy, but people tell me constantly it looks like I took hours to get ready, when I only had 10 minutes! They always add just the right amount of drama to your look! What‚Äôs the best party you‚Äôve ever been to and why? I really enjoyed the Hermes Party at the DIFC not too long ago. It was absolutely beautiful, but my favorite part of the party was the crowd. Everyone was really eclectic and I felt like I was in a completely different world! I felt like the guests really pushed their fashion sense and the end result was beautiful! Not to mention, they were all pretty fabulous! What‚Äôs your three beauty must-haves for the party season and why? Dramatic Lashes, Perfectly Contoured Face, and a Gorgeous Do! Simple, when you have all of these elements, everything comes together extremely fast and you always manage to look like a million bucks! artist Arts beauty blog blogger Dubai Fashion Harpers Bazaar hollywood New York Fashion Week uae Mon, 6 Dec 2010 19 Comments Related Posts Insta Glossary: Lit Mon, 6 Mar 2017 Featured in Popsugar! A golden tan is essential for me, it just makes me feel 1000 times sexier, and it even makes you look slimmer too ‚Äì yaaaas! I LOVE a sun-kissed look but I‚Äôm all about faking it ‚Äì it‚Äôs SO much better for your skin than hours spent in the sun. Since I discovered Sally Hansen‚Äôs Airbrush Legs Makeup about five years ago, it‚Äôs been my go-to for the perfect glow and my savior on so many occasions. You can buy both cream and spray formulas, but my FAV is definitely the spray ‚Äì it always gives me the glow I need in a hurry. The best thing is, it‚Äôs not just a tan, it actually gives you ahhhmazing coverage as well. It‚Äôs like a bb cream for your legs, it blurs the appearance of scars and marks for a flawless, airbrushed look. Instead of spraying it directly on yourself you spray it onto your hands and rub the formula in, and it‚Äôs always very easy to blend, and I never get streaks (be sure to wash your hands after or use a mitt). I also love that the formula isn‚Äôt permanent, so it means I can quickly apply it to bare shoulders or legs ‚Äì like when you‚Äôre wearing a midi dress, and you only need to do up to your knees! It‚Äôs water and transfer resistant, but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this if you‚Äôre going to a pool party ‚Äì it‚Äôs water-resistant, not waterproof! I also love that this formula comes in six shades, whereas most instant tans only offer a couple of shade options. I recommend only going two or three shades darker than your natural skin tone, as you don‚Äôt want it to look fake, and if it does happen to move, you won‚Äôt end up with super obvious white patches! I use shade Tan Glow, and it gives me a really subtle, healthy-looking tint, and I also have Deep Glow. My last and probably the most important tip is to avoid using it with fitted white clothes, it is transfer proof, but if something is rubbing your skin, there‚Äôs a good chance it will rub off on it, and that‚Äôs not worth having a tan for! Overall this is a total lifesaver, and for $13 I haven‚Äôt found anything better. Finally, you can fake yourself slimmer and use this for body contouring. If you‚Äôre wearing a mini, you can apply this down your inner thighs and on the outsides of your thighs to make them appear slimmer ‚Äì just be sure to blend so you don‚Äôt look stripey! To add to the effect, add a little highlighter down the center of your shins and thighs for a Victoria‚Äôs Secret glow. If there‚Äôs one thing we love at Huda Beauty HQ, other than makeup (obvs), it‚Äôs finding unusual natural ingredients that will make all our skin issues go away. Our latest obsession is not only amazing for your body, but it‚Äôs incredible for your skin too, it‚Äôs basically the Beyonce of the beauty world. We‚Äôre not saying oats will sing, dance, act, be gorgeous, and be cool af, but oats do have the ability to do everything from fight acne and dandruff to exfoliating and hydrating your skin. Yes, we‚Äôre talking about simple oats, like the ones you have for breakfast, and they‚Äôve been used for beautifying for more than 4000 years! Why oats are awesome: Oats are packed with anti-inflammatory properties, tons of antioxidants, vitamins, proteins, and minerals, and the complexity of oats makes them ideal for using as a home remedy for all your major skin concerns. Oats are cleansing: Oats are super absorbent and thanks to the saponins they contain, they extract excess oil and dirt from your pores ‚Äì yes, please! Oats are moisturizing: The combination of sugars, oils, and starches in oats are incredibly soothing for your skin, while oats‚Äô rich lipid content lock in moisture and act as a humectant, drawing water into your skin for ultimate hydration. Oats are food for your skin: Boasting the previously mentioned vitamins and minerals, they‚Äôre anti-inflammatory properties relieve dry, irritated skin by normalizing your skin‚Äôs PH balance, while the proteins strengthen and protect the skin‚Äôs barrier function. How to use Oats in your beauty routine: For Acne : Oatmeal is a triple threat when it comes to acne! It can be used to exfoliate pore-clogging dead skin cells, as a paste to soak up sebum, and as a balm to help inflammation caused by skin lesions. To DIY your own acne banishing skincare routine, this two-step DIY is perfect. Start with an oat exfoliator: Mix a cup of refined oats with three tablespoons of brown sugar, one tablespoon of honey, and a tablespoon of coconut oil. Gently rub the mixture onto your skin. This process removes dead skin cells that clog pores while helping to even and tone your skin. After your skin feels freshly scrubbed, wash with warm water. If you‚Äôre feeling extra (like us) follow your scrub with an oat mask. For this, cook oats as usual and then allow them to cool, thickening to form a paste. Slather the mix onto your skin and leave it to soak up excess oil for ten minutes. Oats are also packed with zinc, which as well as having unique skin rejuvenating properties, can help reduce inflammation by killing the bacteria that might be triggering your acne outbursts. For Dry and Itchy Skin : The zinc in oats also work to improve dry and itchy skin conditions like eczema. For an easy home remedy, blend oatmeal powder with hot water to form a paste and apply it to your face, leaving it on for 20 minutes to allow zinc‚Äôs anti-inflammatory properties to do its business. If you‚Äôre dealing with a serious eczema episode, try and use this oat salve every day until the problem relents. For Moisturizing Skin: The beta glucan in oats easily penetrates your epidermis as its molecules are small and quickly absorbed, immediately plumping the skin cells with moisture. From moisturizers and cleansers with an oatmeal base to DIYs, there‚Äôs a ton of ways to incorporate this natural moisturizer into your life. Our fav oatmeal mask (below) is an awesome weekly mask for keeping your skin hydrated. Our Favorite DIY Oat Mask: If you‚Äôre looking for a quick pick-me-up that will leave you feeling and looking better, give yourself an oatmeal facial. Cook together 1/2 cup hot water and 1/3 cup oatmeal, when ready remove from heat and leave it to rest until cool. When cold, mix in 1 tablespoon of plain yoghurt (packed with AHAs), 1 tablespoon of honey, turmeric, (an awesome antiaging and antibacterial powerhouse), and an egg-white for a hit of zinc and vitamin B. Apply a thin layer of the mask to your face and let it sit for 10 to 15 minutes, then rinse with warm water. Whether you have big boobs or little boobs, there‚Äôs one thing they all have in common, they‚Äôre awesome! But with great boobs comes great responsibility, which means you need to CHECK YOUR BOOBS! This month it‚Äôs Breast Cancer Awareness Month, so we wanted to bring to your attention this hugely important topic and round up three things everyone with boobs should do. 1. CoppaFeel Checking your boobs every month is really, really important ‚Äì this is your number one boob priority! In the UK and US, 1 in 8 women are affected by breast cancer, and it‚Äôs still the most commonly diagnosed form of cancer in women under 40. It‚Äôs not always hereditary; actually, only 10% of breast cancers are caused by family history, sometimes there‚Äôs just no reason behind it. The good news is, checking your boobs is SO easy! The key is to check them regularly, every month, and by doing so you‚Äôll become more familiar and become better at spotting any changes in your breasts, which could be an early sign of breast cancer. Detecting breast cancer early can save your life: the five-year survival rate of early-stage breast cancer is 80-90%, falling to just 24% for diagnosis at a later stage. Look for differences in shape, size, changes in your nipples, and feel for lumps. Use the Coppafeel chart for direction and head over to the CoppaFeel page here for more details on the chart below. And remember, if you do find something different or notice any new lumps, don‚Äôt expect the worst. Go to your GP and get them to take a look; there are lots of reasons why your breasts might change, so having a professional assess them as soon as possible is key. Go to the amazing CoppaFeel site for more details on how to check your boobs and to find out more ‚Äì you can even get a boob-check reminder. 2. Get your bra properly fitted! Yes, you‚Äôve probably heard that before, but seriously it‚Äôs really important because it can cause a ton of health problems you might not even realize are a result of your bra. If your bra is too tight: Not only are you going to get quadraboob (your boobs bulging over your bra, so it looks like four boobs), but it can put tension on your stomach and ribs, giving you stomach pain and indigestion. If your bra is too big: If it‚Äôs too big, it can do even more damage than it being too small, especially if you‚Äôre a larger cup-size. If your bra‚Äôs too loose, it isn‚Äôt able to give you the right support, and it can cause the ligaments to stretch and your boobs to get saggy ‚Äì not to mention the back pain you‚Äôve no doubt experienced at some point. If your straps are too tight: Aside from the red marks on your shoulders, it can put tension on your shoulders and neck, most likely resulting in muscle ache, but it can also result in headaches ‚Äì who knew! 3 ways you know your bra doesn‚Äôt fit properly: 1) If the band keeps riding-up at the back and you find yourself pulling it down constantly, the band is too big. When you buy a bra, it should fit snugly and comfortably on the last clasp. As you wear the bra it will begin to stretch; this is when you start using the tighter clasps so that the fit remains the same. After washing, you will probably need to use the last clasp until it stretches again. 2) If your cups are gaping, or if there is any space in your cups, then you need to go down a cup or band size. If only one cup is loose, then you may need to tighten the strap or add padding for extra support. 3) If your boobs are bulging out of your bra, you need to go up a cup size. If your bra is cutting into your back or leaving marks on your back or chest, you need to go up a band size. If you have any of these problems, or you‚Äôre just not sure, the best thing to do is to go to your closest lingerie boutique and get them to fit you correctly. 3. Share this with your friends Now you know how to take care of your boobs and check them properly, tell your friends too! Every woman and man (yes, men can get breast cancer too) should check their boobs; it‚Äôs so so important. So share this with your friends and family to help spread the word. As you guys know, I‚Äôm a big fan of a good contour & highlight! It has pretty much revolutionized the beauty game, and so when Tarte launched an on-the-go highlight & contour palette I was super excited! Tarte has transformed their original six-shade palette and created three new shades for their mini version, the Tartiest Pro To Go Highlight & Contour Palette . Not only is the packaging on-point, another big bonus is that all three shades are powders, whereas the original set had a cream option, which I found could move a little too much. Not only do powders prolong wearability, but they‚Äôre perfect for when you‚Äôre already out and you just need a little touch-up. And what makes me love this palette, even more, is it smells a little chocolatey ‚Äì love! What it is: A sleek, portable contour and highlight palette with two glowing highlighters and a matte contour in powder form. What it does: Three fade-free shades have been mixed to flatter all skin tones and mimic real shadow and light reflection on the face, for the ultimate natural glow and definition. What we liked: The thing I love the most is that it‚Äôs just so compact; it literally fits in the palm of my hand and it has a mirror too, so you can use it anywhere. The contour shade, Chisel, is gorgeous. It‚Äôs dark enough for my skin tone, so if you‚Äôre fair skinned you‚Äôll need to use this sparingly. The powder is really rich and creamy, so it‚Äôs easy to pick up on your brush, but means you‚Äôll need to apply lightly. The Burst shade is so pretty, it‚Äôs a light sandy shimmer, which gives a flawless sheen. But I‚Äôm really loving the Gleam shade, the pigment is amazing and you can literally see the pearls. The only thing people with darker skin tones might find is that it could look a little grey once applied, as it is quite white toned. What we didn‚Äôt like: The Chisel shade is beautiful, but I prefer my contour to have more of an ashy tone to sculpt, whereas this is more of a bronze. So, if you like to bronze and contour separately, this might not be ideal for you. However, it‚Äôs good that this can multi-task if you need it too. Overall, I love the set, but the highlighters might not suit medium to darker skin tones. If Tarte launches more shades, it‚Äôll be a necessity for every beauty connoisseur. in hair , product review The Product You NEED for Gorgeous Beach Waves by HB Team Mon, 3 Oct 2016 Leave a comment We sipped the Ouai juice, and we‚Äôre hooked. But did you expect anything less from Jen Atkin, the queen of Cool Girl hair? Just check out her clients like Chrissy Teigen and the Kardashians for reference. Atkin pretty much discovered how to bottle beach hair in her Ouai Wave Spray that has a light, white musk scent (or is it jasmine? Whatever it is, we likes). It gives our locks a little bit of body and a wave that can go from subtle to beach babe depending on how we use it. We‚Äôve been stocking up since we got our hands on it. What it is: A waving spray that can be used on wet or dry hair to create a beachy wave. What it does: Uses rice protein to add hold for a natural wave look. What we liked: If you‚Äôve used wave sprays in the past, you know the deal. Either your hair gets super crunchy or weighed down. We love to use this on our wet hair and let it air dry for a subtle beachy look, and before a rough blow dry followed by an iron for more defined waves. Plus so much body! All that with no added salt in sight. What we didn‚Äôt like: That air dry tip didn‚Äôt work for our fine hair tester as much as it did for our tester with thicker hair. And though we love the smell, it‚Äôs not for everyone if you‚Äôre not into the musky-type perfume scents. Fun fact: Ouai is pronounce ‚Äúway,‚Äù inspired by the cool Parisian way to say ‚Äúoui‚Äù or ‚Äúyes‚Äù Price: $26 Availability: sephora.com in product review This Twist Up Charcoal Cleanser is Everything by HB Team Wed, 28 Sep 2016 2 Comments We admit it, we were a little confused at what the Tarte Frxxxtion Stick was exactly upon first sight. With its gold cap and accents, it looked too pretty to just be a cleanser. Plus, with a similar packaging as Tarte‚Äôs Lip & Cheek Tints, we thought it could be makeup. That is, until you twist the cap open to find a black solid. It‚Äôs described as an ‚Äúexfoliating gel‚Äù ‚Äî all of which you‚Äôll mostly understand when you use it for the first time. Good luck going back after you do. What it is: An exfoliating sea algae and charcoal cleanser in the form of a solid stick that is activated to a gel when applied to wet skin. What it does: Uses charcoal powder and microexfoliants for a light scrub and cleanser that helps draw out impurities in the skin. To use, wet face, then rub on face directly until evenly applied. Use fingertips to massage on face then rinse off. What we liked: It was easy to apply, and even though it melts to a gel upon use, there‚Äôs fairly no mess. The microexfoliants scrub without being harsh and the charcoal helps to absorb oils and other impurities (charcoal is known to absorb about 200 times its weight in impurities). The cleanser has no strong discernable scent and also doubles as a mask if you leave it for a couple minutes. The result is a shine-free, dirt-free finish. The cleanser is also compact and solid which makes it good for travel and those on the go. Plus it looks pretty on our bathroom counter. What we didn‚Äôt like: The balm can‚Äôt get into the inner corners or around the nostrils upon contact but you can also use your fingers to wipe around those areas. And although it‚Äôs gentle enough to use everyday, we don‚Äôt recommend using any granule product more than 2-3 times a week! Who it‚Äôs best for: Good for all skin types, and people who usually carry around their life in their bag (we see you, Jetsetters). Price: $22 Availability: tartecosmetics.com Fun fact: Tarte is launching in the Middle East on October 27th ! For makeup lovers like me, running around LA to every beauty boutique to get your hands on the limited edition NARSissist Unfiltered Cheek Palettes will seem totally normal ‚Äì and yes, that‚Äôs what I did! I was sooo excited to get my hands on these two palettes, I mean, a six-shade offering in one palette is a dream. They‚Äôre great value for money as well, considering a NARS full-size blush retails for $30, and these palettes include six almost full-sized shades for $59, you‚Äôre definitely getting your money‚Äôs worth. What it is : A limited edition collection of six blush shades. Unfiltered I offers a rich collection of berry hues that will best complement darker skin tones, and the Unfiltered II palette offers six pink-toned blush shades that will suit paler skin tones. What it does: It‚Äôs designed to sculpt, shape and add a glow to cheeks with a variety of bold matte and shimmering shades. What I liked: NARS really got their packaging spot on with this, I LOVE the size and the mirrored casing, and it also includes a full-size mirror inside. Although it‚Äôs a bit big to carry around in your handbag, it‚Äôs still not too big for traveling. My favorite color was Out There, a dark dusky rose shade from the Unfiltered I palette, and I liked that they included some paler, shimmering shades in both palettes that can be used to highlight too. The texture was creamy and felt really velvety, but even though some shades seemed quite intense and buildable when applied, they did seem to wear off over the day. What I didn‚Äôt like: I was so excited about this palette, but unfortunately, the color offering disappointed me. I feel that with both palettes, the shades aren‚Äôt overly wearable and the pigment intensity wasn‚Äôt strong enough. The colors are buildable, and it also suggests wetting a brush to pick up more pigment, but I feel like I shouldn‚Äôt have to do this. I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôll be using either of these palettes again, but they‚Äôre so pretty I just have to keep them on my desk! When it comes to a gorgeous glow kit, Anastasia knows what she‚Äôs doing. Last July, the release of her Moonchild palette sent highlight fanatics into a frenzy, and there‚Äôs no doubt this glow kit has just as much ethereal lustre to be excited about too. One thing‚Äôs for sure, her packaging game is on point ‚Äì makeup junkies, this one‚Äôs for you. And if you were looking for a highlight to take your look to the stratosphere and back, then the Aurora palette has a surprising shade collection that‚Äôs sure to excite you. What it is: A six-shade highlighter palette designed to create intense radiance for face and body. What it does: A variety of shades give plenty of room to switch up your glow game. They can be applied with a damp brush to intensify the pigments, or mixed with a hydrating oil for a shimmering body glow. What we liked: The first thing to note is the packaging ‚Äì the gradient finish is super cool and ties in so nicely with the name, and I love the iridescent writing. The highlighters last really well and are easy to blend, although I did notice with the darker shades (Orson and Spectre), that the powders seemed a little drier and were less blendable. I love the Eclipse shade, it has a stunning peach iridescence to it, and Lyra also has a gorgeous pearly pink sheen. What we didn‚Äôt like: If you love a glittery finish to your highlight then this is the perfect palette for you, but because of the glistening effect, this would be a palette I‚Äôd mainly use in the evening. I also noticed when I applied it with a brush, the glitter was more predominant than the pigment. I would recommend using your finger and gently pressing it onto your cheeks to get the best application and pigment payoff. Moonchild or Aurora: Both palettes are gorgeous and are must-have limited edition pieces for makeup collectors ‚Äì like yours truly! I love the new colors of the Aurora palette and think they‚Äôll look best on medium to deeper skin tones, while the Moonchild has super pretty pale shades, which best complement fair to medium skin tones. For day-to-day use, my preference would be the Moonchild glow kit, but for girls who really want to pop, Aurora may come out on top for you. SUMMER | HAIR STYLES By Huda Heidi Kattan Looking for a great hairstyle this summer to help keep you looking and feeling cool? Check out these great hair styles and how-to‚Äôs from Allure magazine. 1. Hot Bun Humidity and gorgeous hair just don‚Äôt go hand-in-hand! A great way to fight humidity is to move your hair with it, up! While hair is wet, gather at the top of the neck and wrap it around into a little bun, secure it with an elastic and use hair pins if needed. Remember, avoid using products with heavy alcohol content like hair spray, instead try using a shine spray and a small brush/tooth brush and brush over any areas where frizz is prone. 2. Head-banded Hair When selecting a headband it is crucial to take into consideration the structure of your face shape. If you have a round face, it is best to find a headband that is flat. Heart shaped faces look better with a thin headband and oval shaped faces look great with thick bands. Simply tie around head from underneath the hair and accessorize with large shades (optional). 3. Loose Braids A great way to make braids look chic is to start the pony tails below the ear. This allows the braids to naturally loosen and gives you a sexy care-free look! 4. Textured Ponytail According to hairstylists, Antonio Prieto of Antonio Prieto Salon in NYC, the best thing to do after a day at the beach is put your hair into a low ponytail (middle of neck) and simply run your fingers through it. Simply apply some serum if neccessary and pull your hair straight back so that there is no obvious part. images courtesy of allure band braid bun celeb frizz hair loose pony style summer tail textured Thu, 17 Jun 2010 1 Comment Related Posts 4 Easy Hairstyles To Hide Your Greasy AF Hair Wed, 17 Jan 2018 5 Things You Should Never Do If You Want Hair Like Rapunzel Thu, 28 Sep 2017 Could Sleeping With Your Hair Up Cause Hair Loss? Models basically get paid to look beautiful, so if we‚Äôre going to be taking beauty tips from anyone, these ladies are top of our list. Not only do they get to work with the industries best makeup artists and skincare specialists, but they always pick up on the coolest hacks while jet-setting across the globe. After being mesmerized by the Victoria‚Äôs Secret models all over our Instagram, here‚Äôre three things all models do that you should definitely know about too: Models know the importance of a facial massager Facial massagers are not part of the Instagram hype ‚Äì you don‚Äôt see them in every video, and not every brand is creating their own ‚Äì but it‚Äôs one of the most common tools among many models. Take a Jade roller , for example, not only can they immediately depuff your skin by stimulating lymph drainage, but over time they can diminish the look of fine lines. Then there‚Äôs the Japanese Golden Beauty Bar that you use to help your serum penetrate deeper into your skin. The gold ions and micro vibrations stimulate facial massage, while it also tightens and contours your skin. If it‚Äôll help us achieve anything close to a model bone structure, we‚Äôll try it. Models know that their necks need attention too No matter how young your face looks, a saggy turkey neck will give your age away immediately. Models know that they need to take their skincare routine all the way down to their neck as well because actually, the skin on your neck is just as sensitive as your face. This means make sure you remove any makeup here, tone, and moisturize your neck as well ‚Äì the latter is especially important. This means don‚Äôt just apply SPF to your face, but to your neck as well. We know it sounds extra, but in ten years you will thank us for it! Models know to drink crazy amounts of water Okay, so models use great skincare, and they know a ton of tips and tricks, but they also know that what‚Äôs on the inside massively reflects on the outside too. Models know that drinking loads of water is key to their skin looking gorgeous ‚Äì if you don‚Äôt drink enough water, it can make your skin look dull and emphasize fine lines (you should aim for at least 2 liters a day). It‚Äôs not just about water either, most models love green tea , which regulates hormones, controls sebum production, fights against wrinkles and has a ton of other amazing good-for-your-body benefits. And if you ask what most models drink first thing in the morning, they‚Äôll tell you they don‚Äôt start the day without a cup of lemon water, which cleanses the digestive system and contains tons of vitamin C. Moral of the story? DAILY DOSE | SKIN By Huda Heidi Kattan One of the most challenging things as a makeup artist is dealing with skin that is dry, unhealthy, or irritated. If only everyone was born with perfectly flawless skin that would last throughout their lifetime! A great way to help nourish skin, without using any harmful ingredients is to use natural oils. When I was in the states recently, my skin was extremely dry, one of my friends told me that when she was pregnant, she used almond oil to keep the moisture in and also to give her skin a glow‚ÄîI have been hooked since! I actually need to head to the store, because I can‚Äôt seem to keep in stock in my bathroom cabinet! Definitely a must try if you suffer from any dry skin! Recommendation: Before Makeup: Before you apply your foundation, add a few drops of almond oil to your moisturizer. Make sure not to add too much, remember, you want a glow NOT a shiny T-zone! Let your moisture mix sit for a few minutes before blotting, then apply foundation as usual! At Night: Simply massage several drops into your face in an upward motion, I always work towards my forehead. Making sure your skin has enough moisture and the right ingredients while you sleep is essential for gorgeous skin! image credits sheknows skin Mon, 31 Jan 2011 9 Comments Related Posts Why Not Understanding Your Skin Type Is Keeping You‚Ä¶ Wed, 29 Nov 2017 How Your Moisturizing Mistakes Are Messing Up Your Skin Thu, 28 Dec 2017 DIY Face Scrub for Glowing Skin! The Bridget Jones‚Äô of this world (going forward referred to as ‚Äòus‚Äô), all have one thing in common, and it‚Äôs not just a search for the perfect Mr. Darcy figure. No, it‚Äôs our love-hate relationship with dating apps like Tinder, Bumble, and Coffee Meets Bagel ‚Äì this isn‚Äôt our fav breakfast spot. We love them because they provide thrill, excitement and give us that much-needed confidence boost when it‚Äôs a Sunday night, and we‚Äôre on the couch in our PJs, doing our best impression of Bridget and stuffing our faces with Ben & Jerry‚Äôs. We hate dating apps because when it doesn‚Äôt work out, or our date turns out to be a weirdo, we blame these apps for not protecting us from the disappointment. The reality is ‚Äì love it or hate it ‚Äì if you really want to give this your best shot and get your ‚ÄòHappy Ever After,‚Äô you first need to make sure you‚Äôve upped your chances of getting the ten out of tens swiping right on your pics. So, here are our top tips for nailing the online dating game (or just your IG profile photo), in all its shallow glory! 1. Make sure you‚Äôre not just a stock image One picture is not enough, and in a world where we need proof to believe anything, putting up at least two or three photos will give your prospective love-interest some confidence that you do, in fact, exist. 2. Lighting is everything! Good lighting is the key to a great profile pic ‚Äì of course, you already knew that! You can edit most things, but if you have bad lighting, no amount of FaceTune is going to fix that. We love outdoor lighting if you‚Äôre standing in the shade, or bathroom lighting can also be really sexy (not the shocking, fluorescent kind, the warm, dim kind). 3. Strike a pose (and find your angle) From T-Rex hands to Bambi bends and over-the-shoulder looks, there are hundreds of different celebrity-certified poses and angles to glean inspiration from. Knowing your best angle and your most flauntable assets will make your 4. Get into their subconscious Sounds creepy, we know, but why not use a little psychology to your advantage? According to researchers at the Department of Psychology at the University of York, there‚Äôs three core features people inherently lookout for when sculpting first impressions from a picture: approachability, dominance, and attractiveness. As for judging attractiveness, after examining 1000‚Äôs of photos, surveys revealed that people are only really studying two things about a person‚Äôs face: eyes and mouth. People with broad, happy grins are seen to be approachable, and consequently, more relatable, and eyes were everyone‚Äôs go-to. And if you want to seem like a strong individual, good brow game will help with that! 5. The DO NOT‚ÄôS! Ditch the indoor sunglasses (no, just no) and, we‚Äôre all for Snapchat filters ‚Äì but keep it to one image with a flower crown. Boys, tweeze away that unibrow, and please, for the love of God ‚Äì don‚Äôt leave us guessing who you are in a group shot of eight guys. This one may sound pretty obvious, but only post pictures that are in focus: You have one or two seconds to get a right swipe, so why waste time on blurry shots? 6. Smize baby, smize We‚Äôre about to change your life with Tyra Bank‚Äôs top model advice: when in doubt, smize! In simple terms, smile through your eyes (yes, this does really work). Smizing will continue to draw attention to your eyes without giving you the deer caught in a headlight look. 7. Clothes maketh the man (and woman) When it comes to make or break fashion statements, we‚Äôre set on one thing, be you! But, of course, it‚Äôs always helpful to see what trends in the dating world, and the app Photofeeler, a tool that allows you to get feedback on your profile photo, found that when it came to clothing, although the results were torn, the most poignant fragments of feedback were: ‚Ä¢ Dark colors and formal attire always received more positive feedback. ‚Ä¢ Don‚Äôt cover or block your eyes. Sunglasses and hats are a big no-no for both genders because it makes you seem unapproachable. Tinder reported 12% less right swipes for sunglasses, and 15% less for hats. ‚Ä¢ The psychological effects of the color red for both men and women have been well researched. So, if you‚Äôre looking to make a grand first impression, make sure your tinder picture has some eye-catching crimson or burgundy to ignite their subconscious interest. ‚Ä¢ Ensure your clothes fit well! Our top tips for getting the most bomb Tinder pic: First of all, make sure your main pic is the best, and follows all the rules ‚Äì let‚Äôs be honest, people only ever keep looking through your photos if they‚Äôre not sure (or you‚Äôre really hot!). According to data at Tinder, here are our final tips for what you need to do to up your chances of getting a swipe in the right direction: ‚Ä¢ Smile: 14% more likely to get a right swipe ‚Ä¢ Face the camera directly: 20% more likely to get a right swipe ‚Ä¢ Avoid selfies: particularly for men, you‚Äôre lessening your chances of a swipe. Girls, put away the duck face pout. ‚Ä¢ Make sure the pic clearly shows your face! One of the most important tools to arm yourself with when taking your next Tinder profile picture is confidence and originality. Meet our #WomanBossWedsnesday @ExpiredNFabulous ! Not only is Faiza Rammuny funny AF, her Instagram channel guarantees you‚Äôll be binge-watching her videos and loling for at least 30 minutes, but Faiza is also a huge inspiration! Going against family and cultural expectations, Faiza came through to share her struggles, make us laugh, and be an agony aunt to all of us ‚Äì seriously, message her with your relationship issues, and she will be there! Her main message is self-love, and we couldn‚Äôt agree with her more. Here‚Äôs why we love her: What‚Äôs your most inspiring/ empowering quote? I often say, ‚ÄúFeel to Heal,‚Äù because I feel that it‚Äôs very important to FEEL through all of the emotions that life throws at you: the good, the bad, and the really really ugly. Don‚Äôt put a bandaid over a bullet hole in your heart. You‚Äôre hurting, hurt. You‚Äôre sad, be sad. You‚Äôre angry, be angry. I firmly believe that our emotions and ability to feel them is what makes women so powerful. Who‚Äôs your icon? Princess Diana. I think she showed women that sometimes you have to go against the grain to find your happiness and make real change in this world. Where do you usually get inspiration from? My past i.e. upbringing, family, dating, heartbreak, and embarrassing circumstances I have found and still find myself in. I get SO much inspiration at night when I‚Äôm replaying my day, week, or revisiting the past in my head. I sleep with a notepad and a pen on my nightstand. A post shared by Faiza Rammuny: üêßMama Penguinüêß (@expirednfabulous) on Oct 30, 2017 at 12:07pm PDT What‚Äôs the weirdest place you found inspiration? Parking space 360 at the Metra Train Station near my house. After my almost three-year relationship ended, I went there to cry, escape, heal, and write content. I never thought I would be inspired by a damn parking space, but there you have it. As a woman boss, we would love to know how you‚Äôve made it so far? I found my purpose. Then I went all in with hard work, dedi-fucken-cation, and sacrifice. I quit a great job, struggled financially, went against family expectations and culture to be doing what I do today. I made it far because I was willing to lose it all, if only to say I tried. What drives you? My penguins (followers) I hate calling them followers, it sounds so Manson family. They drive me forward every single day. Sharing their stories, their lives, and their vulnerabilities with me is SO inspiring and drives me every day to give many a voice that they don‚Äôt have. Any tips you can give to others? Be YOU! Don‚Äôt let society, family, culture, or anyone tell you who that‚Äôs supposed to be. Find out for yourself. Make your own rules. Understand that mistakes mold you. I never thought that I could be accepted for ME because I was raised in a rigid culture that constantly pointed out my ‚Äúfaults.‚Äù Today almost three hundred thousand people around the world see those ‚Äúfaults,‚Äù and love them about as much as I do. Tell us who you think should be our next #WomanBoss in the comments below.
