You may not be familiar with the term AHAs (Alpha Hydroxy Acids) specifically, but chances are you‚Äôve heard of lactic or glycolic acid. If the name still doesn‚Äôt ring any bells, check the packaging of your favorite deep cleansing exfoliator, anti-wrinkle cream, or serum ‚Äì there‚Äôs a good chance you‚Äôll find the name on the packaging. AHA‚Äôs ability to smooth deep wrinkles, erase skin pigmentation, and promote even, smooth skin makes it one of our must-have products in our beauty regimes, and one you should definitely be using, if you‚Äôre not already. What Are AHAs? Alpha hydroxy acids are basically a natural chemical exfoliator, so instead of using abrasive creams to rub away dead skin, AHAs have the unique ability to penetrate the skin and breakdown dead skin cells. AHAs are found in fruits, milk, and sugars: citric acid from citrus fruits (that figures), glycolic acid is sourced from sugar cane, lactic acid is found in sour milk, malic acid is extracted from apples and pears, and tartaric acid can be found in grapes ‚Äì yes that means there are lots of DIY AHA masks you can create (more on that later). What AHAs Do: AHAs are an exfoliant that gently works to remove the top layer of dead skin by ‚Äòungluing‚Äô the old cells still stuck to the epidermis. This gives way to new skin cell regrowth and also helps to stimulate collagen and elastin production. This spring cleaning of your epidermis helps to improve wrinkles and pigmentation, and will leave your skin super smooth! AHAs are amazing for everyone, especially aging skin, but they also work brilliantly for: Acne: Introducing a weekly AHA peel is incredible for acne-prone skin. The acid will penetrate and strip away dead skins cells that can block pores and lead to acne. Scars : For fast scar removal, buy an exfoliator with 4% or more of AHA, which will speed up the removal of dead skin and smooth any scar tissue. An overnight moisturizer or serum under 10% concentration will extend the process. If you‚Äôre looking to remove scaring fast, applying 70% glycolic acid in a series of peels helps immensely to reduce the appearance of scars. Wrinkled or Dry Skin (Xerosis) : For treating wrinkles, sun damage, and dry skin, AHA creams and serums around 8% concentration are incredible for erasing fine lines and tightening tired, damaged skin. AHAs‚Äô ability to increase water retention in your cells will also help them combat signs of dryness, further improving the appearance of wrinkles. How To Use AHAs: In your skincare: AHAs work best in skincare products if the concentration is between 5% to 8%, and you can find them in your moisturizer, cleanser, exfoliators and even suncreams. Because AHAs should be left on your skin, they are most effective in a moisturizer or exfoliating mask. Look out for glycolic and lactic acids on your labels as these have been proven to give the best results. Because AHAs make your skin more sensitive to sunlight you should always wear SPF when using them to protect the new skin on the surface. As a treatment: You can receive chemical peels from a doctor, dermatologist, or local beauty clinic. A chemical peel uses a much higher dose of AHAs (around 50% to 70%), and these give similar results to microdermabrasion and will help to improve acne, wrinkles, pigmentation, and uneven skin tone. It gets its name because it literally causes your skin to peel for up to a few days, or even a week afterward, but the results are much more effective than at home skincare treatments and can last up to 2 years. Our fav formula: Ole Henriksen‚Äôs Power Peel is a 3-step facial system that includes a scrub, followed by a lemon AHA peel, and a soothing clay mask. This is the ultimate 3-step at home facial, check out the review here . Our Fav DIY AHA Masks: Fruit acid mask with strawberries and lime: Not only are most zingy fruits AHAs but citrus fruits like limes, lemons and kiwis are filled with antioxidants, which help combat free radicals and keep cells healthy and rejuvenated. Mash up two large strawberries or five or six small strawberries and mix with half a lime (you can either squeeze the lime juice into the strawberry mix or include the lime pulp as well). Leave it on your face for 10 to 20 minutes (whatever is comfortable for you), then rinse off with water thoroughly. Lactic acid mask with yogurt and honey: Yoghurt contains lactic acid, another form of AHA, so if you‚Äôre looking to fight the clock, this one‚Äôs your boo. Lactic acid helps dissolve dead skin, tighten pores, and reduces the appearance of those pesky fine lines. Mix in honey (which is soothing and also has anti-bacterial properties), and you‚Äôve got an extra powerful skin rejuvenating mask. Combine one heaped teaspoon of natural yogurt and one teaspoon of honey, (you can add a squeeze of lemon if you have any), and leave on for twenty minutes, before rinsing with a face cloth. Introducing our #WomanBossWednesday, the incredibly inspiring Nabela Noor . Fearless and empowered, Nabela is exactly the kind of friend we all need in our lives. While her highlight and lipstick are always on point and her videos will teach you to color correct like you never knew possible, Nabela is so much more than a YouTuber; she is making waves in the industry to advocate for women of all shapes, sizes, cultures, and ethnicities. We love Nabela for her incredibly motivating captions as much as her amazing makeup tutorials. Here‚Äôs why she‚Äôs this week‚Äôs #WomanBoss: What‚Äôs your most inspiring/ empowering quote? I always say, ‚ÄúI will not reserve my happiness for a later date or a later weight.‚Äù I became liberated and my happiest when I stopped waiting to be happy. Postponing my self-confidence for a certain number on a scale was not helping me love who I am today. So, I stopped waiting and decided whoever I was today and however I looked today was good enough and worthy of love. And it‚Äôs changed my life. What‚Äôs the first thing you do in the morning, and before you go to sleep? The first thing and the last thing I do every day is actually the exact same thing! I list out everything I‚Äôm grateful for in a gratitude journal and re-center myself in a place of thankfulness. It‚Äôs the best way to start and end each day, I promise you. What keeps you motivated? My mission keeps me motivated. I want to bring visibility for girls like me in beauty, fashion, and entertainment. Brown girls. Muslim girls. Plus size girls. I want to keep shining my light in hopes to inspire other girls to shine their own light as well. I want to keep enforcing messages of tolerance, acceptance, and unity in all that I do. Your biggest challenge? Along with urging for representation for Muslim and Brown girls, I use my platform to advocate for representation for the plus size community as well. So, a huge challenge has been the resistance from the beauty, fashion and entertainment industry to include plus size women in the narrative. And not just include us to say that they‚Äôre including us. But to truly uplift us and portray us in the equal and gracious light we deserve. Huda has been so great at doing just that, and I‚Äôm forever thankful for her dedication to inclusion. What would you be doing if you weren‚Äôt where you are now? Definitely working in politics and government, specifically at the United Nations where I could focus on advocacy. Where do you usually get inspiration from? Trailblazers inspire me, regardless of what industry they belong to. I can spend hours listening to leaders from all areas. I also get inspired by ideas. Ideas change the world and the idea of a world where everyone feels seen, heard and represented truly inspires me every day. A post shared by Nabela Noor (@nabela) on Jan 4, 2018 at 9:15am PST Something you‚Äôve never told anyone before? My first channel on Youtube was actually a music channel. I created my beauty channel as a second channel for fun. The beauty channel kicked off, and I later deleted my music channel but promised myself I‚Äôd release music one day to my audience. This year I‚Äôm doing just that!! What advice would you give to aspiring MUAs I love this quote: ‚ÄúDo the best you can with what you have.‚Äù In this social media world where it can always feel like nothing is ever enough, it‚Äôs so important to remember to do the best you can with what you have. It‚Äôs okay if you don‚Äôt have the best equipment or setup or backdrop or makeup, do the best you can. Whatever you want to do, just do the best you can possibly do with what you have. You have something unique and special to offer the world so discover what that is and own it and don‚Äôt let comparison keep you down. Rise above and keep shining! Share some love for Nabela in our comments and let us know who you think should be next week‚Äôs #WomenBoss. One of the best DIYs I‚Äôve found for acne personally is probably already in your kitchen. Just take the peel of a ripe banana (not overripe, you want one that‚Äôs yellow with a few dark spots), and rub it on your blemish for ten minutes or so. You‚Äôll see a big difference in your acne, especially after a few days. Why does this work? A lot of reasons! Bananas have so many anti-inflammatories, like vitamin A, zinc, and manganese. The peels are also natural exfoliants to remove toxins and helps to prevent bacterial infections that may contribute to acne. The enzymes help to heal scars and prevent new pimples from popping up, and the starch unclogs your pore. It‚Äôs basically an anti-acne powerhouse! While our teens were awesome, there are certain things we look back at and cringe about. It‚Äôs bad enough having Facebook remind us daily of the very public conversations we used to have with our friends on their Facebook page, and then there‚Äôs the text typing language too ‚Äì you know what we mean: GR8, BRB, Skool, L8R, and lol (still guilty of the last one, we admit!). While we‚Äôre over the clumpy mascara look that was major goals of the early 2000s, and finally, most of our eyebrows have recovered from being plucked to a tiny fine line, there‚Äôs still more than a few practices we‚Äôre not guilty of quitting. Here‚Äôre five you‚Äôre probably still doing, that you really should stop, like ten years ago already! Toothpaste on your pimples Seeing as we all use toothpaste every single day, it‚Äôs readily available, and it doesn‚Äôt cost a bomb, when our BFF told us it would get rid of our pimples, we were more than keen to try it out ‚Äì what a magical solution! Unfortunately, although toothpaste may dry up your pimples, in the long run, it‚Äôs going to do way more damage than just drying up your pimple (see the full story here ). The good thing is, there are lots of spot-zapping treatments that will do the trick way better than toothpaste, and they won‚Äôt cause long-lasting damage to your skin. We love to use tea tree gels and Witch blemish sticks, which you can find variations of in all your local drugstores. Squeezing your spots wrong There‚Äôs a wrong way and a right way to deal with pimples and blackheads, and squeezing as hard as you can with all kinds of tools is definitely not the answer. Your skin is fragile and sensitive, and pushing and pulling on your skin will only do more harm than good. Check out our guide to squeezing pimples and blackheads the right way here . Not washing your makeup brushes We admit, washing our makeup brushes is quite possibly one of the most boring tasks ‚Äì although seeing all the dirt coming off is insanely satisfying! We know it seems perfectly harmless, but unwashed makeup brushes and beauty sponges can harbor all kinds of bacteria, as well as accumulating dead skin cells. This means if you‚Äôre not washing your makeup brushes, you could be causing breakouts and clogged pores (see my guide to washing your brushes here ). We recommend washing your makeup brushes every week and your makeup sponge after every use . If you really can‚Äôt be bothered to wash all your brushes, at least focus on your foundation and concealer brush, or any brush that you use with liquid and cream formulas. A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Aug 19, 2017 at 1:30am PDT Peeling off your gel polish The struggle to not pick away at our gel manicure when it starts to chip and come away from our nail bed is VERY real! But we‚Äôre here‚Äôs why you need to fight the urge to rip off your gel polish and instead remove them properly. When you peel off your gel varnish, it also pulls away the delicate top layers of your nails, which not only results in white patches, which don‚Äôt look pretty, but it significantly weakens the nail. The more often you do this, the more layers of skin are removed, and not to mention the nail beds are buffed every time gel polish is applied. The damage from repeatedly peeling away your gel varnish can take months to heal. If you can‚Äôt make it for a top up, you can easily remove your gel mani at home. How to DIY gel polish removal: Gently file the top layer of the nail varnish away. Cut cotton pads into quarters (you‚Äôll need one quarter for each finger), and cut aluminum foil into ten sheets (roughly 10cm X 10cm). Soak the cotton pad quarters in in an acetone nail varnish remover and one finger at a time, place the quarter onto your nail and wrap it with a sheet of foil as tightly as possible. Leave it on for at least 15 minutes. When you remove the foil, the gel varnish will have dissolved and will have come away from your nail. You can repeat the process if not all of the varnish comes away immediately. Bleaching your mustache If you ever had a stupid boy at your school call you up on your fluffy mustache and you resorted to what seemed like the most obvious solution, bleach, then now is the time to move on. Unfortunately bleaching your mustache may make the dark hairs appear slightly less visible, but in the light of day, your bright white hair will literally glisten in the sunlight. Try threading or waxing, and if you don‚Äôt fancy spending the dollars, we swear by Veet‚Äôs face wax strips, ( $8, here ). Our top tip is to dust a fine layer of talcum powder on your upper lip before you apply the wax strip. This should prevent the wax strip from potentially ripping away any skin. beauty mistakes beauty tips teen mistakes Fri, 22 Dec 2017 4 Comments Related Posts The ONLY Way I Clean My Makeup Brushes Sat, 19 Aug 2017 Will Toothpaste Actually Kill Your Pimples? Just take the peel of a ripe banana (not overripe, you want one that‚Äôs yellow with a few dark spots), and rub it on your blemish for ten minutes or so. You‚Äôll see a big difference in your acne, especially after a few days. Why does this work? A lot of reasons! Bananas have so many anti-inflammatories, like vitamin A, zinc, and manganese. Remember some time back in the 2000s ‚Äì the days of Britney and JT, flared jeans, and thongs peeking out from your super low-waisted jeans ‚Äì yeah, it was an ‚Äòinteresting‚Äô time for fashion and beauty. We imagine right now you‚Äôre having some pretty cringey flashbacks; remember chains dangling from your pockets, Juicy Couture was hot af, and Claire‚Äôs Accessories was the bomb ‚Äì we die! Well, we thought we‚Äôd reminisce some of the most hilarious trends from our millennial teens, you know, that grey area between the end of the 90s and the early 2000s, just for fun‚Ä¶ The Hair It was a time for bright butterfly clips, two tiny little hair tendrils framing your face, crimped sections, and those little twisty pieces of hair carefully pinned to your head by the aforementioned butterfly clips! Of course, all our fav icons wore them; Sabrina The Teenage Witch, Britney, Topanga, and Christina ‚Äì major goals! The Makeup Where do we begin? Chalky white or bright blue eyeshadow was the look du jour, of course carefully topped off with purple mascara and non-tour ‚Äì it‚Äôs hard to believe contouring didn‚Äôt even exist at that point. Then, there was the super glossy lip and the over-plucked brows that we‚Äôre still recovering from to this day. What were we thinking, and can you believe we thought this looked good?! A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Nov 16, 2017 at 7:48am PST The Clothes It‚Äôs kinda funny to see how many of the trends from our teens have actually come back into fashion; who else got a weird sense of d√©j√† vu fondling a new pair of hoop earrings and velvet choker? Fortunately, there are some things which haven‚Äôt come back in: boleros (THE must-have mini cardigan!), disco style halter neck tops, ¬æ length jeans, velour tracksuits (if you were lucky you had a pair from Juicy Couture), and then, of course, there were crop tops (back in again!), and boob tubes. OMG, and remember wearing dresses over jeans, denim minis, and RaRa skirts ‚Äì it‚Äôs too much to handle. We can just be thankful that we didn‚Äôt have phones at that point to document every outfit and makeup look with selfies! The Music We don‚Äôt know about you, but the music from our teens gives us MAJOR vibes, and you cannot imagine how much fun we had compiling these iconic tracks from our teen years! DAILY DOSE | SOFT FEET By Huda Heidi Kattan Nothing beats having super soft feet and if you love wearing heels as much as I do, then you know how difficult this can be at times! SUPER SOFT FEET SOAK : 6 cups hot water 2 cups milk 2-3 drops lavender extract (optional) Mix ingredients together in large bowl and make sure temperature is comfortable for feet. Earlier this week I got an unexpected package from KKW Beauty, and I couldn‚Äôt believe it when I opened it to find completely new products that no one, I repeat no one, had laid eyes on yet! Even Kim hadn‚Äôt teased the products on social, so I was confused, but also hyped because her new collection, Ultralight Beams Highlighters and Glosses, SLAYS. What it is: A collection of five super shimmery, glitter lip glosses, and five loose pigments, each in bronze, gold and silver shades. What it does: The glosses are super thick and add high impact shine to your pout, while the loose pigments can be used anywhere on the face or body. What we liked: I‚Äôll start by saying I‚Äôm not a gloss person, but as far as glosses go, these felt really nice on the lips. I like that the texture is thick, so I feel like the formula will last for a long time, but they‚Äôre also very sheer so I think they would look best on top of a liquid lipstick to give them more dimension. I love, LOVE, love the loose pigments! The colors are soo pretty, and they look amazing on. The formula is a little dry so they would likely move if used alone, but with a little fixing spray to hold them in place, they look stunning packed on the eyelid. I think the white shade (Iridescent) is bomb, and I love mixing the colors to create your own shades ‚Äì I mixed the gold and copper tones, and the combination was divine. What we didn‚Äôt like: The glosses are very glittery, so I worry that they could look a bit kiddish if used by themselves, but they layer gorgeously on top of colors. As soon as we posted about these, we got a lot of comments saying they looked like Stila; I honestly don‚Äôt think they do at all, the packaging is really beautiful with the classic pale pink shade that KKW Beauty is known for, and the glosses have a sleek, soft-touch lid. My tip: For the pigments, take a small, flat concealer brush, and spray a little fixing spray onto it and pat it across your eyelid. Using the same brush, pick up the pigments and press them onto your eyelid. This will give you the best control and insane coverage! Price: Not yet released Available: KKWBeauty.com (December 1 st , 2017) See my immediate reaction to receiving the new KKW Beauty collection here . One of their tips to getting that super amazing smell, which in my opinion is an awesome and easy idea is using scented body oil and mixing it with perfume. I know it sounds elementary, but it works wonders! Mona actually does this all the time, and I swear we get stopped in public places all the time! People always want to know what she‚Äôs wearing! Today Sahar and Mona told me they actually use Vanilla, Coconut or Jasmine scented oil after they get out of the shower. Then add a mist of their favorite perfume for a super unique and delicious scent! Of course mixing it is key, but this is one of the best ways to get your own scents that is not only delicious, but unique to YOU! üôÇ I would recommend mixing some scented oil or essential oil with almond oil to get a super moisturizing boost to your routine! It‚Äôs 2017, and the unicorn‚Äôs been killin‚Äô it since 2016! Soon there won‚Äôt be a brand that doesn‚Äôt have a unicorn beauty product because frankly, we‚Äôre all OBSESSED! There‚Äôs literally nothing that hasn‚Äôt been unicornified: whether you want unicorn essence, (Farsali‚Äôs pink, glittery antioxidant essence, which looks and smells pretty damn magical), unicorn tears, (Too Faced‚Äôs holographic cream lipstick), unicorn horns (makeup brushes by almost everyone), or unicorn lashes (that‚Äôs actually a brand!), you can find it. This goes hand in hand with the unicorn trend; as the platform dominates, brands are having to keep up with striking imagery that will grab you mid scroll‚Ä¶ and unicorn makeup does that! It‚Äôs pretty, it‚Äôs sparkly, it‚Äôs bright, different, and majestic! And it‚Äôs a bit different too: natural glowing skin is all good and fun for the daytime, but for the weekends, who doesn‚Äôt want to strobe their face and let loose with a rainbow highlighter or holographic lip strobe ? So, right about now we‚Äôre guessing the urge to unicornify has overcome you ‚Äì well we‚Äôve got your shimmery back! SkinCeuticals Body Texturizing Treatment ‚Äì This is one of those products people don‚Äôt really think about using, but it‚Äôs incredible. It‚Äôs one of my favorite body products. DAILY DOSE | HAIR By Huda Heidi Kattan It doesn‚Äôt matter what your industry is, we are constantly learning new things! The other day, I was amazed at how many articles I was able to find saying that Aloe Vera is a huge promoter of hair growth. The enzymes in Aloe Vera, when applied to your scalp, lead to hair growth over time! Wanting to test this theory, I tried using a recipe I found, mixing 3 parts Aloe Vera with 1 part honey. I applied it to my scalp and left it for about 25 minutes before washing off. Ok, It definitely felt really nice on my scalp, and I noticed after about a month and half of using this once a week, I did notice a difference in my hair growth, but I was really amazed to see many new baby hairs growing! I was pretty amazed, which is why I recommend this for both men and women!! I also love the way my scalp feels when I sue this mixture! I recommend using less honey, though. I recommend 1/2 cup Aloe Vera gel (pure) with 2 tablespoons honey, that seems to work better. Only apply the mixture to your scalp! I‚Äôm going to continue doing this once a week, I love it so far!! beauty Natural Beauty Tip Wed, 8 Jun 2011 29 Comments Related Posts We‚Äôre Buying An Aloe Vera Plant Right Now! Our #HudaBeauty3DHighlight reveal now on IG Stories üò±üò±üò± what do you guys think?! I want to know!! A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Mar 1, 2017 at 1:21am PST Hey My Loves!! So I cannot believe that I finally get to show & tell you guys about our new Huda Beauty 3D Highlighter ! We have been working on this for almost 18 months, and I must admit ‚Äì I was SUPER anxious to reveal it today on Social Media!! I‚Äôve literally been dying to share this with you guys! Before I jump straight into the palette, I wanted to tell you guys a bit more about the inspiration behind this palette. So we all know that highlighters are super major right now, and I‚Äôve seen loads of stunning ones on the market which I absolutely love! I really wanted to launch a Highlighter Palette, but I promised myself I wouldn‚Äôt launch anything unless it was revolutionary. If we were going to create a highlighter, it had to push boundaries. I wanted to change the highlighter game forever and take things to the next level! Although I love wearing highlighters, I often notice that it magnifies my already large pores. That‚Äôs where the first inspiration came about with the Melted Strobe . It‚Äôs a pearlescent, creamy base enriched with shea butter to create a smooth canvas for makeup application. You guys might remember my coconut oil hack where I apply coconut oil before applying my powder highlight ‚Äì who would‚Äôve known that that hack inspired this formula! I always did this because layering beauty oil with powder highlights made my cheeks pop from miles away. What I love about the Melted Strobe is that it really helps boost the highlight because it amplifies the glow and it‚Äôs great to wear layered, or on its own. Huda Beauty 3D Highlighter: Pink Sands Edition Another goal I had was to make highlighting like a pro within each person‚Äôs grasp using our unique formula & technique (which you‚Äôll see instructed on the palette to help guide you!). The technique is super special because that is what creates dimension on your cheeks and blends your highlight perfectly. Every single color in this palette is so important and although our palette may look like a normal highlighter at first glance, it definitely is not. Incase you didn‚Äôt catch the how-to on my Insta-Story or Snap; here‚Äôs the 4-step technique to create the ultimate 3D cheek glow: 1. Prep: Apply the Melted Strobe as a base to smooth the skin and amplify the light reflecting pearls. 2. Set: Dab the lightest highlight from cheek to temple to set and bring out the pop. 3. Sculpt: Apply the darker shade under cheekbones to add dimension and shape. 4. Flush: Sweep the rosy highlight on the apples of your cheeks for a healthy glow. Huda Beauty 3D Highlighter: Golden Sands Edition I really wanted to create an all-in-one cheek palette for everyone! The Huda Beauty 3D Highlighter comes in two editions ‚Äì the Pink Sands Palette is ideal for fair to medium skin tones, and the Golden Sands Palette we developed for medium to dark skin tones. The name inspo for these palettes also have a special story to it‚Ä¶but I‚Äôll tell you guys that another day. üôÇ Let me know what you guys think of this palette! I‚Äôd loooove to hear your comments! This was such a huge project and I‚Äôm just so happy I was able to share this with you guys. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è Thank you so much for all your love & support, you guys are amazing!!! Oh yes ‚Äì I almost forgot to mention!! The Huda Beauty 3D Highlighter launches mid-April on shophudabeauty.com . I LOVE the cake face, but I like to think it‚Äôs a perfectly iced cake. My brushes, and of course my beauty blender, are my essential tools‚Ä¶ But if there‚Äôs one very important lesson I‚Äôve learned in my many years as an MUA, it‚Äôs that dirty brushes will get you nowhere! Not only can makeup brushes harbor oil, dirt, and bacteria from your face that can lead to breakouts, but the old makeup trapped on your brush won‚Äôt give you the flawless application you could get from clean makeup brushes, particularly with your powders. In an ideal world, makeup brushes should be cleaned after every use, especially foundation brushes, but a more realistic expectation is once a week. You can use an instant brush cleaner in between washing ‚Äì I LOVE the Cinema Secrets Makeup Brush Cleaner , it‚Äôs really easy to use and dissolves all your makeup and purifies the brush. Your makeup sponge really should be cleaned after every use: I usually do it just before I‚Äôm about to use it, that way it‚Äôs clean and damp and ready to be used ‚Äì check out my tips here . It‚Äôs weird, but if you‚Äôre anything like me you‚Äôll actually find the process of cleaning your makeup brushes really relaxing and SO satisfying ‚Äì I love watching as all the makeup washes away and having them all clean and organized. A post shared by Huda Kattan (@hudabeauty) on Aug 19, 2017 at 1:30am PDT It might seem a bit extra, but this is the way I clean and store ALL my makeup brushes ‚Äì I have hundreds ‚Äì it‚Äôs really worth it if you want your makeup brushes to last, especially if you‚Äôve spent a lot of money on them! I use the Sigma Spa Brush Cleaning Mat ‚Äì it‚Äôs ahhhhmazing, and you can just put it straight in your sink ‚Äì and the Sephora Solid Brush Cleaner , which is so convenient. You can also use baby shampoo, or even just a bar of soap. Once the brushes are all shiny and new again, leave them on a clean towel to dry completely. After, I use my brush cleanser to ensure they‚Äôre sanitized, and then I store them with makeup brush guards to protect the bristles and preserve the shape ‚Äì they‚Äôre also brilliant for traveling. Finally, the best advice I can give you is to be gentle. It might seem like vigorously washing your brush will clean it better or by rubbing the bristles on a towel will get it dry quicker, but the rougher you are with your brush, the more damage you‚Äôre doing. Over time this will wreck the brush and the way it distributes your products, so it‚Äôs better to be careful. But where does it stand in the spectrum of eyebrow needs? Here‚Äôs what we thought: What it is: A waxy, tinted brow gel housed in a sleek mini, black compact. What it does: With the help of a brow brush, waxy pigmented gel can easily help fill in sparse areas of the brows. What we loved: True to the Bobbi Brown spirit, this is best for a more natural approach to brows. The combo of pigment and beeswax helps achieve a natural, fuller look. It feels a bit like pomade for brows. We found it‚Äôs best for filling in sparse areas of the brows without looking like overkill. The color range (17 total) are also very close to natural hair colors (we love Saddle for brunettes) and shades for highlights to give hair the look of texture. What we didn‚Äôt like: While great for filling in brows, because of its waxy nature, it‚Äôs not the best for buildable, detailed work (such as defined strokes mimicking the look of natural hairs). A good pick if you‚Äôre looking for a little more volume with a more natural approach to brows. Also note, while it is water-, sweat-, and humidity- resistant, it can still rub off by mistake. PRODUCT REVIEW | MAKEUP By Huda Heidi Kattan This is going to sound pretty bizarre, but I‚Äôm not one of those makeup artist that keep a huge beauty bag in my purse. I actually am COMPLETELY one of those girls who takes a good amount of time doing my makeup (I will take as long as I have! If it‚Äôs 20 minutes to 2 hours!) and expects it to stay alllll day long! Other than my lips, I really don‚Äôt like readjusting my makeup throughout the day, so of course I am constantly looking for makeup that lasts as long as possible! I had a small baby shower on Thursday and I applied my makeup at noon that day, I couldn‚Äôt believe it, but my makeup stayed perfectly (aside from lips) without any retouching till 2 AM. What I was most impressed with was my blush! Ok, here‚Äôs the deal, I have been on a serious search for the best cream blush that (1) had the best blending texture, (2) the best pigment, and (3) lasts all day. I am so happy to say I really believe I have found it! I tested soooo many brands and this one just met all of my requirements! The Makeup Forever HD Creme Blush (I looooove #6) is AhhMAZING! I applied my makeup, contour, highlight, etc, then ever-so-lightly (I mean this) pressed the pump to get a tiny amount on my fingers. I then used my fingers to apply the blush very lightly. I like to follow with a powder blush for extra staying power, I used Illamasqua blusher in Hussy. I couldn‚Äôt believe how perfect my makeup stayed for over 12 hours! Nars‚Äô latest lip collection gives an impressive color payoff and comfortable wear for someone who‚Äôs undecided if they‚Äôre Team Gloss or Team Lipstick. Here‚Äôs what we thought: What it is : A smooth hybrid of a lipstick and a lip gloss, and a gorgeous edited color range. What we liked : The Velvet Lip Glide is aptly named ‚Äì it‚Äôs soft, and glides on saturated color for a semi-matte finish. The consistency is not-tacky like most glosses, but is creamier than most lipsticks (see why we don‚Äôt know what to categorize it as?!). It has a faint vanilla scent, nothing distracting. It feels buttery-soft and plush on our lips that makes it so fun to apply. There‚Äôs a color for every occasion and every mood ‚Äì right now we‚Äôre feeling sassy in their siren red No. 54, but we like Bound‚Äôs muted mauve for every day (it wouldn‚Äôt be Nars if the names weren‚Äôt provocative). (Above, top to bottom: Swatches in Unlaced, No. 54, Playpen, and Bound) What we didn‚Äôt like : You might have to put more than one coat to get an even finish for some of the colors, which is normal for a lot of lip products. It lasts for a few hours (longer than most glosses), but don‚Äôt expect it to stay put when you drink your morning cup of coffee ‚Äì it‚Äôs not supposed to be liquid matte lipstick, after all. Other than that, not much‚Ä¶it‚Äôs found a happy place in our makeup bag. We‚Äôre all busy people, aren‚Äôt we? Naturally, we take the final step in our makeup routine very seriously, especially when we‚Äôre counting on it lasting all day. Urban Decay‚Äôs All Nighter has been a cult favorite to set makeup, but is it worth the hype? What it is: A makeup setting spray. What it does: This setting spray is said to actually lower the temperature of your makeup to keep your makeup looking smooth in humid or cold conditions without settling in lines or caking for at 16 hours. What we liked: It‚Äôs not really a spray as much as it is an even mist. Your skin with be lightly dewy as it sets and then it gives a nice, even sheen to your makeup. And our makeup actually does last a lot longer when we use this. Also one of our favorites to use after a good baking session . What we didn‚Äôt like: Aside from some occasional oil slick on our forehead and T-zone area, not much. The price tag is a little steep but considering it‚Äôs also around how much full size makeup setting sprays run, it‚Äôs worth the investment. Our advice: go light and let it dry first before layering too much, or you might risk running your makeup. Best for dry to combination skin types. There‚Äôs literally nothing I love more than discovering ingredients that will solve all your beauty problems, and it turns out, Apple Cider Vinegar is SO much more than an addition to your salad dressing. Yep, apple cider vinegar is one of nature‚Äôs most potent creations, full of active ingredients, vitamins, mineral salts and amino acids. Its magical properties as an antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, and antifungal, have been used in medicine for thousands of years, and it‚Äôs now a staple skincare supplement in my beauty regime. APPLE CIDER VINEGAR: Banish acne and fade age spots: The malic acid found in apple cider vinegar makes it a potent antibacterial and antifungal substance that kills bacteria and prevents pimples from popping up. It also removes excess oil from your skin, balances your PH levels, and over time works to draw out toxins from your skin for a glowing complexion. It also works wonders on age spots and acne scars, as the alpha hydroxy acids penetrate deep into the skin, removing dead skin cells. Try washing your skin a few times a week with one part apple cider vinegar and one part distilled water, or create a toner with the same solution. For age spots, apply the vinegar directly, rinsing with warm water after 30 minutes ‚Äì repeat every day for results within six weeks. Whiten teeth: Say adios to stains and rub apple cider vinegar directly on your teeth before rinsing with water. Or, try mixing one teaspoon of apple cider vinegar with a cup of water for a homemade mouthwash, which also kills bacteria that cause bad breath. Avoid doing it daily as it can break down tooth enamel. Get glossy hair: Get the Pinterest mane of your dreams and use apple cider vinegar to cleanse your hair. It‚Äôs awesome clarifying properties remove excess buildup from products and seals the hair cuticle. Check out my video on how I use it as a rinse after washing hair. Dry scalp? With natural antifungal properties, it will restore your skin‚Äôs natural PH balance and destroy dandruff by killing fungus and cleaning clogged pores and hair follicles. Try rubbing a solution of equal parts of cider vinegar with water, and a few drops of tea tree oil, onto your scalp for 5 minutes, and let it sit for 15 minutes before rinsing and shampooing as usual. Say bye bye wrinkles: Apple cider vinegar also hydrates skin and will minimize the appearance of fine lines. Make a mask with equal parts of honey and apple cider vinegar and leave it on your skin for up to 20 minutes, then rinse with warm water. Or, soak a cotton pad in diluted apple cider vinegar and dab it on your skin. After ten minutes rinse with warm water and pat dry. Soothe sunburn: When your glow is veering more towards a tomato tint, add two cups of apple cider vinegar to your bath and soak for ten minutes. It will restore your skin‚Äôs PH balance, soothe your skin, and get rid of the burning sensation. Be careful always to dilute apple cider vinegar, as it‚Äôs a strong substance that can irritate or dry sensitive skin, and remember, you need to buy organic, raw, unfiltered Apple Cider Vinegar ‚Äì otherwise all the magical enzymes will be lost during the filtering process. DAILY DOSE | SKINCARE By Huda Heidi Kattan As much as we love our expensive creams and treatments, it‚Äôs always a good idea to mix in a natural remedy to keep skin balanced! Personally, I love natural remedies that include easy to find ingredients and are easy to make. This recipe for natural moisturizer is really awesome. I was really surprised when I used it, but it feels awesome and it helps brighten and even skin tone! AWESOME HOMEMADE MOISTURIZER Ingredients 1/2 lemon 1 tablespoon yogurt 1 teaspoon olive oil Chop lemon and blend in a food processor with peel. Then add yogurt and olive oil and blend some more. Apply to face after cleansing, refrigerate excess, keep for no longer than 2 days (or date of expiration of yogurt, whichever one comes first). beauty natural Skin Care Mon, 12 Sep 2011 3 Comments Related Posts Awesome DIY Mask for Super Soft Skin! PRODUCT REVIEW | MAKEUP By Huda Heidi Kattan Being a makeup artist means I pretty much never leave the house without foundation on! So of course this means I spend a lot of time trying new foundations! One that I recently tried and loved is the new Dolce & Gabbana Creamy Foundation! I love this product for a number of reasons! The thing I love the most is the color choices (I use the foundation in Bronze), typically it‚Äôs hard to find foundations that match olive skin, which is ironic because most people all over the world have olive skin tones. Finally someone gets that in order to match skin, you must add olive tones, Yaaay!! Needless to say, this foundation will match almost anyone‚Äôs skin, whether rich and dark or light and creamy! Another amazing thing I love about this foundation is the coverage is amazing! Although it might seem like it‚Äôs too heavy, it definitely applies and covers extremely well. Personally, I like medium coverage, but this foundation is definitely one that is not cakey, so I would be using if I wanted the extra coverage! If you have had trouble matching your foundation and need extra coverage, this is definitely a foundation you want to try! I would also recommend this foundation for a bride or anyone looking for foundation that you can wear all night and keep the coverage looking flawless and still natural! Now the lipsticks that were also launched with the foundation are UNBELIEVABLE! I love them so much!! They are kind of between lipstick and gloss, but they provide a crazy amount of moisture and the colors are GORG!! I love the fact that after I wore one, my lips literally felt more nourished and plump! I am also in love with the intensity and color selection, but the staying power is ok. The real reason why you MUST try this lipstick is because your lips will thank you! It just feels amazing and it‚Äôs almost like a treatment for your lips that makes them look gorgeous! How Fab!! Available at Paris Gallery Dubai Mall, Paris Gallery Marina Mall Abu Dhabi, Harrods UK, Available at Select Saks US. DAILY DOSE | SKIN By Huda Heidi Kattan Getting rid of body hair is such an annoyance, but it‚Äôs part of being a girl! I typically wax and I have never had issues with ingrown hairs until recently! My sisters were over the other day and pointed out that one of my legs had a few ingrowns‚Äînot becoming at all! One of the reasons why ingrowns form is due to bad exfoliation and poor moisturizing. As much as I preach beauty, being a new mom has left me little time for beauty! So after scrubbing away the ingrowns and using a little extraction, I tried using this little bump relieving mask and it left skin soft and help soothe the area! You can also use this after you wax sensitive areas to prevent irritation or bumps forming later on! It‚Äôs also great to help prevent scarring since it has honey, which is a natural antibiotic! BUMP BE GONE MASK Ingredients 1 1/2 tablespoon honey 1 teaspoon olive oil 1 teaspoon yogurt 5 tablets aspirin (uncoated and crushed) Mix together honey and olive oil in a bowl until blended well (you might want to zuk it in the microwave for 5 seconds). The let cool. Mix in yogurt and aspirin and place over your ingrowns. Let sit for 15 minutes before rinsing. beauty skin Skincare Wed, 5 Oct 2011 9 Comments Related Posts My Absolute FAV Acne Miracle Mask! Only 3 Ingredients! This is by far one of my favorites to date! LUSCIOUS AND DELICIOUS LIP SCRUB! Ingredients 1/2 Teaspoon Olive Oil 1 Teaspoon Honey 3 Teaspoon Sugar Splash of Lemon Mix all ingredients together in a bowl, then massage onto lips. This works best when you actually scoop up the sugar and rub that part. Feel free to apply the juice of the scrub on your lips and let sit for a couple of minutes! Makeup aficionados, the beauty universe just received some very exciting news! Our long-term MUA crush and makeup legend, Val Garland , has been sprinkling her magic along the runways, on magazine covers, and on celebrities for decades, and now she‚Äôs joining L‚ÄôOr√©al Paris as their global makeup director. Excited is an understatement. Val has been responsible for some seriously iconic beauty looks: glitter eyeshadow, flower face painting, Lady Gaga‚Äôs prosthetic Born This Way cheekbone look, and most recently #SnoggedLips. Her penchant for color and her inspirational creativity is second-to-none. She‚Äôs worked on the runways of Preen, Erdem, Alexander McQueen and Mary Katrantzou to name a few, and on countless fashion editorials with photographers like Mario Testino. So if you guys watched the video on my YouTube , then I‚Äôm sure you were just as blown away as I was by world-renowned skin dermatologist Dr. Doris Day . I was extremely honored to have her in our studio (ahem‚Ä¶we might be a little obsessed with how cool she is) and due to all your amazing feedback about the video, we decided to put together the Top 10 Things we learnt from Dr Doris Day. Trust me, your skincare routine will never be the same again!! 1. Adult acne is different from teenage acne. It is usually triggered by an imbalance of hormones and it often starts after your teenage years, sometimes in your mid 20‚Äôs to 30‚Äôs. It appears as cysts and pimples along the jawline, chin and lower face. This kind of acne is difficult to control without careful guidance from your dermatologist and can often lead to scarring. Teen acne is more visible over the entire face. Both adult and teen acne can occur on the back, chest and shoulders. 2. Cleansing your skin is REALLY important! Dr. Doris recommends that you do this daily and suggests that cleansing brushes are a better option than simply using your hands or a washcloth. 3. Your skin has its own personal bouncer or immune cells to protect it and is constantly regenerating itself to protect you from infection and aging. New skin cells take about 7 days to grow and fully regenerate or turn over every 30 days or so. If this process doesn‚Äôt work properly due to acne or dry or sun damaged skin, your skin will look dull, uneven in tone and ultimately wrinkled over time. 4. The sun makes your oil glands over-grow which makes your pores bigger and can ultimately make acne worse. YIKES! 5. Botox and Fillers are excellent tools to help you look your best and stay looking beautiful as you age, however it‚Äôs important to see an aesthetic physician who will make sure you look like the best version of yourself without looking unnatural. Botox is a very safe and reliable treatment for rejuvenation when used properly and in the right areas. In order to look as natural as possible, do not try to eliminate all your lines and wrinkles in your face. The goal is to re-train muscles so you can move and always look beautiful. 6. Don‚Äôt try new skin care products or treatments right before an important event. Stick to what you are used to and what you know works well for your skin. Keep your skin fresh: exfoliate, moisturize, apply a mask, drink water, listen to calm music, think positive thoughts and rest well. Changing your skincare routine can risk you getting a breakout or irritation especially when you have the stress of an upcoming event. 7. Eat all your meals within a 12 hour window, for example 9am-9pm. This will help balance your circadian rhythm which controls genes that affect metabolism and will help you lose weight. 8. It‚Äôs okay to use a moisturizer or foundation which has SPF as your sunscreen, however the key is to use enough and to reapply it every two hours if you‚Äôre outdoors. If you don‚Äôt want to keep reapplying over makeup, look for a powder SPF for the re-application during the day. 9. Your skin repairs while you sleep and it also loses more water at night than during the day so the best thing you can do for your skin at night is to apply a good layer of moisturizer and antioxidants, and gently pat or massage it into your skin, always applying pressure upwards your head. 10. Both UVB and UVA rays can damage your skin and UVA rays can even penetrate through window glass (even tinted ones!), unless they are specifically UV protected, and are a contributing factor towards skin sagging and aging. DAILY DOSE | HAIRY TALES By Huda Heidi Kattan We all know this already, but our hair is dead. There is no way to revive it, it‚Äôs completely made up of dead cells, which means, once it‚Äôs damaged, it‚Äôs VERY hard to make it look great again without cutting it! While being in the states, my hair has been sooooo dry! I actually bought a few hair masks, which honestly cost me a fortune and did next to nothing for my hair except make it look super oily and flat‚Äîyippee! Of course, I had to stop at the grocers and pick up some produce for my own little cocktail! I actually loved this and it made my hair really soft! SUPER MOISTURE PACK HAIR MASK! Ingredients 1/2 Avocado, pitted 2 Tablespoons Coconut Oil 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Melt the Coconut Oil in a bowl (just zuk it in the microwave for a few seconds until it is completely soft/liquid). Mix in the Olive Oil. Mash the Avocado completely until no lumps are present (you can use a food processor, but make sure only to pump it). Add mixture to clean hair and wrap with a plastic bag or shower cap. Let sit for 30 minutes before washing hair as usual. avocado Coconut oil hair Human hair growth Olive oil Mon, 2 Jan 2012 16 Comments Related Posts 3 Super Easy DIY Hair Rescue Masks Mon, 13 Nov 2017 Adriana Lima Gave Me Her Secret To Shiny Hair‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ Wed, 17 May 2017 Product Review: Hair Rehab with Ouai Hair Masques Tue, 1 Nov 2016 Maliha We donot get avocado in pakistan.. PRODUCT REVIEW | SKIN By Huda Heidi Kattan It‚Äôs no secret that I love Olay, if you walk into my beauty room, you would find a plethora of skincare products and Olay is one I must always keep in stock! The first time I tried Olay, I really wasn‚Äôt expecting anything spectacular, partly because I had tried everything under the moon and it became kind of my own mantra that for great skin, you should spare no expense! Needless to say I have spent unthinkable amounts on skincare through the years and I just didn‚Äôt really think a drugstore brand like Olay would give me the same results that my high-end face creams would‚Äìthat is, until I tried it! Now it‚Äôs shocking to me how I missed so many important points that come from brands that have been around for years working with some killer R&D to bring great products to you at an affordable price (hence, the reason why I HAD to create a ‚ÄúDrugstore Product of the Week‚Äù). Sooo, when I read that Olay was one of the Reader‚Äôs Choice Awards for Allure magazine, which to me is kind of the beauty bible, I had to try their Total Effects since it had won so many awards! I recently started using it (probably for a little over a week now) and so far my skin loves it! I am using the Total Effects Day and Night Creams and the firming action is AWESOME from the Night Cream, that I actually use it on my neck as well! The Day cream is phenomenal at providing moisture to dry skin, it just makes you feel hydrated! I have a confession, and my hubby will never admit to this, but this weekend we actually went on a little getaway to Ras Al Khaimah. It was amazing, but as much as I had poured on the SPF 100, I got a slight tan and my hubby almost burnt! He is sooo against using face creams, but he had to use something since his skin was so dry! He actually loved the Total Effects Day Cream and it completely healed his skin and kept it from peeling at all, which was awesome! I definitely recommend this cream! Our office has no shortage of Lush fans, so there wasn‚Äôt much convincing that needed to be done when they put together perhaps one of the best-smelling parties we‚Äôve ever had in the office. What we realized is pretty much every one of your favorite beauty treatments ‚Äì from toners to toothpaste ‚Äì can be found as a solid. Here are some of our faves: 1) Damaged Hot Oil Treatment Ever tried hot chocolate on a stick? You know, where you melt the chocolate by stirring it in a cup of hot milk? This inspired the cutest hot oil hair treatment from Lush. Their vegan Damaged treatment is a solid block of nourishing virgin olive oil, almond oil, and avocado oil (all superstars for shiny, strong hair) on a stick that you melt by stirring in a cup of hot water. After it cools, apply and leave on dry hair for 20 minutes then shampoo out (might take more than one go to get all the oil out). The result is hydrated locks with a beautiful vanilla scent we can‚Äôt get enough of. Tip we learned: If you find you don‚Äôt need the whole mixture for one use, cover it and keep it in the fridge until you‚Äôre ready to melt it down again for another use. 2) Honey I Washed My Hair Shampoo Bar We get it if a solid shampoo seems scary‚Ä¶it‚Äôs unchartered territory for most. But trust us, this is not to be underestimated. The self-preserving bar packs a punch of at least 80 washes which is the equivalent of three bottles of shampoo ‚Äì all in a tiny little bar. Just wet the bar and rub between hands to lather, and add to damp hair. It will sud up beautifully and clean your hair thoroughly. The honey will leave hair ridiculously soft. Extra points for easing your travel woes. No more throwing out oversized bottles of liquid at security. 3) Tea Tree and Dream Steam Toner Tabs For a legit blackhead buster, try one of these toner tabs. Just drop it in bowl of hot water like an alka seltzer and it will fizz up, dissipating in the steam. Hang over it with a towel over your head for a skin clearing (thank you, tea tree oil) and calming (lavender) blend of toning goodness. It‚Äôs like bringing the spa home. A cool tip we learned: put the water in a plastic spray bottle after use to store in the fridge for up to two days. You can use it to spritz on your face for a little pick-me-up. 4) Full of Grace Serum Bar A power moisturizer full of vitamins and skin calming chamomile blue oil and calamine powder, this little bar (that can be easily mistaken for soap) is actually a serum that feels like butter on the skin. Gently glide it over your face for a soft layer of serum that you can massage into skin. With ingredients like almond oil, murumuru and cupuaco butter, it‚Äôs amazing for dry skin, especially during the colder months. 5) Miles of Smiles Toothy Tabs Yup, even your toothpaste can come in a tablet. A cool, different take on cleaning your teeth, just bite into one of these to crumble them in your mouth (don‚Äôt eat it!) and promptly start brushing the mix of baking soda and mint oils to freshen breath and clean your pearly whites so they stay that way. You‚Äôll be amazed at how much it foams up with just a little water! Fair warning, this doesn‚Äôt taste amazing, unless you‚Äôre into that baking soda taste. SUPER HAIR GROWTH Ingredients 1/2 Cup Olive Oil 1 Teaspoon Cayenne Pepper 1 Teaspoon Mustard Seed (powder or crushed) Mix all ingredients together than massage on your scalp for 20 minutes, starting from the front of your head the back. The massage will also help the oil penetrate and improve circulation. If you are worried about sensitivity, test your skin first, around your neck for 30 minutes before application! Once finished, shampoo and condition as usual. in beauty , product review 5 Crazy Cool Products We Discovered at a Lush Party by HB Team Wed, 12 Oct 2016 Leave a comment Our office has no shortage of Lush fans, so there wasn‚Äôt much convincing that needed to be done when they put together perhaps one of the best-smelling parties we‚Äôve ever had in the office. What we realized is pretty much every one of your favorite beauty treatments ‚Äì from toners to toothpaste ‚Äì can be found as a solid. Here are some of our faves: 1) Damaged Hot Oil Treatment Ever tried hot chocolate on a stick? You know, where you melt the chocolate by stirring it in a cup of hot milk? This inspired the cutest hot oil hair treatment from Lush. Their vegan Damaged treatment is a solid block of nourishing virgin olive oil, almond oil, and avocado oil (all superstars for shiny, strong hair) on a stick that you melt by stirring in a cup of hot water. After it cools, apply and leave on dry hair for 20 minutes then shampoo out (might take more than one go to get all the oil out). The result is hydrated locks with a beautiful vanilla scent we can‚Äôt get enough of. Tip we learned: If you find you don‚Äôt need the whole mixture for one use, cover it and keep it in the fridge until you‚Äôre ready to melt it down again for another use. 2) Honey I Washed My Hair Shampoo Bar We get it if a solid shampoo seems scary‚Ä¶it‚Äôs unchartered territory for most. But trust us, this is not to be underestimated. The self-preserving bar packs a punch of at least 80 washes which is the equivalent of three bottles of shampoo ‚Äì all in a tiny little bar. Just wet the bar and rub between hands to lather, and add to damp hair. It will sud up beautifully and clean your hair thoroughly. The honey will leave hair ridiculously soft. Extra points for easing your travel woes. No more throwing out oversized bottles of liquid at security. 3) Tea Tree and Dream Steam Toner Tabs For a legit blackhead buster, try one of these toner tabs. Just drop it in bowl of hot water like an alka seltzer and it will fizz up, dissipating in the steam. Hang over it with a towel over your head for a skin clearing (thank you, tea tree oil) and calming (lavender) blend of toning goodness. It‚Äôs like bringing the spa home. A cool tip we learned: put the water in a plastic spray bottle after use to store in the fridge for up to two days. You can use it to spritz on your face for a little pick-me-up. 4) Full of Grace Serum Bar A power moisturizer full of vitamins and skin calming chamomile blue oil and calamine powder, this little bar (that can be easily mistaken for soap) is actually a serum that feels like butter on the skin. Gently glide it over your face for a soft layer of serum that you can massage into skin. With ingredients like almond oil, murumuru and cupuaco butter, it‚Äôs amazing for dry skin, especially during the colder months. 5) Miles of Smiles Toothy Tabs Yup, even your toothpaste can come in a tablet. A cool, different take on cleaning your teeth, just bite into one of these to crumble them in your mouth (don‚Äôt eat it!) and promptly start brushing the mix of baking soda and mint oils to freshen breath and clean your pearly whites so they stay that way. You‚Äôll be amazed at how much it foams up with just a little water! Fair warning, this doesn‚Äôt taste amazing, unless you‚Äôre into that baking soda taste. But we did find it does a heavy duty job on cleaning teeth. Plus, it‚Äôs always nice to definitively see when you‚Äôre down to your last tablet, rather than squeezing a toothpaste tube for dear life and hoping for one more drop. What are some of your favorite Lush products?

Whether your hair is short, long, curly, or straight, we all want hair that glows like Gisele B√ºndchen‚Äôs, bounces like Gigi Hadid‚Äôs, and makes headlines like Solange Knowles‚Äô. We want it so bad that we‚Äôre prepared to spend A LOT on any product that promises to nurture our hair into red-carpet readiness. Shampoos, conditioners, serums, leave in sprays, there are thousands of products promising bigger, better, stronger locks. But what if we told you there was a way of achieving all that and more without you having to spend your dedicated Sephora money on your hair. We‚Äôve pulled together our favorite DIY hair masks to make the most of all that nature has to offer. Whether you‚Äôre looking to revitalize your sun-damaged hair, rid yourself of dandruff, or give it shine that glows brighter than your latest highlighter, we‚Äôve got a DIY remedy for it. Repair DIY mask for dry and damaged hair Practically everything is working against you having instagrammable hair 24/7, from products and straighteners to shower water, UV rays, dyes, and pollution. For most of us, this results in dry, brittle hair. Fortunately, it‚Äôs also one of the easiest problems to treat. This coconut oil mask adds much-needed moisture and nutrients to your hair, as coconut oil‚Äôs high levels of MCFAs (medium chain fatty acids) and lauric acid supports the hormone and cellular health of your hair. If you‚Äôre someone who is a product-fiend or serial hair straightener/curler, even if the damage has seemingly not taken root (pun intended) use this mask at least once a week. Ingredients: 2 tbsps of coconut oil 2 tbsps of argan oil (supplement with olive oil or canola if argan isn‚Äôt available) 1 egg 2-3 drops of peppermint essential oil, or lavender oil Combine the ingredients and whisk together until well-blended. Apply the mask evenly over damp hair (think towel-dried consistency), paying particular attention to the ends of your hair. If you suffer from dandruff or a dry scalp, work the mix into the roots, too. Clip your hair up, so you don‚Äôt get oil everywhere, and cover with a shower cap. Let the mask sit for 30 minutes before rinsing with your daily shampoo and conditioner. If you have long or thick hair, you can double the recipe. Clarifying DIY mask for oily roots There is NOTHING more annoying than oily hair! Oily hair could be caused by anything from overuse of products, using too many protein-based shampoos and conditioners, and fluctuations in hormones. If your oily hair has more grease than gleam, this lemon-based mask is essential; it‚Äôs filled with vitamin C and A, essential for bright and healthy hair. Because the mask is acidic, it breaks down sebum in oily hair and removes excess oil from your scalp. Salt, while helping scrub and remove impurities, will also separate oil from your follicles by absorbing it. Using coconut oil on oily hair might seem weird, but we don‚Äôt want to remove all oil; just the unnecessary stuff that‚Äôs weighing your hair down. Ingredients: 1/3 cup of lemon juice (or lime) 1 tablespoon of sea salt (use crystals instead of refined table salt) 1 teaspoon of coconut oil Mix all the ingredients into a part scrub, part liquid shampoo mixture. Rather than working it into the bottoms of your hair, focus on working this formula all over your scalp. Leave on for 5 to 10 minutes before rinsing with warm water and shampoo ‚Äì just don‚Äôt condition it. Growth boosting DIY mask for longer locks Long healthy hair might seem like an impossible goal, but we promise it is. This mask uses canola oil, which is deemed to be a perfect choice for hair related issues like hair loss and chronic dryness. Like coconut oil, the presence of unsaturated fatty acids helps sooth frazzled follicles and locks them together to prevent moisture loss. Canola oil is also rich in vitamin E, an antioxidant that helps repair and build tissue, as well as sterol, which helps damaged cells recover. Canola oil puts your hair in a good enough state that it focuses less on regeneration and repair, and more on growth. Both Jojoba oil and rosemary oil are capable of stimulating hair growth by improving blood circulation and moisturizing any dry or damaged hair follicles. This mask not only leaves your hair super soft but it will keep your scalp in the best condition for optimized hair growth. Ingredients: 2 tablespoons of canola oil 2 tablespoons of jojoba oil (grab some hazelnut or grapeseed if you don‚Äôt have jojoba oil) 1 egg 2-3 drops of rosemary oil (lemongrass is a great substitute) Whisk the ingredients together and apply it to damp hair. Leave on for 20 minutes and repeat once a week. Rinse with warm water before using your shampoo and conditioner. These hair masks will make a huge difference to your locks, but also check out five things you should never do to your hair , to keep it in gorgeous condition. Hang over it with a towel over your head for a skin clearing (thank you, tea tree oil) and calming (lavender) blend of toning goodness. It‚Äôs like bringing the spa home. A cool tip we learned: put the water in a plastic spray bottle after use to store in the fridge for up to two days. You can use it to spritz on your face for a little pick-me-up. 4) Full of Grace Serum Bar A power moisturizer full of vitamins and skin calming chamomile blue oil and calamine powder, this little bar (that can be easily mistaken for soap) is actually a serum that feels like butter on the skin. Gently glide it over your face for a soft layer of serum that you can massage into skin. With ingredients like almond oil, murumuru and cupuaco butter, it‚Äôs amazing for dry skin, especially during the colder months. 5) Miles of Smiles Toothy Tabs Yup, even your toothpaste can come in a tablet. A cool, different take on cleaning your teeth, just bite into one of these to crumble them in your mouth (don‚Äôt eat it!) and promptly start brushing the mix of baking soda and mint oils to freshen breath and clean your pearly whites so they stay that way. You‚Äôll be amazed at how much it foams up with just a little water! Fair warning, this doesn‚Äôt taste amazing, unless you‚Äôre into that baking soda taste. But we did find it does a heavy duty job on cleaning teeth. Plus, it‚Äôs always nice to definitively see when you‚Äôre down to your last tablet, rather than squeezing a toothpaste tube for dear life and hoping for one more drop. DAILY DOSE | QUICK TIP By Huda Heidi Kattan A while ago, I posted the benefit of using head massage to help hair growth and boy did I get a lot of responses!! Many women (and some guys) said that they used head massage for hair growth and it really worked! However, one very interesting member told me that she has her own way of getting the most out of her massage. Instead of just doing a regular head massage, she massages her head upside down. Sound crazy? It‚Äôs brilliant! It actually helps with the blood flow when your head is upside down while the massage makes sure that all of your hair follicles get the right amount of attention. I have been addicted to this new method and I‚Äôve been doing it every day! I simply stand up, then bend all the way over as if I were reaching my toes to stretch my hamstrings. I massage my head for a couple of minutes, and believe me, you can feel the blood flow! There are a few alternatives available on the market so definitely check them out (like Liquid Biotin and Keratin). What I did: o Make sure you have clean hands o It says you take a whole ampoule, twice a day (I just use a third of that, still twice a day though) o Apply and massage the product into your roots and scalp. Every morning and at night. Actually, just by massaging your head you‚Äôll stimulate hair growth. As your blood flows, you improve circulation and that improves hair growth. I know it sounds weird, but massaging your scalp is very VERY effective!! I have a double-whammy trick to help my hair fall stop and make it look thicker: I use a mix of K√©rastase Densifique Minoxidil solution (which helps to add density to hair) and a dark eyeshadow shade (here I used Too Faced‚Äôs Natural Matte Palette) to cover up any exposed scalp areas. I would also recommend eating walnuts as snacks (maybe twice a week) because they are full of B-vitamins which is great for hair and nails. DAILY DOSE | NATURAL REMEDY By Huda Heidi Kattan Almost every time I do makeup for a client, one thing I always give extra attention to is the lip area. Our lips don‚Äôt have any oil glands, and therefore have no way of replenishing themselves. That means it‚Äôs up to us to make sure these babies get all the moisture they need! It‚Äôs important to always carry a chap stick in your purse and to apply as needed. And remember, it doesn‚Äôt matter how expensive your lip product is, it‚Äôs the constant care that will make a difference and keep your lips from looking rough, and nothing is hot about peeling skin! Try this at-home lip scrub which will help fight dry lips. Lip Scrub: Ingredients: 1/4 cup sugar 3-5 drops peppermint oil 1 tablespoon honey 1 tablespoon olive oil In a bowl, mix together sugar, peppermint oil, honey and olive oil. Add water sparingly. You want to create a thick paste. Mix thoroughly. Take a warm wash cloth and hold over lips for 5 minutes. This will cause the dead skin to soften up. With your hand, take a small portion of the scrub and gently rub on lips in a circular motion. Do this for 1 minute. With the warm washcloth, wipe off scrub.Finish off by using your favorite lip moisturizer. image courtesy of arxbeauty artist at chap chapped cloth dry home honey lip Makeup natural oil olive peel peppermint remedy scrub service sugar wash water Sun, 23 May 2010 5 Comments Related Posts DIY Face Scrub for Glowing Skin! DAILY DOSE | HAIR By Huda Heidi Kattan To a woman, nothing can be worse than hair breakage, yet so many women are doing the exact opposite to stop hair breakage! Believe it or not, most of my favorite tips are super simple tips that require just a simple change in routine, but dramatically improve results! I have already confessed my love for how I get super voluminous blowouts , but I have received so many questions about breaking splitting hair that I felt compelled to share another easy but important trick for avoiding hair breakage! When our hair is wet, it is at it‚Äôs most fragile state. It breaks easily, can fall out more easily and quite frankly, our strands need a little TLC in the shower! The best way to care for your hair is before you get in the shower! Make sure you brush your hair completely so that you are 100% knot free! Try not to brush your hair at all the shower! I seriously couldn‚Äôt believe the difference in my hair when I started doing this. I noticed so much less fell out and I can imagine the difference it made on the quality of my hair! Super simple, yet soooo necessary! PRODUCT REVIEW | MAKEUP By Huda Heidi Kattan Call me ridiculous, but one of the things I do quite A LOT is run around department stores and drugstores looking for the best of whatever product I‚Äôm craving at the moment‚Äìthe other day that product just happen to be mascara! I wasn‚Äôt looking for the most dramatic mascara, most lengthening, most voluminous, no! I was looking for the absolute darkest mascara known to man, and I do believe I have found it! There is nothing I love more than bold dark liner and mascara‚Äìit just makes everything seem so dramatic and beautiful! I love the way it looks from far away and up close! I literally tried every mascara I owned, which is an entire drawer labeled ‚Äúmascara‚Äù, filled with about 20+ mascaras I use at any given time (would be more if I didn‚Äôt throw them out so often, I hate expired makeup) and then went to Sephora to compare some more! The darkest mascara I found? I was pleasantry surprised with the L‚ÄôOreal Voluminous in Carbon Black. It beat all of my other mascara‚Äôs no matter what their price range or promise(came close to Smashbox Lash DNA)! I actually have this mascara in waterproof as well, and it‚Äôs definitely my fav! I don‚Äôt usually like waterproof makeup, but this mascara comes off quite easily, yet there is no flaking, or smudging, so I might just covert to waterproof for the time being. I will say, this is my favorite mascara to finish a look off. It doesn‚Äôt necessary provide volume the way the name might suggest. It‚Äôs much better used last to add some drama to the entire look and also seal everything in (since it‚Äôs waterproof). When I wear false lashes, this is the only mascara I use. However, on an everyday basis, I would start by using another mascara (right now I am using Giorgio Armani‚Äôs Eyes to Kill Excess, it gives you super feathery, yet dramatic lashes) then topping off the look with this! It adds the drama and depth your normal mascara might be lacking! I love it so much, I just bought three more today! image credits beautythesis beauty drugstore Makeup product Mon, 16 May 2011 7 Comments Related Posts This Drugstore Mascara Just Became My Go-To Mon, 4 Sep 2017 Extra Long Lashes With Cotton And Mascara?! We haven‚Äôt made our affections for makeup artist Hrush a secret. But there‚Äôs good reason for it ‚Äì girl knows beauty. Understandably, when she partnered up with Tarte to come out with her own mini-palette, it sold out quicker than you can say Styled by Hrush. Good news is, you can still purchase it at Ulta.com. Here‚Äôs what we thought about her limited-edition palette: What it is : A palette co-created with celebrity makeup artist Hrush Achemyan containing three shimmery shades (including a limited-edition white gold one), three matte shadows, and one peachy-pink blush. What we liked : We loved the pigmented colors that you can use matte for a sophisticated day time look, or blend with the lusters to amp it up as a liner or shadows for an evening look. The colors are a universally-flattering combo for all-over, crease, and highlight shades. We love to use the peachy ‚ÄúPinch‚Äù for everyday, the brown ‚ÄúKitty‚Äù for our crease, and the decadent ‚ÄúRoyal‚Äù purple as a hint of liner. The shimmery ‚ÄúBliss‚Äù and ‚ÄúSmitten‚Äù add a nice pop of bling that‚Äôs so very Hrush. Not to mention, a peachy-pink blusher that gives us the prettiest flush to our cheeks. It has personality, with still very wearable colors. The size is perfect to throw in your purse ‚Äî the sleek faux-crocodile leather embossed cover even makes it look like a mini-wallet. What we didn‚Äôt like : What‚Äôs not to like? I love teasing with a tooth brush, it‚Äôs my favorite thing to use! Check out the difference in these photos when I have no teasing vs mega teasing! Use Volumizers! Volumizers are Awwwwwsome!! I love them! I love blow drying my hair, then using a volumizer all over! DAILY DOSE | FAN QUESTION By Huda Heidi Kattan Hello Huda, I want to let you know how much your blog has helped my beauty knowledge and I really thank you for you sharing your knowledge! Huda I feel I have a problem and I hope you can aid me with a way to get rid of the issue I have with my blackheads. My pores are very big and I feel so unsure about them‚Ä¶I hate the way I look in the photo because of them and I really need your help! I want to know if I can do extraction myself? I love you Huda and I am huge fan of yours, so I hope you can help me !! Hi sweetheart!!! Awww babe, you are sooo undeniably adorable! üôÇ OMG! Pores!! Ugh! The thought of them makes my stomach turn! I typically take extra good care of my pores, but when I don‚Äôt‚Äîahhhh, the BLOW up! I don‚Äôt recommend doing at home extraction, simply for the reason that it is very easy to damage our skin and you could cause some of your veins to become very obvious if you put enough strain on your capillaries. One of the things I love to when is a clay mask! Clay is sooo awesome for pulling out any impurities and it almost works like a magnet, scratch that, it completely works like a magnet and pulls out all of the yucky sebum and dirt in our pores to reveal beautiful skin! There are some awesome ready to use clay masks out there if you don‚Äôt want to do it at home! If you don‚Äôt like the idea of putting clay on your face (although, I highly recommend it), you can always try very natural remedies such as using lemon juice. Try using a cotton bud to saturate your face with fresh squeezed lemon juice. Let the juice sit over night and wash off in the morning. The acidity levels in the lemon juice help loosen up the dirt and will help remove the blackheads over a few nights. I hope these tips helped!!! in product review On the Go: Tarte x Styled by Hrush Palette by HB Team Sun, 30 Oct 2016 Leave a comment We haven‚Äôt made our affections for makeup artist Hrush a secret. But there‚Äôs good reason for it ‚Äì girl knows beauty. Understandably, when she partnered up with Tarte to come out with her own mini-palette, it sold out quicker than you can say Styled by Hrush. Good news is, you can still purchase it at Ulta.com. Here‚Äôs what we thought about her limited-edition palette: What it is : A palette co-created with celebrity makeup artist Hrush Achemyan containing three shimmery shades (including a limited-edition white gold one), three matte shadows, and one peachy-pink blush. What we liked : We loved the pigmented colors that you can use matte for a sophisticated day time look, or blend with the lusters to amp it up as a liner or shadows for an evening look. The colors are a universally-flattering combo for all-over, crease, and highlight shades. We love to use the peachy ‚ÄúPinch‚Äù for everyday, the brown ‚ÄúKitty‚Äù for our crease, and the decadent ‚ÄúRoyal‚Äù purple as a hint of liner. The shimmery ‚ÄúBliss‚Äù and ‚ÄúSmitten‚Äù add a nice pop of bling that‚Äôs so very Hrush. Not to mention, a peachy-pink blusher that gives us the prettiest flush to our cheeks. It has personality, with still very wearable colors. The size is perfect to throw in your purse ‚Äî the sleek faux-crocodile leather embossed cover even makes it look like a mini-wallet. What we didn‚Äôt like : What‚Äôs not to like? Price : $30 Availability : ulta.com (Get it while you can!)

Price : $30 Availability : ulta.com (Get it while you can!) in celebrity Hrush Achemyan of @styledbyhrush Talks Brows and How to Slay by HB Team Thu, 15 Sep 2016 Leave a comment A photo posted by Hrush Achemyan (@styledbyhrush) on Sep 9, 2016 at 3:40am PDT You might recognize her on IG as @styledbyhrush , a regular at red carpet events, or maybe even Kim Kardashian West‚Äôs glam guru/jet skiing buddy. Whichever way you may have come across her, one thing we can all agree on is Hrush Achemyan gives good brow. Which is why we‚Äôre not at all surprised when Make Up For Ever chose to collaborate with the makeup artist for their latest brow collection. While in Dubai to celebrate the launch, we caught up with Hrush about some of her makeup tips and the surprising things you might find in her purse. Read on! Why was it so important for you to collaborate with a brand like Make Up For Ever? It‚Äôs exciting! I was extremely honored that a brand which, when I started off as a makeup artist would have died to have the whole collection, actually asked me to collaborate with them on something I‚Äôm obsessed with. I have such bushy brows myself and I used to be made fun of for them for so long, and now it‚Äôs the it-trend. It‚Äôs like, look at me now! I‚Äôm just so obsessed with eyebrows. It was really a no-brainer for me to get on board. What are your tips for making brows look fuller? A new product that Make Up For Ever launched is the Brow Liquid Liner. You can fake extra hair if you use it properly. It adds the look of texture. The Aqua Brow for me though is what really attracted me to brand in the first place. I like to use it to lighten my eyebrows because they‚Äôre so aggressive looking. It‚Äôs actually what got me on to first using brow products. Who in your opinion has the nicest brows right now? Cara Delevingne! If we look in your purse right now, what are three things we‚Äôd find? You‚Äôre going to find a mini Sriracha bottle on a keychain‚Ä¶I‚Äôm not joking! You‚Äôll probably find Chapstick, and I always carry a brush for my brows because if someone touches or rubs my face, one eyebrow goes down, so I have to brush it up again. Being based in LA and visiting the Middle East, what do you think is the biggest difference between beauty in both places? The Middle East loves black and I love that a woman feels so confident with her face. Girls in the U.S. like to glam, don‚Äôt get me wrong, even if they‚Äôre a little more low-key about it. I just believe wherever you are in the world whether from the U.S. or Middle East, with anything you wear if you wear it with confidence, you‚Äôre going to slay.

DAILY DOSE | SKIN CARE By Huda Heidi Kattan Ok, so while I was in Paris, I actually spent a lot of time with some gorgeous Parisians! Of course being beauty bloggers, many of them had their own natural remedies! I was so shocked to find out that a few of them contributed their perfect skin to two things, Green Tea and Rose Water! I recently posted about how amazing Green Tea is and I have personally seen amazing improvements in my skin when I drink regularly, but Rose Water is something I am definitely getting more into! I actually love this recipe for a natural DIY Rose Water Spray! It‚Äôs super easy and you can use it as needed! This is great for stabilizing skin, especially oily skin! It also helps keep your skin flawless and if you have any blemishes or open wounds (including from acne or sunburn) this is awesome to help cool and heal! ROSE WATER BEAUTY Ingredients Handful of rose petals (I used dried rose buds, which worked beautifully) 2 cups spring water, boiling In a bowl, place the roses and pour water on top. Cover with a plate and let sit for a few hours. Using a strainer, drain water into a spray bottle and keep with you.
